title: It’s really really adorable in my hair however…
text:
[[VIDEOID:f7a496b8573ef75cce856e43697157ad]] What I do like:
1. The color is vibrant.
2. It’s very cute and does give the oversized look when wearing it.

What I don’t like and why I didn’t give 5 stars:
1. It gets “runs” easily. You can see from my picture there’s several “runs” like would happen to a set of tights. When you’re wearing it however they’re not obvious at all.
2. This might be a no brainer because of the size but this is not really a wrist scrunchie, it’s so large wrist wear isn’t practical. You’ll need to either commit to wearing this all day or have some bag or purse to keep it in, this is slightly less practical for daily use then I personally like.
3. It’s not tight enough to be used alone, you’ll need to first use a regular hair tie and then add this for decoration, I prefer scrunchies alone because hair ties hurt after a while but this scrunchie is too slick to stay by itself and would need to be folded over several times eliminating that cute chunky oversized look that this is supposed to give.

Although I’m a little let down by the practical use potential of the product, I do like this and will definitely continue to use it for special occasions just not daily wear.

title: Beautiful colors, might not work with all base coats.
text:
[[VIDEOID:19bb6cb5b35b75de6cd429e3da29e779]] These gel polishes are gorgeous colors! I found things I liked and disliked about them.

What I liked:
1. The kit comes in a pack of 10 and the color variety is good. This is a lot of polishes for the price.
2. The colors look the same wet and dry *see video* as well as on the bottle swatch.
3. They have lasted very well for me and I work with my hands a lot as well as play guitar often with no pick. This will chip your nails quickly, but this hasn't happened yet.

What I disliked:
1. This kit does not come with a base or top coat.
2. I already have a few base and top coats hanging around the house and the first attempt I made using this polish I used a base and top coat that was not comparable. It would not dry even when under the UV light for quite some time. The second attempt I switched my base and top coat to another brand and it worked. They should really just include the base and top coats if this is a potential for customers. Just keep this in mind if you find the polish isn't drying the first attempt.

Given the pros and cons as long as you can find a compatible base and top coat you'll really like this product, if you want to avoid the frustration I'd suggest finding a kit that includes the base and top coats already.

title: Beautiful but not for me
text:
This is a beautiful shade and has a very soft luxurious creamy feel to it.

I have small lips with a very thin upper lip and most lipstick looks horrible on me so I stick with balms and occasionally glosses.
I had hoped this gloss would look nice on me but the color didn't look good on me at all :(

It's beautiful and I think would compliment very dark or very fair skin beautifully but for the fair to mid toned skin it just looks odd in Mt opinion.

title: The stencils are meh but the brown cream is great
text:
I ordered this more for the brow filler than the stencils. I actually have a few sets of these stencils and they're very hard to use properly. If you are heavy handed at all then your brows will end up much wider than you're wanting and if you use a light touch to apply the makeup it's difficult to keep the stencil in the same place long enough to finish them.
Overall the stencils are a great guideline if you have some patience but that's about it.

The brow cream itself was great quality though! I really couldn't tell much of a difference between it and my much more costly name brand cream brow filler. The brush that was included isn't nearly as fine and high quality but I have my own so that wasn't an issue and the makeup alone was well worth the cost of this whole kit.

A great value for the makeup alone, the rest of the stuff I just view as extras and if they happen to work well for you then that's a fabulous bonus!

title: A lot of great products for a low cost
text:
This is the second eyebrow stamp kit I've ordered and I Definitely like this one better.

It takes a little practice to apply it just right without the powder going outside the stencil or bleeding but once you have it down it's super easy to use and is a HUGE time savor.

The little plastic stencils with the rod attachment are definitely easier to use but don't give you as natural and nice of shape.

The little individual thin stencils work better but take a bit more practice.

They highlighter or eyeshadow sticks were a really nice extra and are actually fairly pigmented and very sparkly and pretty!

Overall this is a fantastic set and a great value. Suprised at how great these products are but Definitely worth it!

title: Amazing!
text:
This thing has blown me away!

Mostly got it because I thought a straightening brush would be faster than my traditional flat iron. I wasn't wrong, I was able to go from my before pic to my after in less than 5 minutes which is impressive enough but that's not the best part!

It doesn't fry your ends!

I was very skeptical when the description said that the steam made it healthier for your hair and caused less damage and kept it moisturized.
After using it I'm a believer.
Usually when I straighten my hair my ends end up looking and feeling like straw. Literally. It looks horrible no matter what type of conditioning product, heat protector, or oil I use. I was blown away when I saw my poor over bleached ends were as smooth as the rest of my hair! It's like night and day.

It's super easy to use and it comes with a little bottle to fill the steam chamber with water. It took less than a minute to heat up and it didn't pull hair or burn my scalp.

It is hard to get some of the baby hairs well with it but that's really not a big deal.

It has clips to help section your hair into layers and I don't think I've ever been able to straighten my hair so thoroughly so quickly!

I was surprised because when I opened it I felt like there was no way it would work on my hair but it was so easy to use!

If your hair is damaged I would 1000% reccomend this to help keep your ends from looking fried.

It's as affordable as most traditional straighteners and works so much better!

Get it.

title: Soooooo Much Better Than The Budget Option!
text: I tried a more budget friendly at home laser hair removal device a while ago and was less than thrilled with the results, but decided to give it one more try with a better device. I'm glad I did! This is a significant improvement! I wanted to wait several weeks to write my review to see if there were results and after 6-7 weeks of use I'm definitely seeing a significant reduction in hair! The device is super easy to use and instead of having to manually select the correct level of power for your skin tone, the device analyzes your skin tone and makes the selection for you. It literally could not be easier. There's little to no irritation if you use it correctly. If I get lazy and try to use it with any sort of stubble, then it stings a bit. But if I shave prior to use then it's quite comfortable. It's absolutely worlds better than epilating for sure. But that's a different story for a different day. (Ouch.) The one thing that's a little tricky about using this device is that you're not supposed to overlap the rectangle of light, but there's really no way to see exactly where you're placing it because it's up against your skin. Other than that, this is a breeze to use. In the 6-7 weeks I've been using it I've seen probably a 40-50% reduction in hair growth and what is growing is lighter and more fine. I don't expect to be completely hair free even after the 12 week treatment program, but even a significant reduction in hair would be fantastic! Bring on the shorts and tank tops!

title: Downright Impressive!
text: I'm super impressed with this fragrance, especially for the insanely reasonable price! I've tried perfumes that cost $150 more than this that I didn't like half as much. The first notes are sweet and bold and then the scent settles down into a nice, deep, sexy fragrance with a bit of a vanilla smell to it, which I absolutely love! My husband also said he really liked it, so that's a win! The only thing I don't love about it is the cheap looking plastic lid on the bottle. It really cheapens the look of the bottle and doesn't snap on well, which is kind of a pain. I thought about just throwing it away, but then if I travel with the bottle I'm afraid it will spray all over my bag. Other than that, I'm a huge fan of this scent and would order this again in a heartbeat. I can't believe that a fragrance that smells this good, in a bottle and package that looks this great is so reasonably priced.

title: My 3 Year Old Approves!
text: This is a nice set of glittery nail polish. I personally wouldn't wear this on it's own since it's quite sheer, but it's perfect for putting over a color. I ordered this set because my 3 year old LOVES all things sparkly, so it's perfect for kicking solid colors up a notch and making them fabulous enough for a preschooler. It took two coats to get enough sparkles for her taste. It's kind of tricky to get them even, which for makes my inner perfectionist feel a little crazy, but she's 3 and doesn't care. The sparkles are almost holographic so they are intensely sparkly. These nail colors arrive in a nice box with a foam cutout for each bottle. My only complaint about the packaging is that nowhere on the bottles does it say the name of or show the color. There are color dots included if you'd like to make your own color dot for each bottle, but I would much prefer that it arrive with the color on the bottle already so I don't have to. I don't understand why you wouldn't include the color on the bottle. Other than that I'm happy with these.

title: Only Works WIth Liquid Soap and Hand Sanitizers
text: My 3 year old has a knack for making a huge mess out of our old soap dispenser. Tipping it over and spilling the soap, leaving globs of it all over the place, it was just pain messy. This dispenser is perfect for her, and everyone really! I was initially pretty frustrated the first time I tried to fill it with regular, thick gel hand soap because it wouldn't work. Then I went back and actually read the directions and found that this only dispenses LIQUID soap and hand sanitizer. It will not work with gels. If you want to use gel hand soap in it you will have to water it down until it's liquid. This dispenser is a sprayer, so it doesn't turn the soap into foam, and it doesn't work with gel soaps or sanitizers. If you're ok with only using liquid products then it works as advertised.

title: These Work Well
text: I make my own hydrogen peroxide based laundry stain remover, which is sensitive to light, so these bottles are perfect! The bottles themselves are nice, thick glass and come with a sprayer nozzle for each bottle as well as screw on caps and cute chalkboard labels. The sprayer nozzles feel a bit cheaply made to me, but they do work quite well. I would like to see the tops be made of nicer plastic, but for the price, I would recommend these.

title: Where Has This Stuff Been All My Life???
text: Oh. My. Word. *Excuse me while I go throw away all my regular nail polish.* This is a Game. Changer. I'm a busy mom and honestly, I just hate going to the nail salon, and who has time to wait for 300 hours (Ok, maybe not quite 300) for your regular nail polish to dry, only to smudge it or have it chip within 2 hours? I had pretty much given up on nail polish and just been resigned to the fact that I would have boring nails forever. This stuff is seriously incredible. You just paint it on, cure it, wipe the top with the cleanser to remove the tacky finish, and VOILA! Perfect nails! I did mine last week with this set and they still look AH-MAZING. When this set arrived, I was a bit bummed to find that there's no color included, just base and top coat. I live an hour from the nearest mall and so I couldn't just pop into the store and get a color, and yet I wanted to try it out... Like, right now. I did some reading and found that you can actually use regular nail polish to make a "Gel-y" sandwich. Once you have the base coat on, cure it, then paint your regular color over the top and wait the "300 hours" it takes to dry. Then paint the top coat over the regular color, cure, wipe with cleanser and enjoy your stunning, long lasting nails! The only thing I would change about this set is the light. I wound up buying a larger light because the one that comes with this set is quite small and I wanted to be able to fit all my fingers or all my toes in at once. This light is great for storing and being portable, but I personally wanted something bigger. Overall a fantastic set. I'm never going back to regular polish ever again!

title: Smells great, very intense scrub
text:
When you open the lid of this lava scrub, you'll think you just stepped off the plane landing in Hawaii. It smells so tropical, so dewy, and so tasty I almost tried it. And it's no wonder, with ingredients of coconut oil, papaya extract, and macadamia oil.
I tried it a few times on my face (mixed with soap, of course), and it was a little too strong for me. The sugar crystals are large and sturdy, requiring a vigorous scrub to dissolve. It didn't cause me to break out, but I did notice that the rest of the day and the following day, it looked like half my skin got taken off. Dips, discolorations, and small zits that were hiding beneath the surface were all visible - but after a couple of days everything went back to normal. Those of you who have tried chemical or acid peels on your face know what I mean.
I get it, if there are that many impurities on my skin, it's a good idea to scrub them away. But I don't really like looking at my face like that in the mirror. So... now I've switched it to a body scrub and use it in the tub. Perfect! Arms, legs, and chest are now totally smooth and smell great.

title: Smells funky, but no tears
text:
As the product information boasts, these makeup wipes don't burn your eyes and cause tears when you use it! As someone with sensitive eyes, I would be the first to report if there was a problem. I'd also be the first to report if the added vitamin E oil caused a breakout, and it did not. I don't use foundation makeup, so I only used it to wipe off eye makeup, but I didn't get any breakouts near my eye area or forehead.
There is an odd smell to these wipes, but if you chalk it up to the 'healthy' aspect (we all know health food stores smell weird) it shouldn't bother you. It's not long lasting, so you won't smell it as you drift off to sleep. These are easy to glide over your face, and with lots of acreage per wipe if you do wear foundation. I also tested it with waterproof mascara, and it took it off extremely easily!

title: Very small salt crystals, but smells good!
text:
The best way to describe the scent of this exfoliating scrub is to say it smells like you just walked into a day spa. It's a truly lovely smell, light, fresh, salty, and luxurious. I've actually tried using it as a lotion instead because the fragrance is so nice, but it didn't really work out. It's very creamy, though, and when you put a dollop in your hand, it might seem like there aren't any salt crystals in it, because the cream is thick like lotion.
There was quite a bit of settling in the packaging when I opened the jar, and since I ended up using quite a bit in the shower, I don't think it'll last very long--perhaps a month. The salt crystals are very small, and when I tried to vigorously scrub, it washed away before I could properly exfoliate.
How I recommend using it, in order to get the best use out of the Himalayan salt is to wet your leg before you step unto the shower, so it's a little more than damp. Then take a dollop and scrub your leg, and when you're done with whatever appendages you wanted to exfoliate, hop in the shower and rinse it off. Somehow, when my legs and arms were really drenched, the scrub just slid right off. Less moisture helped it adhere better. The smell really is great and refreshing, and once I've figured out how to use it, I've started enjoying it more.

title: FINALLY! My tangles are gone!!!

Over the years, I have tried many different shampoos, conditioners, masks, and hair treatments but In spite of my efforts, combing my hair (especially right after shampooing) has always resulted in a nightmare of tangles—until I tried this product. I can hardly believe how easily I can comb through my hair now! I am a very happy customer and if you have easily-tangled hair, I would highly recommend that you try it.

If you're looking for an exfoliant to help with ingrown hairs, brighten skin and get out dirt it is a good product. Exfoliant is also great for healed tattoos to keep that new brightness.

title: Clip Doesn't Leave Any Room for Hair! Can't Stay In.
text:
The reason this clip won't stay in anyone's hair isn't that it's too heavy. It's in the way it's constructed. They made it so that when you open the jaws, there's just not much room for hair in there. The metal from the decorative part comes down into the center of the circle made by the open jaws. There just isn't much room for hair.

So don't think, like I did, that if you have thick hair, you can wear this clip. You hair won't fit in it. :(

If this review was helpful to you, would you click "yes" below? I'm dreaming of becoming a Vine reviewer someday.

title: Flower very nice, but birdcage veil difficult to handle
text:
I purchased this for my upcoming wedding. The flower (called a "fascinator" in the bridal industry, I'm learning) is very nice, and I will definitely wear it. I may cut the wires with the bling off, but that's just me. I'm having a simple summer picnic wedding with a white, cotton halter dress, and the bling might be a bit too much. I am going to ask my best friend before making this decision. Either way, it's a nice piece.

The birdcage veil, though, wasn't really how it's pictured. In the photo it seems to have a lot more conformity to a human head than the actual piece that showed up in my mailbox. The real thing starts out unruly, and popped up in weird places on my head. I tried calming the thing down with bobby pins, but it still looked unshapely. Finally, though, after watching the company's videos (they give you a piece of paper with a link to some instructional videos) and keeping it near the shower for a few days to get it to calm down, it did actually look good. I have a large head with puffy hair, and I found that if I put the comb towards the back of my head on the right, and allow the veil to come up over top my head from the back right, hanging down around my face, that the veil's large size is actually an asset, because it covers my puffy hair without flattening it.

I was so worried about the veil that I ordered a separate, handmade birdcage veil from etsy for $30 (see it at pompandplumage.com) that I hoped would be more what I'm looking for. When it arrived, though, it was too small to wear without wearing my puffy hairstyle slicked back, which isn't how I plan to wear my hair. I actually went back to the cheaper veil I bought here on amazon.

Whatever you end up doing with the veil portion, the flower/fascinator is nice enough, and cheap enough, that it's still worth the purchase. The flower/fascinators on the same site on etsy where I purchase the other birdcage veil, pompandplumage.com, are $60-$70, and look similar, so even without the veil, this was a good deal.

Excellent product. Phenomenal results for my lower back pain. Really unbelievable. My pain was so intense that I had and MRI done and then a visit to the neurosurgeon. Diagnosis was that I have bulging discs, arthritis and some slight stenosis but not yet a candidate for surgery. The neurosurgeon suggested that I visit a Pain Management specialist. Instead, I used this 4% cream that I had purchased for my wife's hand pain. I used the cream for seven days and the pain completely disappeared. I have been pain free for over a month !!!!

My wife has severe arthritis in both hands and this cream controls her pain.

Smells good, too.

I bought two additional containers of this product for relatives.

title: Good product but quantity misleading: Only one pen included!
text:
Is it just me? I have purchased this exact product several times--happily--in dark brown, grey brown, and chestnut (red brown). My eyebrows are, like my natural hair, about a level 4 or 5 dark brown, and the grey brown is probably the closest, though the other colors are handy for changes of color to hair and makeup. My brows are thinning, but a little filling in does the trick, and these pens are my favorite tool for the job, as they both color in where you need solid filling and can be used to make feathery strokes for a more natural brow look. This pen came with a useless little razor and three eyebrow "templates," only one of which I might consider useful (if you are new to shaping your brows).
The problem:
In the past I have received (I see now from other sellers) at least two or three pens for $6.99 to $8.99. I can't believe I paid over $8 for just one pen from this seller "Generies." Going back over the seller page, I see that indeed, by the pictures it appears that one will receive two pens. A sneaky little trick, showing the same photos as the sellers with better deals, but neglecting to include the "2 CT." If you are busy or distracted in the least, you might fall for it, as did I--and doubtless, as have many customers.
I really dislike writing negative comments, but am doing this to save others the trouble and disappointment of feeling ripped off. Needless to say, I will be buying this product from other sellers in future--the ones with the more reasonable--and honest--deals.

title: Excellent brushes for straight-haired wigs or your own natural hair
text: The loops didn't look like a good idea, but boy are they ever! Was able to brush out two long straight wigs that tend to tangle, and to shed with brushing. These brushes actually prevented fallout, while easily and gently handling tangles. Same for my own (long straight) hair. Highly recommend.

title: Fig will not likely be the shade you expect
text: This was supposed to be "fig," a color designation that most often turns out to be a pinkish brown- based berry color, between the mauve base of a plum and the darker red tone of a currant. It was none of these things, except maybe save a distant relation to "berry": it turned out to be a cooler red-blue tone of cherry. Not much pigment intensity and nothing like a tint or stain--more a weak gloss that would need constant reapplication. Was very disappointed, had high hopes for this brand and color, which online looks like the shade of my dreams--that slightly-darker than-my-own natural lip tone of fig I guess I might never find (though Etude House's gel stain in the odd, misleading name "sweet potato red" comes pretty close).

title: This is a must have
text: I believe I have had this long enough to determine it's value. It is well worth the money. This is a must have for any beauty routine. It comes very well packaged and protected. It comes with the charging stand, plug, charging cord, little filters that go inside the product and three Microdermabrasion tips. The tip that comes already on the Diamond Microdermabrasion is the normal one, then there is one for sensitive skin, and the last one is a precision tip. When you use this it gently uses suction and the the diamond tips to pull away the dead skin, black heads and even small whiteheads. Afterwards lightly wash your face. It does leave your face a little red but only for a few hours. By the next it was gone. I did have some areas of slight  bruising from going over the same area to often. It wasn't really bruising it was more like a suction mark on your skin but it was gone by the next day. I have used this several times and I absolutely love it. My skin looks and feels much better. This is one of those things that I won't be able to live without. I love it. Had I not seen it on sell, this is one of those things I would have never tried but since it was discounted I am so glad I got it and I think you would have too. I highly recommend this Microdermabrasion device.

title: Better than expected
text: This is a surprisingly nice product. It's large, though not as big as the picture made me think it would be, well made, and really smells nice. The lavender scent is definitely a stress reducer, and since it's both microwave and freezer safe you can use it hot or cold. To use hot you need to mist a little water on it (but not soak it) and microwave for 30 seconds. To use cold simply place it in the resealable plastic bag and leave it in the freezer overnight. I'm not sure if it really does anything for migraines or not since I don't get them, but everything else the manufacturer claims seems to be true so likely it has some benefits for that application as well. It's best to store it in the resealable plastic bag to make it last as long as possible since the scent comes from lavender blossoms and flax seeds rather than artificial ingredients that can be "recharged."

title: Worth the purchase!
text:
I have a toddler, I need a no-slip option for the tub. I searched, for a good option that was also cost effective. I didn't want a mat - to me, they are too thick and get grimmey/slimey around the suction cups. This was a fun print that is also a good alternative. I had to buy 2 packs (I bought 1 turtle and 1 penguin pack) so there would be enough to fit my standard sized tub.

Pros: The colors are vibrant and don't quickly fade (I am writing this review almost 2 months after purchase/install... 2-3 showers are taken daily in the tub where these are located). These stuck easily and have adhered nicely - they have not moved or lifted (i put these in when the tub was clean and dry). My toddler likes that there are animals in the tub. The no-slip surface isn't too rough and it does prevent slips!

Cons: I just wish there were more in a package - I had to buy 2 packs which wasn't the worst thing because I was able to get a 2nd print. A variety pack would also have been nice with a few different animal prints instead of all one print but I still love this purchase!

Did you find this review helpful? Let me know!

title: Needs Some Work to Make it work!
text: This was my first experience with a wig that wasn’t from Spirit Halloween and I can’t say it was much better. After trying this wig I decided to learn a little more about wigs and I found a ton of info out there about them and how to do a little work on the less expensive ones to make them look better. (ie: thinning them out, plucking the part and hairline, etc.) I also learned about the features of a wig that make it look more realistic, such as synthetic vs human hair/human hair blend, pre-plucked and lace front. Now that I know a bit about wigs I feel more optimistic that I’ll be able to find ones that are affordable yet look more realistic and/or that I’ll be able to work on them a bit to make them look more so. In summary: The part and thickness on this wig are what I think need the most work. There’s virtually no part and the hair on the top is much too dense and puffy. This could be rectified by plucking but the wig is just not worth the work, IMO. The style of it is cute—The length and the waviness of it were exactly what I was looking for. I can’t say the same about the bangs but that’s the part of the wig that would benefit from some plucking and thinning out. The softness is pretty good for a synthetic wig.  I can’t comment on tangling because I didn’t keep the wig long enough to see how it holds up. The color is hard to comment on because it looks so different depending on the light—It can look like an ashy light brown with subtle highlights, a darker, less ashy light brown with no dimension to it, and in others it appears to have a mauve-like tinge to it. (You can see the differences in the pics.) In the end I returned this wig and after doing more research I decided I wouldn’t buy another inexpensive synthetic hair wig and instead look for a human hair blend that may be a little more expensive but looks more realistic. The bottom line: I recommend not buying this wig unless you know how to work on a wig to make it look more realistic.

title: Big Bar Of Soap!
text:
I have been using this soap for the last 5 days and wanted to use it that long to see if it works for me. I have sensitive skin on my face that is prone to breakouts no matter how much the company says it is for sensitive skin. I have minor adult acne and still hate it. I just want clear skin...is that not too much to ask? Well, after just 5 days, I see a major improvement around my t-zone and chin area that normally breaks out with everything new I try. I did have one bump that showed up and drew a white head but only lasted a day at the most before it dried up. This is my first time ever using an African black soap and always heard good things about it, and so happy I tried it. This is a really BIG bar of soap that I've cut into smaller pieces so that it last longer. I use it on my arms, legs, and face only. So far, doing wonders. I no longer have dried out skin to where I have to immediately put on lotion after showering. Totally worth trying out, even just once!

I received a free product for the purpose of my review. Opinions are 100% my own.

title: Didn't work as well as hoped
text:
This product was okay for minor maintenance of hair loss, but at about the three month mark my hair thinned in gobs across my scalp. Given that yes, I have scalp problems that are not genetic, but other products have worked better. Redken is a brand that works. I have a few issues with this product that are not limited to the failure for it to help my hair problem.
Cons:
This does not increase volume and thickness, it coats the hair in a waxy substance that makes the hair feel disgusting. If that's volume, it's not worth feeling that way consistently.

This product has soy and wheat ingredients in it, both of which have no actual use due to the high content of phytates and lectins binding all nutrient content away. Any claim to nourishing hair is automatically refuted because of the science behind these seeds.

The price for an ineffective product is too high.

The ingredient list is a bit long, but not filled with artificial chemicals.

Pros:
The shampoo smells good.

Can help with extreme minor maintenance, but is not very good long-term as far as I could tell.

Effective against seborrheic dermatitis and general dandruff.

Contains beneficial, natural ingredients, but the soy and wheat are unnecessary.

Overall, this might work for someone, but not me. I'll be trying other brands because of this setback.

title: Nice kit for beginners/parent child activity
text:
I purchased this for my 7 year olds birthday. We got around to doing it tonite, finally. Overall, we were very pleased with this kit. Make sure the water temp and oil temps are spot on, add them and mix. Let sit, mix, let sit, mix, let sit, mix, etc. I was surprised how simple it was. It's nice how they combine oils and make everything into convenient packets of mixtures. Not having to measure really helps you focus on making the actual product while still keeping my daughters attention. She enjoyed this very much and was so eager for us to be able to stop mixing it and bottling it up.
My only gripe is the amount of lotion. We wanted to play with scents, so we used flavor oils we found in our cupboards. But, because they are tiny 2 oz jars, it was difficult to experiment with different scents. We did end up just taking out 2 oz of lotion, scenting, bottling, repeat. But, it was kind of annoying. For double the price of this kit, I saw another kit that makes 4x this amount of lotion. But, I believe ingredient wise, this kit is better. I love that this company chooses a natural preservative and that they use essential oils for scent. (It only comes with 1 scent - lavender) To make this kit better, they should increase the amount of lotion this makes and maybe offer a variety of essential oils to make a few different scents. I also wasn't quite clear on if they used unrefined or refined mango butter, but considering the small amount, it's not a huge deal. For the first timer, this is a great intro to DIY AND THE BEST PART: the lotion is lovely!! Makes my hands so soft and isn't greasy. I'm going to try making more lotions on my own :) My daughter was so proud and just loved labeling her lotions and giving one to her brothers.

title: Appropriately Sized Bottles for Travel
text:
I don’t like to travel with the original bottles of shampoo, body wash, etc. They are huge and would take up my whole suitcase. This set of 6 bottles are great for holding just enough to last the trip. There are three 100 cc (the maximum amount per bottle for carry-on) spray bottles. Also, there are three 60 cc pump bottles. Each is made of hard plastic and 5.5 inches tall. They fit very well into a purse or cosmetic bag.

I put shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and hand sanitizer in them. They are clear, so TSA shouldn’t have a problem with it when screening at the airport. The pump and spray are easy to operate. One word of caution on the pumps: The pump attachment does not lock, so I recommend saving the little clip that came with the bottle to keep the pump in a locked position. In summary, these are good quality pumps and spray bottles for a great price.

title: Very Durable and of Good Quality Product (Caution!!! It Might Damage the Wall on Move Out Day!)
text:
This item is very durable and very easy to hang up, as all that is required is simply removing the glossy sheet that covers the back of the stainless steel hanger and applying it to the wall with pressure. You would have to make sure you are precise, i.e. it is leveled––straight, as the adhesive on the back is REALLY strong.

That being said, you would have to make sure the wall is not made of cheap materials. I had no problem having this item on my bathroom wall for over a year. There was no need for concern that it would fall. However, the moment I needed to get it off, it was as though it was going to take the wall with it. Paint and parts of the wall came off and caused damage. So I had to take off the black sheet that had the adhesive from both stainless steel pieces and keep them. It's possible to find some other form of adhesive (like Command hanging strips) to reapply them to the wall.

title: Huge variety and lasts a long time!
text: I bought these tattoos as a party favor for my daughter's unicorn themed birthday party. We didn't invite many kids (yay COVID) so we had quite a few of these leftover. I noticed as I was making the party favor bags that each sheet of these tattoos are unique, so you don't end up with a copy of the same thing. Some are pretty, some are cute, and some are silly, so there's something for everyone. We had a tattoo party a few nights ago and everyone in the family got a tattoo put on the back of their hand. Dad, mom (me), daughter, baby sibling, and grandma. They go on quickly with a little bit of water and only pressing for ten seconds. They look great once applied with very bright colors and unique designs. Dad's was barely scrubbed off the next day in time for work. Mine lasted two full days with multitudes of handwashing and still had to be scrubbed off in the shower. Four days later, daughter and baby sibling still have theirs on and they look great! I would definitely recommend these tattoos for anyone wanting a cute temporary tattoo that lasts a long time.

title: Perfect for me! Difficult to figure out the first time.
text: I like this drill because I feel safe using it. It's not as strong as a dremmel or other brand drill, but for me I like that. The price is great as well! It saves me tons of money from going to the salon. It was very confusing to figure out how to use it the first time. I thought it was broken for about 5 minutes. I even youtubed directions and couldn't fine much. Just push the little nail looking thing in (it'll catch when you try to turn the bit) and turn the bit on the top to open it up and switch the bit. It's easy to do once you figure it out the first time. And always put your fingers on the indents halfway up the drill for stability.

title: AMAZING MASCARA!
text: I can’t recall which beauty store here in FL that I purchased this AMAZING mascara, but the one I have is finished and I’m on the hunt for restocking.  This mascara is the FIRST mascara that I’ve found that truly Elongates my lashes while separating each lash. Because the wand brush has 2 sides to it (a short rubber bristle side and a longer bristle side) I am actually able to get to the BASE of the lashes on my lid and rotate the wand to the longer bristle side to coat each lash while separating them - on the FIRST application!  The result is PERFECT each and every time without the mess, clumping, stickiness, etc that almost EVERY other brush causes.  The other thing I noticed immediately is that since the brush doesn’t taper at the end like most brushes do, I actually get mascara on my inner lashes (near the nose bridge) without making a clumping mess!  My current Triple Play has been finished for a while now and I’ve just been (unhappily) using THIS wand to apply my other mascaras! :-)). I’m so glad Amazon has come through yet again for me!  I’m going to order as much of these as I can find on here. GOOD JOB NICKAK!!

title: Hair just slipped right off the small brush
text:
Very disappointed. I was trying to replace my existing hot air styling brush (LUXE Brand) before it breaks. I quickly realized the LUXE brand has been replaced with another name, that being Jinri. There are other names for this same style, one of them, Sultra which is SUPER EXPENSIVE ($149.00) for the SAME dryer. CRAZY

The reason this Milanta brand is being returned is because the 1 1/4 brush does not have those little balls on the end of the bristles therefore my hair just slides right off. If you use your hand to hold the hair in place, of course your hand gets too hot. The small brush is difficult to hold on the tip, it is slippery, it needs BIGGER Ridges to grip. The Big brush bristles are much better and they DO HAVE the little balls on the end. BUT the TIP of the brush does not have a enough space to put your fingers on while you are turning the brush.

The picture above shows my old styler brush in the middle and their (Milantia) brushes on either side.

Anyway, I found the Jinri on Amazon and ordered that one, it looks exactly like the one I have. 1000W is the same as my old one. YAHOO

title: A lot of good things to say about this mask
text: I really enjoyed this and I think a lot of others will too, if you have oily skin and want a mask that will steadily peel off of your face and take all of the dirt from the day with it then you should try this kit. It comes with a step 1,2, and 3 with the mask itself being step 2. First you use step one "Export Black Heard " which helps pull the black heads out of your skin and it does a really good job on its own- I acutally bought this set twice for the first step alone! MY bottle tipped over without the lid on (thanks to my awesome toddlers!!) and I almost immeadiately ordered a whole new set. I could see results before even putting the mask on just from the prep. When you put step 2 the mask on your face you want to make sure that you dont make it too thick of a coating because it will take longer to dry (but this one still will unlike a lot of peel off masks that end up being scrub off because they dont ever harden and do what they claim they will. The third step is also a really good one it closes the pores to prevent them from immeadiately accumulating dirt again. The instructions are in a foreign language, but there isnt too much going on here that is too copmlicated to understand.  I like how my face feels clean after usinmg this

title: Recommended
text: I've been very happy with this brush.  My hair has always been thin, but since it has started getting more gray, it has become more dry & coarse. I've been using a flat iron to smooth it out and get rid of the kinky nature.  This has worked great for me instead.  I wash it, dry it, and then just brush.  One word of caution, the nubs are very hot, so you can put your hand over them, also, your hair will be warm for a few seconds after you brush thru it.  I discovered I could use a dry wash cloth or heat resistant glove to assist in keeping  my hair against the warming surface.  As I place the brush under my hair & brush downward, I place my other hand (protected by cloth or glove) over the nubs, thereby holding the hair tight against the surface.  The smoothing effect is great without any burning of the hair like with a straight iron.  We also used it on my mixed race granddaughter whose hair is much thicker and kinkier.  It took a little longer than it did on me, but it did smooth her hair faster than with a hot iron.

title: Not what I expected :-(
text:
As much as I wanted to like this wig, even with no reviews - I didn't.

First, the cap is SMALL. You have to have a very small head to get this on without half of your own hair exposed. Even with a wig cap, the bands of the wig are visible.

Second, it's THIN. The cap, albeit airy, is visible throughout the wig, especially at the top of the bangs.

Third, it's quite shiny. Even for a gray-based color, but dry shampoo does help a little.

Fourth, the texture is stick-straight. The picture looks a little wavy, but it's not.

Fifth, the hair texture is a bit odd. It's actually slippery, so glossy that a barette or band slides right out of it without any effort. The photo looks a lot more natural.

In conclusion, it's a fail, It might work for someone else, but sadly, not me.

title: Under boob & stinky teenage boys
text:
Why yes, I did just pay $18 for 1 stick of deodorant. That's how good this stuff is. I normally buy from Lumes website but they are insanely slow to ship and they're headquartered in my city. I needed this yesterday so I had to buy on Amazon. My 14yo son is stinky. I believe this to be true for most teenage boys. However this stuff solved that problem. Because it works for extra hours, it helps the forgetful kids. I haven't gagged at the smell of my son since we found this stuff. Buy this, lots of it, if you have stinky boys.
Second, let's talk big boobs: I've got 'em. It's super hard to keep the under boob area dry & chafing free in 100° summers. This does not stop sweat - but it does stop the smell & most importantly the red chafing that goes along with it. I have very sensitive skin & have tried 'all the things' to cure my constant red, chafing & sometimes yeast infected under boobs - including Dr prescribed ointments. This did it when nothing else does.

title: Phenomenal!
text: I've tried many sheet masks, but this one is a standout. I was looking for pearl as an ingredient in a sheet mask, and it's hard to find.  I read a lot of reviews before purchasing.  It is loaded with essence (many of them are), but these masks are different in their results.  I honestly see the little fine lines under my eyes gone after using them.  They stay gone the next day or so, too.  I know, that sounds hard to believe, but for me, it's true. And there is some brightening effect, too, and definitely calmed redness and... spider veins.  Your results may vary, but it wouldn't hurt to try these masks if you've developed broken capillaries.  Certainly there is "plumping", and my skin is bouncy and supple the next morning. I will say that after removing the mask and patting, the essence stays a bit tacky, but with these results I don't mind.  Essence that remains in the packet I use the next night as one of my serum steps.  I certainly will reorder.

title: Doesn't do a thing for me
text:
This is a very thin, clear oil. It isn’t as thick as baby oil and runs almost like water. I would never put oil or an oil-based product on my skin because it clogs the pores. Some people might be able to get away with it, but even though I have dry skin, my skin will break out if I put oil on it, so I have skipped that test. I did rub it into my hands and it dries fast without leaving an oily slick.

What I did use this for is my hair, which is very thick and very dry. After shampooing, I poured a little bit of the oil into my hand and rubbed my hands together. Then I ran my hands through my hair, keeping the oil away from the scalp area. Afterwards, I blew my hair dry then applied more oil. Usually, I apply a gel in the same manner that calms the frizz and leaves my hair with a nice shine to it. However, the oil did not produce the same results. My hair still had flyaway ends with no gloss to it. My newly washed and dried hair always looks better the next morning after the hair product has had a chance to calm the frizzy hair shafts, but the morning after I used the oil, the results were no different than the night before.

I’ll stick to my gel product to end the frizziness of dry hair.

title: Terrible - Damages hair worse than flat iron
text:
I was so excited to try this as I don't want to use a curling iron all the time. I followed the instructions and watched a few videos. I woke up with terrible hair to the point that I had to wash so I can style it. No way I could leave the house looking like that. The curls were loose and uneven, wack waves and broken off ends. Just terrible. Here are the things that didn't go as expected:
1) It's not so easy to put them on and takes 5 tries before one is on
2) The velcro pulls hair and makes it messy and fizzy
3) Very hard to keep the ends secure, so I. had chunks of broken tips on the floor and sink as I took them off
4) The waves are not round as you sleep on it and some look bent depending on how you slept, so more of a kink than a curl
5) No way 8 rollers can cover the whole head, so you need at least 2 boxes to do it properly
6) the front of the hair looked awful, as it turned into my forehead with a kink

All and all, it was a waste and I'm returning them. Watching all the hair that was left in the rollers with the velcro and on the floor from breaking off, I find it damaging.

title: Wow! This Shaver Rocks!
text: After 30 years of shaving with the old shaving gel and razor routine, I entered the 21st century with the Norelco 7885XL and am extremely pleased that I have. The convenience of being able to shave on-the-go and the closeness this Norelco provides are both well worth the investment. Although, I've got to mention that I got a little lucky price-wise because the Norelco 7885XL magically appeared as one of my Amazon "Gold Box" promotion items so I jumped at the chance to buy this model at an incredible savings! Other than an excellent shave, my favorite features are the "time remaining" and the "needs cleaning" indicators on the LCD screen. The unit quickly charges to the full 45 minutes of run time in about an hour and is easy to clean by simply flipping open the head assembly and rinsing under the faucet. Did I mention quiet? Yep, the 7885XL is whisper quiet. Did I mention close? I'm getting a closer shave than I've ever gotten from a hand razor. Price, convenience, money-back guarantee from Norelco (use it for 21 days and get a full refund if you're not happy) - Buy it! Chances are, you'll be pleased you did.

title: Pretty stretchy and thin but OK for price
text:
These spiral ties from Gomayee are very handy. They are inexpensive. Except for the original brand of these, all of the ones I have found on Amazon have the little rough and uneven part where the the circle is completed. Thicker bands definitely have it show less though. The lower the gauge (if this is the same way earring posts are measured) the better the tie.

These are extremely thin and stretchy. I have a couple of photos with blue text that show the difference. The thick one is actually too big for my thinner hair. These are also rather loose on my thin hair. I have some smaller ones with thick plastic that are my favorites. I would think these are good for big buns and maybe for thicker hair? I can twist them around about 4 times for a pony tail. Still they don’t damage or tangle my hair and I will use them. They feel fine on my wrist too for when I take it out and don’t want to lose it.

title: Really made for a full head of very thick hair
text: These are for very thick hair. I usually put spiral hair ties around my hair twice but these need to go a minimum of three times around my hair. They don't snag or pull my easily knotted hair. They work very well and arey favorite type of hair tie. If you have thick hair, give these a try! They do work on average to thin hair too, just have to have twists  in them.

title: The Goldilocks Of Hairbrushes
text: I have very long hair, and I seem to have tangles that are impossible to get rid of. This brush did a pretty good job with some of the worst tangles and I'm very pleased. However some of my hair overtime due to poor hairbrushes became too matted and will just have to be cut out. For me bore brushes have always been too soft. They control frizz, and make my hair shine on the surface but lack any kind of pull so that overtime my hair will get out of control. With most plastic and nylon brushes I am either breaking to much of my hair or causing myself pain while obtaining mixed results.  With that said,  this brush does a very nice job at keeping my hair under control and giving it that beautiful luster. It has just the right amount of rigidity to pull at those tangles, but it also knows when to give so as to keep these locks in gorgeous harmony. So if you like me are seeking a good quality hairbrush, possibly look at this one.  I can't guarantee you will have good results like mine because everyone has different hair, but for the price it's worth a try.

title: Discontinued, don't know why
text:
I purchased this neck cream over six months ago. Just surfin' the net about neck creams, I found that it is discontinued, and more than one site advised reading the warning on the label. There was no warning on my tube, and I no longer have the box to check.

Anyhow, I contacted the original seller to see if they knew if I should still use this discontinued cream, for instance, if a problem had been identified with it or its ingredients. The seller emailed me back saying they had seen something about a discontinuation and possibly a warning, and gave me the phone number for BORBA. I called the number, and it is no longer in service. I checked, and it is the number on the BORBA website. Then, I went through their website email screen, filled out the information, and still haven't heard from them in almost two weeks.

I kinda liked the feel of this cream, but no longer trust BORBA, due to the above. I do not recommend purchasing this product, because (1) it is discontinued under suspicious circumstances and (2) manufacturer is unavailable to contact by phone or email.

title: so I am satisfied with this cream
text:
This cream has actually made a slight difference so far. I have been using this for almost two weeks and I'm starting to notice my breasts do feel fuller. They are still the same size but the shape has improved. I am a former bf mom so they are not as perky as they once were. I wouldn't say this is a replacement for surgery or anything though. For me just seeing any improvement is exciting, so I am satisfied with this cream. I wasn't really expecting this to work in the beginning, I began to see a difference around the third day. I used it twice a day.

The smell is a little different. It was musky to me. It doesn't smell bad.. but it could be better. The size is probably enough for a few months, I still have tons so a little goes a long way. The consistency is thick and really blendable. A little nickel sized amount is about what I use each time because it spreads easily. It really just feels like lotion on your skin, it isn't sticky or gel like.

The only thing I didn't like about this was the fragrance, the scent is not a scent I would normally wear but since it does seem to benefit my breasts it
Is a scent I can live with, I just spray perfume over my shirt and it covers it up.

Overall I am happy about this cream, even with the change being suttle so far it still has some affect and that's better than nothing for me. I'm hoping I see more improvement with this in the long run and I will continue using it.

I did receive this product at a discount or for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I do express my reviews honestly by the actual experience I have with the product.

text: As far as the deodorant is concerned, I was impressed by the effectiveness and I like the subtle scent. However, don't buy through this vendor because it was a total rip off. title: Bottom line: great product
text:
A little goes a long way! I have to admit that I thought my sample jars were a bit better than the full size in regards to performance but that being said, I really like these.

Lavendar and Cleary sage both have calming effects. If you are a guy and would like some zen but don't want estrogen effects that lavender can cause opt for the clary sage.

For performance, hmmmm.....when I used my samples i had zero issues with odor, even after workouts. I did not go through any detox issues but i haven't used conventional deodorants in years.

Now that I'm on my full size, i find it isn't quite as good as before. Then again, I'm perimenopausal so with raging hormones, who knows what is going on with my body!

It will not keep you from sweating during hot environments or workouts, but that's actually a good thing. Your body is designed to sweat out the bad stuff and to cool you down. It does help with odor control for sure and yes, detox is a real thing. Drink more water to help. If you are having any serious issues with detox, use the tea tree oil one. Tea tree is a great antibacterial and antifungal.

I'm overall very happy with these products. I do highly recommend them and I know I will be continuing to use them.

I have sensitive skin and I can't use traditional lotions on my face, so this has been wonderful.

title: Soooo happy!!!!
text:
I got my lot today and I'm SO happy with it! I knew it was a risk being unable to select the colors myself but I'm pretty thrilled with the colors that arrived. There were no duplicates (which I was concerned about) and while there are three dark blues that are somewhat similar, there are enough differences in the bottles to make them unique. I had two of the colors already but considering I have about 15 of this brand already getting only 2 that I already owned was amazing! All in all, this purchase was definitely worth it! Where I live, these bottles run about $8/each so I just got $160 worth of polish for just $35. Hard to top that!

text: I used to love this product. I had several bottles. I reordered and got this. I used it ONCE, and it foamed up nicely, then, poof, that was it. No matter how I pushed on the button/lid, no foam came out. I shook the bottle, several times. That helped a TINY bit and a dribble of foam came out. I had this happen once before, but not after the first use. They need to figure out the dispensing issue, here. I will never buy again. I threw it out, too annoyed to bother to send back. Not recommended.

title: Princess and the Pea -Worthy
text: They have really improved the eye mask. Just not too many years ago, you had to settle with 2 lb. eye bags which smashed your cornea and your vision was blurry for hours. or you had to settle for faux fur, or "memory form"  stiffness. Or a well-meaning aunt gives you a spa package with an eye mask that was silky but looked like you had a panty liner on your face. NOW, these are available, in fun colors. The best feature is that they are concave, formed, so that you can bat your eyelashes inside and your REMs will not be suppressed. You can open and close your eyes ad libitum, thus giving you more freedom and less of a claustrophobic feel. These are light, easy to pack, or store, comfortable, SO, comfortable, and they block 99% of the light. With a little jiggling and arranging you can tighten them up and block out 100% of any ambient light. And if I can sleep with them on, anyone can. I'm Princess and the Pea picky.

title: Just try it
text: Yes, it may seem a little pricey.  I was hesitant.  I must have a million dollars by now invested in various nail polishes.  But I bit the bullett to try this one as I liked the fact it was plant based.  I read the claims and was impressed.  Well, I received it a month ago.  It took a few days to arrive but came packaged well.  I immediately took it out of the box and tried it.  I layered it daily as directed initially.  IT HAS NEVER CHIPPED! I've had it on for almost a month. It is shiny as well.  I now have a full set of lovely long strong nails......I only used the clear.  I still work so I'm typing all day long.  I do my own cleaning so my hands are in use in soapy water, etc regularly.  My nails aren't pampered.  I have always had brittle weak nails with ridges, etc.  Had acrylic for years [over 20] and covid put a stop to that.  I'm so glad I found this product.  I just today did one nail in the neutral color that came with the set I purchased.  I'll see how long that one goes without chipping.  You just have to try this!  You won't stop looking at your lovely natural nails.

title: Lightweight, non greasy moisture
text:
The best thing about this serum is that it's completely non greasy. It feels like putting thickened water on your face, but instead of evaporating, it stays on your face and continues to moisturize. I have been using it as a lightweight moisturizer after i wash my face with either an AHA or BHA facewash, so that it really sinks in. That said, it is not enough to use it as a standalone moisturizer, probably exactly because it's non greasy and doesn't create a barrier on your face to keep the moisture in. It says on the bottle to follow up with a moisturizer, and I will but I wanted to test it out alone first.
I really like the dropper packaging - you can be very exact about how much serum you're using. I have tried it with different amounts. Today I used only 1/3 of a dropper, and I still feel like it was too much product so next time I will try it will 1/4 dropper. It comes shipped with a screw on cap that you can save and use for travel.
I have to say that this really does work. My face feels plump and moisturized with no tight feeling on the surface. It's light enough to put even under my eyes and I don't fear that it will cause millia or clogged pores. I don't have a lot of fine lines yet (36), but my skin is prone to flaking and this takes care of that, all day.
It has a very light smell - kind of herbal, but light and inoffensive.
I should mention that I received this in exchange for a fair and honest review, and that I have tested and reviewed to the best of my ability.

title: Overpriced drugstore scent
text: Disappointed. The scents include a "musk", florals (Jasmine, Lily, Honeysuckle) and a "vanilla", which should be a warning. High-end designer scents may be derived or contain some of these "notes", but do not stop there. The "musk" referred to as "amber musk" is the most subtle and acceptable of these; it is somewhat "softer" than the old, familiar drugstore variety that had its heyday in the '80s. The florals smell cheap; very few fragrances use essence of living flowers and that is necessary to distill a true floral scent. The jasmine has a "brassy" top note as does the honeysuckle. No one should do "vanilla" anymore; it is a cloying and overwhelming smell (not scent), rather than a complex "caramel", and this one is no different. (Acqua di Parma is the only line that includes "vanilla" notes in its scents that have class and understatement.) These scents are nicely packaged in glass bottles and a laminated cardboard box with the brand name stenciled on it. But not nearly worth the price.

title: So many to choose from!!!!
text:
Good morning, class!!! I do my own nails to save money, usually with adhesive nail strips. But, I needed something to up my nail game!! Are you seeking quality rhinestones? Well stop looking, because here they are!!! #TakeNotes
Likes...
1. This set has six colors and they all have many different shapes and sizes to choose from!
2. The flatback makes them easy to glue and hold in place.
3. You can choose from small round shapes to larger star, heart or diamond shapes. AND...
4. To make it easy to grab and place your rhinestones, a flat L-shaped tweezer with a pointy end is included.
Room for improvement:
You need to buy glue, it's not included. #DontForget
The cute shapes are not the same for each color...I got only one black star, one green heart, and one beautiful iridescent oblong diamond. Also, the cute shapes are all larger sizes and take up lots of space on my short nails.
Lastly, the white pencil is not waxy, and didn't pick up the rhinestones, but I didn't need it.
OKAY, STOP SCROLLING... THIS IS IT! You cannot go wrong with this set. It should be in your collection, I am happy it's in mine. Raise your hand if you #PutEmInTheCart !!!!

title: Very Comfortable, Well Made, Throw In The Washing Machine
text:
These are very nice gloves. I've been having a reaction to dish detergent lately. I have a cortizone cream I put on once or twice a day and then put a glove on to keep the cream from getting rubbed off or getting near my eyes. I also put a moisturizer on at night before going to bed and then wear a pair of gloves to keep the moisturizer from wearing off. So far they've worked great.

The quality of these gloves actually surprised me. They are well made and the material is substantial. These aren't flimzy at all. I have small hands so I got the medium size. There's just enough elasticity to the material to give me a nice snug, comfortable fit. They won't fall off. It's also easy to handle things with them on. I haven't washed them yet but I'm sure they'll wash well by hand for at least a few washings.

Feb 24 1018: I washed several pairs of the gloves yesterday. I wasn't in the mood to hand wash or baby them so decided to throw them in the washing machine with my dish towels. I dried them in the clothes dryer on medium heat. The gloves came out perfectly. There was no fraying, shrinkage that was noticeable. They came out soft, comfortable, and totally unharmed. I REALLY like these gloves!!!

title: Good--but not excellent for Vaping
text:
I use VG for vaping.
Have been mixing my own juices since 2007 when vaping started.
The quality of VG and PG is very important, otherwise I will start coughing.
My point of reference is essential depot's VG and PG. Their quality is top notch, although their prices are higher.
VG should taste sweet, and have no other residual taste apart from the sweetness. If you taste any bitterness behind the sweetness, do not use it for vaping.
This VG is sweet but I can taste a faint aftertaste mixed up in the sweetness, which makes me think it's not USPS food grade. On another note, I am not coughing, which tells me it's ok to vape.

title: Each of these Soaps Smells so Wonderful and Unique
text: I received a gift set in a cute little silver mesh, drawstring bag from Keomi Skincare in exchange for my honest feedback and opinion. Inside the bag were 4 neatly wrapped soap bars. These soaps are aromatherapy grade and if you smell them, you will see why. They smell so wonderful. I love that these soaps are 100% vegan, gluten free, cruelty free, sulfate/paraben/petrochemical-free, and contain no artificial fragrances or colors. What more could you ask for in a soap? In my little gift set, I received four different scented soaps: Sea Breeze, Golden Crown, Green Tea Goddess, and Luscious Lavender. I’m about ready to cry because these smell so good. I’m not even exaggerating. The soaps are naturally colored and I think the colors of each variety accurately reflects the intended scent. The soaps don't over lather by themselves, but I think that's because of being sulfate free. However, I used the Luscious Lavender with a body puff and it lathered just fine. Overall, these are wonderful soaps and this sample set is the perfect introduction to the company and would make a great gift for just about anyone.

title: The good, the bad and the ugly...
text:
My review consists of the good, the bad and the ugly. First,
the good - I finally found a curler that 'fits' my eyelid. Huh, you say? Well, it appears that most of the manufacturers believe I have golf balls instead of human eyes. The tool's shape is long and shallow enough of a curve to catch most of the eyelashes. It is comfortable to use, but takes a bit of practice. Once you are comfortable with the scissor motion (sorry, no other way to describe it) used to make the curl, you are rewarded with a nice, non-crimpy curl. The pad in this one is the best I have used. This tool also opens wide enough that even the most nearsighted or lush lashed amoungst us can get it close to the base of the upper lashes. The design over all is very well thought out. I recommend using an magnifying mirror if you have to use bifocals (I do). All that said, now...
the bad - there is no replacement pad and I am questioning how sanitary this is going to be in the long run. I agree completely with folks here who advise to REMOVE ALL EYE MAKEUP before use. Ain't nothing pretty about an eye infection. I am wondering out loud how to properly clean this curler to be certain it remains safe. If you are prone to sties and other types of infection, I would be asking the same questions. Which leads to...
the ugly - until you practice and are used to it (won't take long) the results are a bit odd looking. The black pad is plushier and looks to be made of silicone and not the usual hard rubber. I have found that the hard rubber pads are chiefly responsible for that weird ugly crimp you can get. Not so with this one. I mentioned before the squeezy scissor action your thumb and index finger have to use can be tricky. If you have coordination issues, well - things could get ugly.
SUGGESTIONS for use...wash your hands before use. I keep the little plastic clip to keep the tool closed. You could follow the advise of one person here to heat the tool with a dryer, but I think I may skip that. Use a makeup mirror to assist you. Practice when you have some time. Enjoy, Ladies - get out there and be lovely.

title: works well, but has a minor design flaw
text:
I have used ionizing brushes for over 30 years—since they were first sold by Sharper Image. The negative ions work very well to flatten the surface of the cuticle of each hair, making the hair less likely to break or split, and also softer.

This particular brush works well, but the one I received has a minor design flaw: the brush part pops off so easily that I have to hold it tight with my thumb, making it less ergonomic than it might be... not an issue for me. As for the vibrating part, I couldn't tell, but that's not what I bought it for. This brush generates NO heat, which is exactly what I wanted. Unlike some similar products, there are NO seams that could catch the hair.

TIPS FOR ALL IONIZING BRUSHES:
(1) if they don't need electricity (cord or batteries), they're not the real deal
(2) heating elements, just like heated blow-drying, tend to dry out your hair and make it more brittle: even oily hair can get dried out
(3) brush your hair SLOWLY to get the best result
(4) if your hair is flatter after using it, and you don't like that, bend over and brush it upside down to get more volume

title: Great palette.
text:
I ordered this palette in the 15 shade option. I wasn't expecting much from this makeup palette but I was wrong. Now granted, I cannot use most of the colors as I am super fair-skinned but I am able to use most of the left side of the palette.

First, I have terrible dark circles. They are sort of a reddish-brown color. The yellow in this palette conceals them better than any skin-toned concealer I have ever tried. It not only covers but also brightens the area too. I also have a brownish spot on my cheek that bothers me every time I look in the mirror. I have tried everything to cover it. I went to a department store makeup counter hoping they could cover it. The makeup counter girl tried for what seemed like an eternity to no avail. She called her manager over to assess my situation. The manager tried to cover it as well, packing more and more concealer and powder but she also could not cover it. She finally said that it was texture and you cannot cover texture. It sounded like a copout to me. It has no texture, it is just a spot. When I apply the yellow in this kit is does wonders for the spot. It is barely noticeable, almost not at all which is better results than I have gotten in the past.

I use the green to cover redness that I have around my cheeks and nose area. I just make sure to blend really well and then put foundation over it to get rid of the green. The purple is used to brighten your complexion. Just like with the green, I blend it well and cover with foundation.

The best color that matches my skin tone for concealing is the color directly to the right of the purple. For reference I wear MAC Matchmaster SPF 15 Foundation 1.0. Nine times out of ten I am the lightest shade in any foundation. This color matches and is great at concealing.

The darker shades are good for contouring but I prefer to use powder contour rather than cream, just a personal preference.

Overall I really like this kit. It does a great job of concealing areas that are a constant bother to me. I am including photos of before and afters of my dark circles and the dark spot on my cheek. Hopefully they come out well and you can see the difference.

title: Adds hydration and tames flyaways.
text:
This Argan Oil hair serum is amazing. It helps calm my frizzies and provides the hydration my straw-like hair is craving this time of year. It comes in a 1.69 fl oz bottle with a pump dispenser. This hair serum smells like lilacs to me. It is a very lovely scent. It has a medium consistency to it, not to thick but also not runny. I have long, fine hair so I start with one pump on my fingers, rub it all over my palms, and apply it to my parched ends. When there is hardly any left on my hands I smooth the top of my head to tame flyaways. This serum also gives my hair shine which is another great benefit. I love this product and I will definitely be repurchasing when I run out. I think that will be a long time though because I can easily see this bottle lasting me at least a year.

title: great item, totally worth the price, no smell
text:
After reading some of the reviews on this item, I was wary of buying this item, but I'm glad I took a chance because the item really does live up to its promise to help organize your purse. The item is made of durable, quality material, and I can see it holding up for years to come. The price compared to other purse organizers is much more economical and I like that it has a bottom-it makes switching purses much faster than if I had to fish out the organizer and then move my loose items.

A concern listed in a couple of the other reviews is that the organizers smell-I did not encounter that at all, and I'm very sensitive to smells. The smaller organizer fits into my standard size purses and really does help keep me organized. I wish some of the pockets were of a different size, but overall the organizer fits my needs and I'm very, very glad I took a chance on this item.

I bought it through Amazon instead of the TV offer so I didn't have to worry about sneaky S&H charges etc, and as a minimalist, I only need one set, not two, and I certainly didn't need their "special bonus gift".

title: Waste of money
text: I am extremely disappointed with the conditioner. I’ve used other products from them that were great but this one was like washing my hair twice with shampoo.  Either there is a manufacturer issue that placed shampoo in the conditioner bottle or it’s just a really bad product. The conditioner even suds up a little like shampoo ( I even checked to make sure I didn’t grab the wrong bottle by rinsing my hair and reapplying the “conditioner”).  I hoped it would at least dry better but It left my hair dry, frizzy and my hair felt and looked like straw. In the end I had to rewet my hair and apply some real conditioner to try and fix my hair.

title: Works So Well!!!!
text: I lived in Japan for 4 years and had the good fortune to have this exact product suggested to me by a good friend. This is the same brand. My eyes suffer horribly in allergy season. My vision is blurry and foggy, my eyes are sore, itchy, and scratchy. When I use this eye wash they feel amazing!!! And it's not weird or scary to use. Remember you're not meant to tip you're head back anymore with stuff running down your face. The cup enables you to look down into the fluid, move your eyeball around in all directions, blink a few times, and you're done! I do not feel any stinging at all. Just cool relief. And it smells really good, too!  Which is kind of weird, but cool. :) I love the healthy ingredients. I couldn't find similar American products with ingredients as nice as this, so I'm thrilled to find it from Amazon now. So happy to find this product again!  Worth every penny! :)

title: This is my second Straightener Brush ever
text:
However, as far as products go... I really love everything about the way this company presents itself, it's design, it's product and how well the product performs. It has a great warranty (my last one from a different company died in less than 5 months with no recourse), and it came with a bunch of great stuff, including this weird little paddle (the green & white thing) I couldn't figure out at first was a cleaning utensil, and now I really love. It helps you pull the hair from the brush.

At almost 30 years old this year, I had spent most of my life hating my hair with a passion. I would wear hats, I would wear wigs, I could not figure out anything that could make me happy... and it's because I was completely inept with styling tools and doing anything that wasn't simple. So I was beyond happy when someone recommended a straightening brush to me in the first place. Then I stumbled upon the best heat protection spray/frizz stuff ever... and I don't know what happened, for the first time in my life, I'm confident with my hair. So if you're on the fence about getting one of these, because you really have tried "everything" and you still hate your hair....I don't know, maybe try a straightener brush. All you do is brush your hair with it....and it changes things a lot.

This brush though. I can not have enough good things to say about it. It came with everything! A heat protection glove (especially great if you have thick hair like me and need to go all the way up to 450 degrees!), the cleaning tool, a silicone bag to protect it, OH and the cord swivels. I absolutely love the shape and curve of the actual brush, and the sturdiness of the design. I can't see this thing actually needing replacing any time soon, honestly... and that makes me happy because I'm tired of buying stuff on Amazon and having it fail on me.

Of all the purchases in the past 2 years on here I've made, this is easily one of, if not the best.... and I wanted to share the pictures of what it does to my hair, so you can see. That is what my hair looks like after being blow dried, and then straightened with this brush, which doesn't take long at all. Maybe 10 or 15 minutes, and my hair is super thick.

title: Such a good product. Doesn't smoke, not a fire hazard, and does what it says, really WELL!
text:
I LOVED my brush & hate to give it anything less than 5 stars, I really really do. It changed my life. Made my hair manageable &nice & I love it so much. Unfortunately, the orange things started popping off very quickly, and now here I am after about 7 months and it's completely dead. 😭😭😭😭

I have to buy another one.... But I'm going to, that's how much I love it, really.

title: Old Oral-B great, this one not so much (Oral-B 4000)
text:
I had an older oral b electric toothbrush (5000 model) that lasted me a good few years. The battery in it started dying after a few brushes and the toothbrush was looking old so I thought it was time to get a new one. I purchased the 4000 model because I didn't really need the timer of the 5000 model and it looked very similar. It's not as great though. I don't know if I just have a defective one or what but the "brushing too hard" red light is constantly going off when the tooth brush is on, even when it's not in my mouth!

As to the rebate, I don't buy things just because there is a good deal going on but if I happen to find a deal for something I'm planning to buy, I will normally use it. I purchased this item which came in the Amazon Frustration-Free packaging. Sent in the rebate form, receipt, and the original UPC bar code (just like the rebate form showed), and I too got a letter stating they have not received the UPC code and to send it in.

title: It's not what I thought it would be
text:
I gave this 3 stars for "Softness" because the brush is average to a bit firmer than what would be ideal and comfortable to use on your back, while the loofah strap is average. The brush bristles are kind of scratchy and not the "good exfoliating" kind of scratchy. They're more like the "ouch, that's scratching me" kind of scratchy. Overall, though, it's acceptable and average.

Next, I gave this 2 stars for "Easy to use" because I don't find this easy to use. The brush is separate from the stick that extends it to reach your back; you slide the oval-shaped brush onto the stick by inserting the stick into a cut out section on the back side brush. The problem here is that it doesn't stay on firmly at all. I ended up with 2 options: either not on firmly enough, so it kept popping off, or pushed on so much that it's very difficult to get off of the stick to use separately. The loofah strap is really easy to use, though. It's nice and long so there's plenty of length to comfortably hold each end and move it back and forth at most angles, no matter how thin or thick your arms or body may be. That's a real plus! But I still couldn't give more stars if only half of the set is easily usable.

Finally, I gave this 4 stars for sturdiness because there's no doubt, it seems pretty sturdy. The bristles on the brush have stayed intact. The loofah strap is firm and sewn solidly -- but it may be too firm. It's hard to get flexibility out of it. The elastic strap handle on the brush is flimsy, but overall, it's a solid set. The wood is a good, solid, well-finished wood without splits or cracks. It doesn't seem like a cheap product that's going to warp and break easily if you keep it away from hanging to be soaked when it's not needed for use. Putting it somewhere nearby where it stays dry is best.
