title: What an upgrade
text:
I usually get packs of cheapola showercaps from the dollar store (like a six pack of plastic bags with a rubberband, you know?) but they don't last long... So I had a vinyl one that lasted longer, but was really just that same old design that was just plastic tied to your head with elastic...

This shower cap is... well, frankly, after the other ones I've used... luxurious. The material is not plastic, but more like the soft nylon on my windbreaker jacket. It's much quieter when I'm in the shower, which makes for a more peaceful bathing experience. It is also more comfortable, as the headband is more fitted. It's especially comfortable if you wear it over your ears... there's no pressure anywhere, but it still keeps your hair dry. I, personally, like to have my ears "out," so there is some pressure to the top of my ears where the headband sits, but I don't mind it.

The headband does stretch a bit for head size, but not as much as you might be used to if you've used shower caps with elastic bands. I kind of liked this... It makes it easier to get all my hair in it. I flip my head upside down over the shower cap, and the cap just kind of catches my hair like a bucket, and I can just tuck in any stragglers before flipping my head back up. If you need to tighten the headband just a little bit, you can re-tie the bow for a slight adjustment.

No shower cap is going to be completely, perfectly water tight. You're always going to get a little bit of water around the edges unless you're really careful in the shower and take pains to avoid direct spray. I use a shower cap when I take a shower before bed and don't want to go to sleep with wet hair... a little bit of moisture doesn't bother me, as I'm not trying to protect a hairstyle or anything. I really just like the comfort and feel of this cap a lot!

title: Works!  Looks great!  Eyebrows! Yay!
text:
So, after being chemo eyebrow bald (and everywhere else bald too) for almost a year due to breast cancer chemotherapy treatments, when my eye brows finally grew back they were mostly white instead of my natural dark brown. Augh!! Since I am a second time breast cancer warrior with bigger fish to fry — I ignored my mostly white eye brows for about nine months — hoping they would eventually recover their natural dark brown color after my body recovered from all the chemo poison. Nope. Not happening. No such luck.

The mostly white eyebrows bothered me even more than the flat chest double mastectomy— because well a flat chest can be padded but having invisible brows left me feeling washed out and old. So, I decided to fix my brows because that seemed like a doable relatively easy DIY thing. I read lots of articles on home dying eye brows. Then, based on article recommendations, I found this Godfey product on Amazon and after much research and watching DIY “dye your eyebrows at home” videos, I gave it a go and dyed my eyebrows at home exactly one week ago. The results: Yay!!!! As everyone suggested, I put vaseline around my eyebrows to protect my skin. I did one eyebrow at a time rather than both at once. Also, due to my super sensitive skin, I only left the dye on for two minutes per brow. Still, it worked perfectly. My eyebrow hairs are still dark brown — one week after I dyed them. Success!!!

I love having my dark eyebrows back, and sort of feel like me again.

title: Works as promised but the "no mess socks" are too small.
text: I purchased this for my daughter, who had thick, cracked caluses on her heels. She used it and for the first couple days she didn't think it had worked much. Then, last night after her shower, she called me into the bathroom to show me the skin that was literally sloughing off her heels!  Kind of gross actually, but her feet are looking so much nicer now!  The only issue she had is that the plastic "no mess socks" that come with the kit were too small for her size 10 feet.  She had to squish her feet into them, which left very little room to move her feet inside to work the gel around, which is what the directions say you should do. If you wear anything larger than about a women's size 9., you might want to think twice before ordering this. Despite this glitch, I'm still giving the product 5 stars because it does work very well.

title: Smooth fast shave, easy to use.
text:
I have used Norelco travel razors for years, about one per year. My recent attempt to reorder was met with double the price, for the same razor. So, I ordered this one instead. About the same price as before, but with 3 blades instead of 2.
I've used it three days so far and I think it's wonderful. Shaves very close, doesn't pull, easy to clean, and i love the battery status indicator. As I said I've used it 3 days, the battery has used very little charge. I'm anticipating being able to go aweek or two between charges. I'm happy with this one, at least so far.

OK, one whole week. I've used this razor each day for 7 days....still think it's great. It's easy to clean, quiet (enough), comfortable to hold and use. I'm getting a close smooth shave, and have only used about half the charge. The charge was a concern, because I wanted to be able to travel for at least a week before having to worry about charging. Thumbs up for this razor.

What I was hoping for is when I needed to be clean shaved that I would be able to grab this and get the job done. That didn't happen! I have always used clippers to trim down the initial facial hair, and then come in with either a manual razor, or and electric razor to finish the job to get a super close shave. I don't know if it because my facial hair is so thick, but it required multiple passes on areas like the chin, or the necks and still did not get really close to the skin!!!  I would say this shaver would be great maybe for a person maintaining their clean shave, but not to get that initial clean shaved look! The shaver itself does charge fast, and is easy to clean.

title: Clever and Simple Design Idea
text:
I don't know if this listing will last because it is (at the time of my order and review) a four pack for the price of a pair elsewhere. But you do indeed get four. So I thought I'd throw a review up.

I really like the design behind these. You can mount them with screws on a flat surface or corner. And with the included double sided sticky 3M pads, you can do the same without making holes. Plus probably get them on a round pole like a leg of a piece of furniture. The plastic spikes are a good balance of stiff and flexible, though between the two descriptors I'd lean towards stiff. I mounted a couple on my big cat tree (one on a corner and one on the base flat). They obviously blend in fine there. But they're small enough that they would be discrete even if they were put somewhere more out in the open. My cat likes them well enough. She isn't as enamored with them as I had hoped but I've caught her getting the side of her mouth on them more than once already.

Between the cheap price and the non damaging sticky pad option, they're worth trying out if you think your cat would like them. If not, no big loss.

title: Love this brush!
text: I have moderately thick but very fine hair.  I've been taking extra time and good care of my hair these past couple of years since I turned 60, and that is why I can say my hair is moderately thick.  I found that a quality shampoo and conditioner help tremendously in maintaining body and appearance.  I brush my hair at least 50 strokes nightly and in the morning at least 25 strokes with boar's hair brush.  The shampoo, conditioner and brushing definitely improved the condition of my hair.  But this Brush with its Pure Wild Boar Bristle and Massage Tip Bristle Combination feels very nice on my scalp.  I personally prefer the round handle and the round shape of the head.  As I write this review, I am buying another, because something this good usually disappears from the market or becomes unreasonably priced.  All my many other Boar's hair brushes will go to storage.  This is my new "GO TO" brush.

title: Beautiful Oil For A Splurge- But Not Worth The Hype
text: This is a beautiful oil to treat yourself, but the bottle is misleading. If you look carefully, you can see that the liquid does not reach the bottom, that there is another glass bottom a ways up, making the bottle appear more full than it is. I took a star off for that because that's just not cool. They could make it in a smaller bottle & people would still pay $48 for it. It's a nice product. I wish, however, that it didn't have the olive oil in it, because that's what I think is causing acne in a lot of girls skin. For those with acne or if you just don't want to pay this much, you can get the same "velvet" results with rosehip oil. The Ordinary has one for 10 bucks. Rosehip oil can help reduce your inflammatory acne, get rid of acne scars, and clear your skin. Rosehip oil is an anti-inflammatory, able to reduce swelling and fluid buildup. Rosehip oil has a low rating of 1-2 on the comedogenic scale (a.k.a. not likely to clog dem pores). Plus, the linoleic fatty acids in rosehip oil have been shown to reduce oil production in oily skin types which can help prevent future acne. I received this Velvet Skin Drink as a sample & like others, I was impressed, but I found it for brand new & sealed for $24 on Mercari. Personally, because of the olive oil filler and the bottle deception, I wasn't willing to pay $48. They do some great marketing, evidently, as it's out of stock all the time. They make it sound like it's made of purely grapes, which it's not & the bottle deception just isn't worth the hype. Yes, the product is beautiful & makes your skin very soft, but is it softer than my Ordinary Rosehip oil? Nah. This is something nice to splurge on if I find a good deal, because of the of Sarantoni grapes, Resveratrol and lactic acid. But there are no studies on the benefits of these grapes over other grapes & they don't say how much Resvertal and lactic acid they use. I wouldn't consider this an active of any of those products. The Ordinary has both for cheap.

title: Now to hunt for silver vanity trays!
text:
I remembe, as a child, the old movies that had the elegant ladies getting dressed up, or preparing for bed, ALWAYS with lovley little atomizers like these, sitting on a silver tray next to their silver hand held mirros and their silver brush and comb...

Just to see them takes me back to being that little girl and dreaming of having some of my very own. I never really thought I would find then, but, now at the age of 48, I have hit the jackpot!

When my first set arrived, I wasn't expecting them so soon. When I opened the box, and moved the bubble wrap, I seriously nearly started crying! I wa so surprised, even though I had ordered them, it felt like someone read my mind and sent them to me!

SO silly, but so true!

I now have three sets here, and one on the way, leaving just one more for my next order!

Since they do come in pairs, I will let my two teens choose some for themselves, unless I buy them their own sets, unwilling to give up a single one of MINE! <LOL> I would rather split a set, though, as a binding keepsake, in that we each hold one half of the set.

title: Interesting. Takes some getting used to,
text: I was curious, so these became stocking stuffers this Christmas.  Of course, Santa put one in my stocking as well.  I love the idea behind the design and I've wondered many times why toothbrushes weren't made in a shape like this.  Then I found these, and I thought, "finally!".  But, as cool as they are, it's hard to maneuver in your mouth. The end tip is wide, to accommodate the wrap around bristles, and when I brush (and other family members) the large end tip hits into your back gums when you try to get the back teeth.  Maybe with more use I will be able to handle it better.  But I don't know if that's even possible with the end tip the way it is.  Of note: in the center of the two brush sides is another little brush, for the tops of teeth.  I don't know if it's sufficient in size to get the entire tops of the teeth.  I move the toothbrush around to scrub everywhere well.  I think it's worth the money just to try them, and see if you like them.

title: Nail-Saver
text:
This stuff is amazing, I'm always 10 steps behind everyone when it comes to new nail trends/ ideas. So initially I was going to buy another item but after some searching around, this makes so much more sense than getting a little tube that cost twice as much or even one that cost the same amount but only has 1/3 of the liquid inside of it.

Every nail polish lover should own this, im a super messy painter and with this liquid latex its so much easier to clean up. It goes on a light purple color and dries within 15 seconds tops to a dark purple color. It really easy to apply, since I don't have and empty nail polish bottle (what a surprise) I just use and old but clean makeup brush and apply it that way. I do clean my cuticles first of course, and apply it before the base coat because somehow I even manage to get that everywhere.

overall its amazing and it'll last a very long time even.

title: Great option for dry/sensitive eyes!
text:
I rate this a 10/10 for dry or sensitive eyes. I have extremely dry/painful eyes and this is the only mascara I’ve been able to tolerate. This mascara is so light and gentle that my eyes actually feel bare and I forget I’m wearing any eye makeup at all!

Pros:
- No crumbles, clumps, or flakes
- Shiny, smooth, gel-like appearance
- Comfortable and non-irritating
- Very natural looking

Cons:
- No noticeable lift or curl
- Doesn’t add very much length
- Smudges easily

Overall, I think this mascara is great, especially if you suffer from dry eyes!

Currently, this is the only mascara my eyes can tolerate, so even though I wish it gave me a little bit more length, I’m just so grateful that I can finally wear some form of eye makeup again! :)

title: Love Derma-nu
text:
Hyaluronic Acid? I never knew what it was until recently :) sounds like something you use in the brakes on your car. hyaluronic acid (also known as hyaluronan) is a glycosaminoglycan, a type of molecule composed partly of sugars. Hyaluronic acid is actually a natural structural component of skin, and, in fact, is present in connective tissue throughout the human body.

The awesome thing about Hydrolic Acid is its ability to retain moisture; it’s considered to have a greater capacity to hold moisture than any other natural or synthetic polymer. In fact, one gram of hyaluronic acid is able to hold up to six liters of water. The hallmarks of youthful skin is its moisture content. A dried up face will age you quicker then anything.

Hyaluronic acid can improve your skin’s moisture content and at the same time strengthen skin’s barrier; that is, the outer layers of your skin. A healthy barrier looks and feels softer, smoother, and plumper. This does all of that. Sense menopause I have suffered from dry skin. This has made a big difference in how my face looks and feels. Thank you Derma-nu for another 5 star product and Thank you for letting me try this at a reduced rate for my hoest review

I received this in a monthly sample box and thought... really, deodorant? Ok, so it initially wasn't the most exciting thing to receive, but wow!!! It turned out to be my favorite sample so far, and the only one that I've purchased a full-size product of. I agree with another reviewer- if you forget to apply 1 day, the application from the day before still keeps you fresh as can be! The sample stick that I received was rougher than your average slick, chemical-laden deodorant, but I'll take that any day over animal testing, harsh chemicals or animal byproducts! The full-size stick that I purchased from Blissoma is very smooth though! I read that they reformulated a bit to make it softer, so keep that in mind when reading older reviews ;)

Thank you Blissoma for making such a wonderful product!!!

title: Zero Scent!
text:
I got this Nail Polish Remover 100% Natural for a friend who loves nail polish and has a little girl and is always changing colors. She's trying to live a healthy lifestyle so I thought this would make for a nice addition. I love that all the ingredients are natural and it's safe for children. The instructions were easy to follow but not the fastest way to remove polish (especially glitter polish). It's fastest so soak a cotton ball with remover and hold onto the nail.

Yes it does take longer than standard nail polish but it's worth it knowing you aren't using chemicals. The best part? ZERO scent. I know for many nail polish remover is an awful smell and can cause headaches so this is a nice alternative for those who are sensitive to scent!

title: Why pay more?
text: This is a really nice powder countour kit. I was perfect for me because I love makeup but wasn't sure I was going to love the whole "contouring craze". So, I guess you would say it's a beginners kit, countour kits can get really expensive. It has six colors which are all very similar to the popular Anastasia contour kit but half the price. My skin runs fair to medium throughout the year so I can use 4 of the colors and the darker colors I just use for eye-shadow, usually in my crease as a blending color so nothing gets wasted. The banana color is great for brow bone highlighting. I love that the individual colors are magnetized and pop out so if you use a Z palatte (or a cheap dupe here; [[ASIN:B004SMPK6A ArtBin Sew-Lutions Slim Line Magnetic Box-Translucent Raspberry-6905AB]] you can pop whatever colors you use out and put in there instead of taking the whole palatte. It's nice to have the whole thing though because it has a nice big mirror. It also snaps closed so the lid isn't flopping around in your makeup bag and the powders getting gouged which I like a lot. I really have nothing but good things to say about this kit. If you are looking for high end cream makeup this isn't it but the colors blend nicely and look great so you will be the only one who knows you are using a cheaper brand! I received a complimentary sample of the product for evaluation purposes. All opinions are my own

They seem well put together, there were no loose hairs. They also came with a description of each brush and how to use it. They are well balanced and I LOVE the case they come in. It's really cute and perfect for rolling up when you travel! I would definitely recommend these brushes.

My one complaint is the toxic smell when you first open them up however they arrived while I was home on my lunch break so I left them open on the counter and by the time I returned home that night I couldn't smell a thing.

title: Great formula. Very dense pigments. Would buy again...and have.
text:
I really like these stamping polishes.
The pigmentation is amazing, they apply well, and dry fast. They don't smudge if you wait for them to dry and then use a decent top coat.
The only thing I dislike, is the flakiness of the stamping polish around the nail bed, when it dries. It can be messy. Which is why a latex protector may help with clean up. But that's no big deal. Once all is said and done, a quick acetone cleanup or even a hand washing can remove the excess...and once I'm more experienced at application, it may get easier to avoid too. I admit I'm fairly new with stamping. And I would absolutely not remove a star for that anyway!
It does what is says. It applies great and looks amazing. It picks up beautiful with every stamper I have...about 10 different heads and 7 different styles of stamper. So, I'd say it's a good product.
I'd but them again and recommend them to anyone who's into stamping!

Update:
Using it a few more times has shown that I just needed practice...it's amazing. Stamps beautifully. I'll add pics. The mess that isn't caught my latex skin protection, can easily be washed away after nails are top coated and completely dry, or with acetone and a brush. I love these stamping polishes from BMC. I've bought 3 sets of them now. The pics I'm uploading include black stamping polish from this set, and purple (amethyst) stamping polish from another set.

title: Great product. Pretty color purple. Good price. Great for nail art!!!
text:
I got this to try as a cheaper alternative for liquid Latex nail protector. It arrived quickly. It IS absolutely a much more cost effective alternative for buying the tiny bottles individually. And this company has lots of color options too.

What I did:
I received it and immediately painted it around a nail bed to test it's effectiveness. And since, I've compared it's coverage/ease of use/removability to a product that is intended for nail use (a liquid palisade product).
Results are:
it works EXACTLY the same. No harder or easier to use. So, if someone uses liquid Latex for nail art protection already, this IS absolutely a great alternative!!! Once I knew it would work great, I got out an empty nail polish bottle and used a little mini funnel and poured it in. I also decided to spice it up with glitter, like some of the more popular liquid Latex for nails companies have done...and it works perfectly still, and looks more exciting, and is amazing!
Verdict:
I will continue to buy this as my nail art protection. The other items (that are intended for nail art) work great for the same thing, but this is a cheaper and much more customizable option... which I like!
Keep in mind, you can use any empty polish bottles... just clean them out thoroughly first. The glitter is completely optional...but if you do use it, I recommend ONLY using the cosmetic grade glitters...craft glitters are just too cheap and they bleed and curl and ruin the stuff they get submerged in. And any tiny funnel would help you get it into a different container.

I attached photos.
The pics include:
The actual product. What I used to "make" it easily applicable for nails. What it looks like when immediately applied, once dried (which dries to a darker shade), and how easy it is to remove with no residue!

So, I say, this is a great option for nail art enthusiasts like me, and this product would probably also work for other latex uses (like it is shown on the bottle). So, for my liquid latex needs, I'll go to this product from now on.

title: Solid versatility for travel
text:
This solidly built, fast-heating combination curling iron and straightener works with both U.S. and European voltage, with the appropriate plug adapter. It does a very good job on my very stubborn hair too, thanks to the adjustable temperature (marked in Celsius) and seems to be very sturdy. Comes with a little velvet drawstring case for travel. I haven't yet had the chance to test it with European voltage, but expect to soon and will update if there are any issues.

I especially like the fact that there is an automatic shutoff for safety, and the tool takes only seconds to come to temperature.

If I have one small quibble, it's that it's a bit thicker and bulkier than either the straightener or curling iron I normally use, which isn't as convenient for packing, but since this is a two-in-one tool, it's definitely worthy of the space it takes.

I like big hair! Yep. I'm one of those. I love big curly hair with lots of fun volume. While these pieces did a better than average job of fulfilling that need, it wasn't completely up to my expectations. Would have liked a bit more volume. But if you are not a big hair nut -- then these should do the trick quite nicely. I'm new to the "wig game" and don't know much about caring for them, but these were pretty easy to style. Just spritz some wig conditioner on it and comb it out with your fingers or a wig comb and presto! It's back to it's original beauty.

title: Favorite Palette Ever!!
text:
I purchased this product in a store, but I am such a fan I had to write a review. Ever since I purchased this palette, it has been my go-to for everyday makeup. I am fair-skinned with dark hair and hazel eyes, and the colors are perfect. I don't always use every color in a palette and I don't always place the colors as directed, but in this case, Stila knows what they are talking about!

The large color on the left is your all-over base, and I apply that first. Next, I go to the top right corner and apply this grayish color from crease to browbone. Third, I take the darkest color and place it quite heavily (but narrowly) in the crease and a little in the corner and lash line. Next, I put the highlight (lightest) color just under the brow and also outside the inner corner of the eye. Finally, I put the shimmery gold-like color in the middle across the lid and blend all the colors with a blending brush. I use the darker blush normally, but use the light one as a highlight if I want the added effect. I love that when I am doing my makeup on the run, I only have to grab this one container and my makeup brushes (I have the EcoTools Eye Enhancing Duo Brush set with four tips on two brushes, so even there you don't have to take as much with you).

The quality of the product is excellent and it blends well. Other than the darkest brown, the eyeshadow pigments are not super intense, so you can go light or apply more for a deeper intensity.

title: so much smaller than the description
text:
when i bought this I was considering this or one of the all in one handheld. glad I went with this.
As you can see in the picture,this is much more compact than the photos the company provides. Not super compact but fits on my bathroom counter nicely.
For setup, charge first. You have to take the cable out of the back to get it to work. The tank looks pretty small, but it goes a long way. I use this about every other night and I have not recharged the battery or added more water except when I wanted the water to be warm. I have sensitive gums and the warm water seems to be less harsh than cold water.
I have stayed on the lowest setting and it gets out a lot of gunk. This will make a mess! if you close your mouth then you are pretty good but if you open your mouth water goes everywhere. there is a button on the handle to turn the water off (maybe I will use it when i clean my teeth).
this is pretty loud when you run it, not sure if i would want to use it with other people too close. but if you want to travel with this, its pretty compact and has a little carry bag. most of the items store in the lid so that is pretty handy.
if you have been looking for a water pik type device, give this a try. use if for a couple weeks and see what you think!

title: good soap, disappointing variety
text:
I've loved Primal Elements soap since I was a kid, but it's expensive to try by buying full bars, and they keep raising the price of this sampler, which they used to call a grab bag and charge a bargain price for (since it's the end slabs they can't sell as full bars), and they keep filling them with a grossly disproportionate number of Christmas soaps.

I ordered 3 samplers direct from their website when they offered a special in mid October, and 10 out of 23 soaps that came were Christmas-themed, and 2 of those were duplicates (2 each of Rudy and Skyward). Another 2 of the non-Christmas soaps were also duplicates (2 each of Primal IPA and Paw Prints). The Primal IPAs weren't even in different boxes - they were stuck together, right next to each other, in the same box. (If you're going to bill this as a sampler rather than a bargain pack, and as gift-worthy, at least make sure the soaps within a box are distinct!) Though it's early-mid autumn, there was not a single autumn scent.

When I've ordered in the past (whether through them, or Amazon, or RockinGifts), there was a similarly disproportionate amount of Christmas soap, except when I ordered in mid-late spring and got floral stuff instead of Christmas. I've never had luck getting autumn or "oriental" soaps in these packs no matter when in the year I order. This is probably the last time I buy a sample pack unless they add an option to pick the scents included.

title: Great polish and great deal! Even you get repeats!
text:
UPDATE 5/3/21: Got my second shipment today. All in tact! And great color selection!

This is a really great deal. If it is packaged right. The first time, unfortunately the bottles arrived smashed due to poor packaging. This is not the vendors fault as it was shipped by Amazon. I told them about it and they gave me a full refund. I really wish they would take a little more care when shipping. Hopefully my next round will go better.
**UPDATE** 5/3/21: Got my second shipment today. All in tact! And great color selection!
This is my guilty pleasure. It is definitely like gambling. But once every month or so I take the chance and roll the dice. Some times I get colors I do not have and other times I get 4 of the same. But guess what!?! You can mix these colors and get something that you like. That is what I do. I have mixed some shimmery colors with solids and came out with a beautiful shade that didn't exist before! And for around $1 each it is such a great deal!!! Dollar store price but top salon quality. This polish has been discontinued which is really sad because it is my favorite by far. It goes on smooth, love the wide brush and consistency. It helps my nails grow and keeps them healthy and protected. Also it lasts forever. I mean the polish in the bottle will last forever. Like no expiration date. I have some that I have had for over 10 years and they still glide like they were new.

** This is copy of my review from same product but bought different times and vendors***

This a great price for 20 polishes. Buying them in the store would be like $6 or $7. I have to admit this is my favorite guilty pleasure. It is like gambling lol. For around $1 a polish this is such a fun way to try new colors!

I absolutely love this polish. I have used it for years. The nice thing about these polishes is that even after years they still perform as well as the new ones. I love how easy it is to apply. If I am in a hurry, one coat is fine. I like to take my time with my nails so I have steps (below). I like to change my polish every week so chipping isn’t a problem for me. Also I wear gloves when I do dishes or clean to extend the life of my nails.
I love that this polish dries fairly quickly if you don’t put it on too thick. I mean, put on a coat while watching TV or on the PC. Careful not to touch anything! But let it dry thoroughly.
Then if you need a little more tint slap a little thin layer to make it pop. Also here are couple tips I learned through my years of doing my nails:

1. Use the SH Complete Care 7in1 or 170 Clear'd for takeoff as a base coat. (I am pretty sure that is why it’s called that... It makes sense to me) I know they say you don’t need one with this polish, but really it is for easier removal. It makes your life so much easier! Especially with darker colors that seem to get in the creases and under your nail that are a pain to remove.

2. Use a white polish (121 let’s snow for example) under any color to make that color really pop. You don’t need a really thick coat of white either. Just enough to give a canvas for the bright color to pop.

3. This polish is a little thick so mind that when you apply it. Put one streak down the middle of your nail (your first application to each nail) this will be a little thicker then go to each side and touching the outskirts of the middle line to grab some of the excess there to spread to the sides.

4. I use Sally Hansen Salon Manicure Top Coat as well to seal the color in if I am not using a Salon Manicure Glitter Overcoat. I think they both help preserve the color.

4b. I know glitter can be intimidating because it’s such a pain to get off. Don’t let that deter you. If you like the look of glitter go for it! There are polish removers designed for that now. As well as the polish remover in the jar that you put your finger in to remove color. There is one that has little ridges (or brushes) inside the center wall that help strip the glitter. Can’t tell you where or who. But I can say you probably have one in your town.

5. For those of you that like a little shiny nail but not necessarily color. I use the 170 Clear’d for takeoff and add some drops of any sheer color (Arm Candy, Sheer Ecstasy, Sweet Talker, Shell We Dance, Pink Slip) it just looks like a natural nail with clear polish only it hides blemishes! And your nails look super awesome! I get compliments all the time about how healthy my nails look when I do that.

I hope these tips help. These are things I have learned over the years. I love doing nails and I am glad to share the things I have discovered to save someone else some frustration or time.

title: Great product!
text:
This stuff is great for Making Cannabis Tincture. Great price for a gallon anywhere online and also anywhere in store. I filled 3 huge jars and still have a bunch left for next time. This is also Kosher.

My tincture instructions:

Fill jars with leaf matter
Fill with Glycerine Tincture
Leave a little space at the top.

Screw on Caps. Mark dates on top of caps.

Leave for 60 Days.

Put jars in the over for 20-60 Minutes on 100 degrees Fahrenheit ( some people argue to do this first. )

Filter out Leaf matter with cheesecloth and funnel into dropper bottles.

title: A Wonderful Time Saving Device
text: I am SO thankful that this product was created! They took a hair straightener and a brush and combined it into one simple and super easy step! Since I was born with a tremor, the shaking of my hands would cause me to burn myself often whenever I straightened my hair. Thanks to this straightening brush and it's super cool bristle tips, I haven't burned myself once when using it. On days that my hands are extra shaky, I use the gloves that were provided with this brush, so can be extra careful not to burn myself. The design of this brush is beautiful. I can't imagine one could be any better. The rose color is really nice. One feature that I like about the brush that I've never seen on a product of it's type is the fact that you are able to watch it heat up to whatever temperature you prefer. It takes only seconds for it to reach the temperature you set it on. Another pro about this brush is the negatively charged ions. When using a hair tool that emits negatively charged ions, they cause bunches of H2O molecules to break down into small ones, which helps the device to work better and faster. This is SO much better on your hair. It also seals the hair's cuticle which calms frizz and flyaways. The brush comes with a pair of heat resistant gloves, 2 hair clips, a cleaning brush, all in a nice box. I keep the brush and all of the parts stored, conveniently, in the box. I have no regrets about getting this brush. I included  pictures without me wearing any makeup nor did I put ANY hair products on my hair. I ONLY used the brush. I highly recommend it. Please excuse my terrible hair cut. I hope that my review was helpful to you!

title: Super Unique & Convenient Little Bag
text: I have no idea why anyone would give this product a low rating. I find this product quite useful and very unique. I'm telling you, it is super handy to have. On the inside, there are mesh pockets on either side so you can be super organized and find your things with ease! No more digging around and finding every other item in your bag except the one your digging for. I love the little handle it has. It's so easy to grab this bag and be on your way! I also, love that it doesn't look like every other little bag you may find. I love the material it is made of and the little logo on the front couldn't be any cuter! With this bag, I am able to keep my on the go items such as my makeup, feminine items, as well as, some of the things I may need for my daughter on  go. I am very satisfied with this bag. Overall all, I would say this is one super convenient, uniquely cute little bag and I am glad to have been able to purchase it!

title: Ready to change your bathroom game?
text:

How to use: take a small pea sized amount and put it on the TP. Wipe. I use this after initial wipe to ensure what this does is remove all residue and leave behind a clean, fresh tush.
This cream does not have a heavy scent and is transportable - you can carry in your bag because we all know emergencies happen. A little goes a long way so expect this to last awhile. I’ve had this several weeks and it’s going strong. What I anticipate will be a problem will be getting to the bottom of the tube. I’ll cross that bridge when I get to it.
Price at time of this review is 25USD which some may find steep but perfectly normal for the ingredients and the use you get from the tube.

title: I like this heated eye mask
text:
I like this heated eye mask, for the most part, I especially like that it exists in the first place! I was searching Amazon up and down for a heated eye mask that can be worn like a sleeping eye mask to relax my eye muscles after sitting at a computer all day when I finally came across this one. I don't care for the color or the kitty design, but the purple material is velvety soft which I do like.

The mask easily covers my head, though I do have a small head, and the strap fits around the back of my head pretty well. I do choose to wear my hair up at night when I use this heating mask otherwise the strap slides up my straight fine hair slowly if I move my head from side to side. And I somehow never wake up with it on, though I'm thinking that has much more to do with me removing it during the middle of the night vs a product error.

The power cord is composed of two pieces, the first has one end with a USB and the other as a round female piece. Connected to the mask on the right side is the other piece of the cord. This piece has a male round piece and connects perfectly to the female piece. I imagine this design is intended to allow the cord connected to the mask to easily be pulled out if the person moves during sleep.

I plug the cord right into my USB-hub with my phone charger and it works perfectly well.

The controls on this are odd, and you are provided zero instructions. There are two buttons I believe one is a (-) that is indented and the other is a (+) that is raised if my memory serves me right. You have to keep one side pressed down until the unit turns on, then I press the indented button because the numbers go up to 60 on this side. The numbers displaced are bizarre and I have no idea what unit of measurement they are - though degrees Celcius makes the most sense.

The one thing I wish this product had was sewn in contours for the nose and eye sockets so it was able to lay more flush with your eyes. This would allow your eyes to feel a more direct heat. Usually, to counterbalance this I place one of my arms over the heating mask to apply weight and increase the intensity of the heat.

title: Well made, leak-free bottles for a healthier, greener lifestyle
text:
Since becoming a mom, I've been trying to live a greener, less toxic lifestyle. I've started cloth diapering & using un-paper towels. I've switched to natural body & laundry products. However, for some reason, I had been holding out on switching to chemical free cleaning and fabric/air fresheners. I'm not exactly sure why I was so hesitant. These bottles made making the switch fun and easy!

These bottles have both a mist and a stream spray option, as well as an option to turn off the spraying mechanism. Currently, I have one bottle filled with a 1:1 ratio of water to vinegar for use as glass cleaner. The mist option works well on my mirrors and shower doors. The mist option also works very well for both my homemade room/linen spray and my pest repellent spray. (Peppermint essential oil diluted with water and sprayed on the baseboards/around door and windows.) I use the direct stream option for my tub and tile cleaner. It works very well for spraying directly onto the grout.

At 16oz, the bottles are substantial but are not heavy in hand. The trigger is easy to squeeze, yet not flimsy. The glass itself is a gorgeous, deep cobalt blue. I keep my homemade air freshener in one of these bottles on the bathroom counter and have been asked multiple times about where I got it. They really are just so very pretty. Too pretty to be hidden under the sink like most other air freshener or cleaning supply bottles.

Often times, when you purchase cleaners from the store in inexpensive plastic bottles with these same mechanisms, the spray head tends to leak after a week or two of use. It never fails. These, however, are sturdy and seem to be much more heavy duty. I've used these bottles nearly daily and have not had any leaks whatsoever. As beautiful as these bottles are, this is what impressed me most. I'm extremely happy with this product and would highly recommend them!

*I received a discount for this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.*

title: Love the way this worked on my very kinky curly hair
text:
After shampooing and conditioning my hair, I used this One N Only Brazilian Tech Keratin Smoothing lotion with the One N Only Brazilian Tech Keratin Leave In Treatment on my damp hair and then blow dried it straight with a round brush. I then flat ironed my hair in small sections and the results were wonderful. My hair had bounce and shine and held up even in 90 degree humid weather with drizzling rain. Normally, my hair would have frizzed out and been puffy. Didn't happen though; my hair remained bouncy and straight. Just what I wanted!

As a side note - I separated my hair into about 6 sections and applied the smoothing lotion, then brushed it through with a wide-toothed rubber bristle brush. I then sprtized the leave in treatment throughout my hair. After I did that, I was worried that I messed up by combining the two products because my hair felt like it had a film on it. I was anxious that would make my hair dull. But it didn't at all. After blow drying and flat ironing my hair, it was shiny and soft.

I'm happy with the One N Only Brazilian Tech products and will definitely continue using them.

Fast and deep cleansing these are ideal for the whole family. Plus, the pads are small and not overly saturated so you don't get messy using them.

title: Fun flavors!
text:
First, I did find these to be thinner than my original coconut glossy. They still add shine and a ton of sweet flavor, but go on a little heavy out of the tube.
The texture after it settles is nice, shiny and not drying. The scents are fantastic, true to the super sweet scents of my much younger years.
It's a fun way to mix up my lip balms!

title: Solid face cream in a tube!
text:
First, the solid cream is solid. At first application I tried just putting it on my face directly from the tube and stopped almost immediately because I did not want to tug at my skin. Instead, I did the bar method of application by using my fingers on the top to warm it and then tapped it onto my skin. The next morning I let it sit on my cheek an extra moment and was apply to seamlessly apply with little to no tugging.
It's a a balm texture from the tube, but then melts into an almost oil/cream. While I find it takes a little for the oils to fully settle onto the skin once they do, I don't find it to be greasy or heavy.
I put this under my SPF in the morning like a serum, and it doesn't pill or bunch up or affect my sunscreen or makeup application after.
At night it's just the right amount of moisture to keep my skin happy and balanced. I have not had any break outs. There is no noticeable scent, neither on opening, applying or after wearing.
If you are new to solid face creams, serums, etc. give this a little time to find the right balance of how much, how long.
The price for the amount is a great value, and I really like the brands ecologically sound stance. I've been a fan of their haircare and am happy to branch out into the skin and face care.

title: Cheap and dark
text:
This mascaras is worth the price, a set of two for under 10? Go for it. It's not overly sticky, though the consistency is weird and rubbery coming out of the tube.
It goes on dark, dries quickly and doesn't smudge. Does it really lengthen? Eh. Not really for me. But, it's not messy or flaky.
I don't know if I will repurchase, but the price point is good.

title: Stars Aligned
text:
This adorable star clip set my hair game bar so high that after wearing it I have no where to go but down.
It held my hair up comfortably all day, and I have a thick amount of hair. It also held up my daughters without any issue.
It's distinctive shape is so much cuter than the typical claw clip.
Highly recommend!!!

title: Sesame Street Bubble Bath
text:
This is a great bubble bath, soft silky bubbles, long lasting and the scent is really pretty. Not overly strong, and super gentle on my toddlers skin.
Happy bath times = happy me!

title: Fancy Flair
text:
This is a very comfortable headband, it does not have any under grip however and does slip a little. But, it's worth the minor adjustments when wearing.
Very sparkly, this gives off everyday princess vibes. Plenty of color to match just about anything, and arrived without any missing crystals or pokey spots,
Well made and pretty!!

title: Cleansing Pads
text:
I adore these makeup remover rounds. They are the perfect size for a clean face, or even just to remove my eye makeup. No getting water everywhere, no harsh chemicals or cleansers, and there is plenty in this set so that I can just use and wash a new one each time.
They are very soft, but don't let that mislead you. Add some water, and wipe away the day. Flip it to the longer side and buff and exfoliate. Super soft, super clean skin - zero irritations.
Highly recommend and will never be using disposable face wipes again!

title: Super Convienent!
text:
I wasn't expecting to love these nearly as much as I do. Thick, large and easily removes all ten nails worth of polish without making my fingers feel overly dried out like using my regular polish remover.
Because they are all individually sealed I can keep one in my bag for any polish removing emergencies, which trust me... they happen.
These work fast, I don't know what makes the formula 'advanced' but the process is quick and clean.
The smell isn't overwhelming, just the basic remover smell. Works great, travels even better. I'll be keeping these on hand!

title: Dermaplaning-tastic
text:
These are some pretty fantastic razors. They are straight edged, but the provided safety edging prevents me from nicking myself while keeping the blade close to my skin.
It removes peach fuzz quickly, efficiently. My skin is super smooth for about a week after use. My makeup goes on like butter, and I am convinced my moisturizers and serums also work better on my dermaplaned skin.
They are small and precision enough that I can use them around my eyebrows, though I go slow and don't usually use them for that.
But for my upper lip, chin, cheeks and forehead I don't know how I got by before these. While my easy to use electric is nice, these are so much closer. Will be a faithful weekly user!

title: Super little facial masks!
text:
I wasn't sure what to expect from these compressed facial masks in terms of quality, as reviews were across the board. But, they far exceeded my needs and expectations!
They are about the size of three dimes stacked, and are embossed with little flowers on top, which is really just a pretty presentation.
They expand easily with moisture, I mixed up my own serum solution with essential oil, and it was easy to soak and unfold. I worried I would have to be super delicate so as not to tear the paper, but these are more of a fabric than tissue.
In fact, I opened one up to test it's durability. I used some warm water, added some dish soap and went to town scrubbing my basin. No tears, no ripping, no holes. (In fact it cleaned up really well). I used some extra pulling pressure on the cut parts, mouth, eyes chin, and as expected had tears and stretching happen, but that was with abnormal applied pressure.
They didn't smell, they didn't feel weird, and they fit great. For the relaxing usage of a home facial these little compact masks are perfect. I know exactly what I'm putting on my face.

title: Flawless Foundation
text:
My friend recommended this Touch in Sol Flawless skin top coat, and I am so glad she did.
It is really more of a foundation, it has perfect medium coverage. It feels amazing on my skin, light and silky smooth. It leaves me looking matte, but not dry. It's surprisingly radiant.
I use it over the Touch in Sol primer, without setting powder, and it easily lasts the whole day.
So, here I am recommending it to you! Try it! It's amazing!

title: High 3 stars
text:
This is actually a decent palette of eyeshadows. They are not super pigmented, but very easy to work with. This is a very nice beginner palette, especially for the under 10 price.
That said, these need a primer. They last an okay amount of time, but will fade quickly if you don’t use a primer.
Simple cardboard container, very similar to colourpop and bh, but doesn’t have a mirror. Still it’s sturdy and all the pans arrived unbroken!
The shades are arranged nicely, it really has a visual appeal, and makes choosing an eye look easier.
It’s realky not bad, and while my tastes typically run towards the more luxury and pigmented, this is a good entry for a beginner or lighter makeup user.
I will be looking into other palettes by this brand.

title: Soft hair, smells great!
text:
This leave in hair remedy from AG smells wonderful, like a sweet and spicy scent. While it applies strong, it dissipated and left behind a soft clean spicy smell.
It worked really well, and was best when I used it after a work out on damp hair vs dry or showered.
It’s a nice product in my easy care hair Arsenal, I will be picking it up again for my gym bag for sure!

title: Comfy curls
text:
These are an inexpensive and fairly comfortable way to roll my hair at night. It makes getting up and being ready to go in the morning much faster, since all I have to do is unroll, give a spray and shake - and bam waves for days.
However, the quality is decent but not great, one of the rollers looked like it was left out side and got chewed on. But, 1 out of 30 (I counted them) is still good odds for the price.
They came in the matching clear blue zipper bag, and are easy to store. I'd happily purchase another set.

title: I wanted to love these, but the smells....
text: I love a relaxing bath in fall and winter, and I purchased these bath salts about six months ago. Some pros are that I like the milky options, they make the bath feel a little more luxurious, and the placebo effect of the milkiness makes me think the salts are actually doing something significant (I dont really think they are, but that's not really the reason I use them anyway). The colors are kind of fun, although the yellow looks a little too similar to dehydrated urine. The huge con for me is the smells are so overtly chemical. They smell like bad laundry detergent. The smell is heavily concentrated when you first pour, as it fills the air of your bathroom with its harsh chemical smell. This subsides a little after a while, but the fake synthetic chemical smell doesn't really relax me. I was looking for something to smell gentle and natural, like the descriptions evoke (I used the camera feature on Google Translate to decipher them). I wouldn't buy these again--I think I'm looking for something a bit more sophisticated in scent.

title: Different..... but nice
text:
Definitely softens the beard and calms the itch. Cuts down on "beardruff" by moisturizing the face. Its a fairly light oil, not real greasy or 'heavy'. Now for the smell...

... The first time you put this on it may seem strong and even a bit overpowering to some, like many new unfamiliar scents. Keeping in mind it goes on the face near the nose, the scent initially comes off stronger than it actually is. My wife loves it, saying its subtle and masculine. After a few applications, I quickly became accustomed to the smell.

I'm prefer to be outdoors, and if I had my way, I'd smell like campfire smoke 365 days a year. That being said, I wanted an outdoorsy smell, nothing too sweet, citrus or floral. The Canoeist beard oil smells like birch and cedar. It also has grassy undertones, similar to alfalfa hay, with notes of rosemary and/or sandalwood. Make sense with vetiver being a grass and all.

Ingredients as listed on bottle.... grape seed oil, vetiver essential oil, cedarwood essential oil, birch essential oil, and vitamin E oil.

I have my own landscaping business, and love the smell of fresh cut grass, which I often smell like anyway. This scent isn't too far off from that fresh cut grass smell. Thanks for reading.

SPO

title: PROS and CONs
text:
I’ve been single-blade shaving for about 5 years. I enjoy trying out different blades and soaps. This is one of my stand-byes so I can recommend this soap.

1. SHAVE: EXCELLENT. Mitchell’s is very slick and leaves very little tendency to cut or scrape. It results in a close, smooth shave in two passes. Most premium soaps result in a good-to-excellent shave.

2. SKIN: EXCELLENT. This product contains lanolin and results in the very best and softest after-shave experience of any soap I’ve tried. Most premium soaps result in a fair-to-good experience for me.

3. VERSATILITY: GOOD. Some soaps seem to shave very well with one brand of blade and not others. Mitchell’s doesn’t seem to mind. I use ASTRA and generally sharp blades.

4. LATHER: FAIR. This soap deposits easily onto a wet badger brush, sufficient to lather onto the skin and shave well. It does not whip into a full thick lather if that is important to you. It is also reputed (I have no direct experience) to be difficult to lather at all if you have hard water.

5. LATHER DURABILITY: GOOD. The lather on the brush lasts OK during the shave. Easily enough for two passes.

6. PUCK DURABILITY: EXCELLENT. I tend to rotate among several brands of soap, and most milled soaps collect enough water from the brush to decay and dry out somewhat before the puck is finished. Mitchell’s lasts to the end.

8. VALUE: FAIR. Mitchell’s is priced about the same as other premium milled soaps. However, if it is sold as a bare replacement puck so you will need a shaving bowel or other container.

title: It's a groomer, not a haircutter
text: The item has the attachments to cut hair but it is not designed for full-on haircuts.  It's to keep you groomed between haircuts so you don't have to go as often, hence it being called a groomer. Also, if you're having trouble charging it, that's because you're not likely following what it says right in the instructions...it must be charged for a FULL 24 hours before the first use.  Do this, and it works fine. The neckline trimmer is a godsend.  My neck hair grows faster than that on my head so this does nicely for a neckshave when I don't really need a haircut yet.  Professional haircuts are getting too expensive everywhere to go in every 3-4 weeks when you don't need a full cut but do need a touch-up.  This does the trick in that respect.  The nose hair attachment works fine...again, the idea is not to get to the point where the hair is so long and thick that it doesn't work.  Groom it, keep up with it as it grows.  That's what this thing is for.  I have misplaced one of the attachments, unfortunately, so will be buying a new one but this does a a great job, better than the bigger, bulkier products out there.

title: it might be fun to pay a little more than I would if ...
text:
I got this set because I was curious about the spiral thingies and figured, for the price, it might be fun to pay a little more than I would if I was just buying the spirals elsewhere and have some stuff to play around with. Most of the items turned out to be pretty meh, so now I'm the proud owner of spiral thingies and some clutter.

Pros:
The spiral bun holders are great - both for holding my hair up in a neat bun and for putting my hair in before bed. If I wear them to bed (on not totally dry hair), I'll have nice waves when I take them out in the morning.

I like the medium size donut hair thing too. These are super easy to make out of an extra sock. So... maybe not worth buying.

Cons:
I ended up getting excited about the the 'topsy tail' things - but they both broke. I put my hair in a pony tail, wrapped some of my hair around the elastic to hide it, and was using the little topsy tail thing to pull that bit of hair back through the elastic / pony tail holder when it snapped. So I tried doing the same thing with the bigger one and it snapped too. There's always room for user error, but it seems like these guys should have been able to withstand pulling some hair through a pony tail / pony tail holder.

The rest of the set is pretty meh and/or useless.

Overall, though I like it and would likely buy another when this one wears out.

title: Coolest. Thinnest. Most Stretchable!
text:
These are the most stretchable & comfortable. My head size is larger & my hair thick, so these are almost the best. They are also thinner & cooler.
However, the fabric color looks much lighter when stretched & the buttons are a little smaller than I prefer. But what I took 1 star off for was the fact that the buttons are too far back on the band, which makes the mask way too tight on my face. Also, if you have a small, petite head with flat hair, you might find that these do not stay in place like 1 reviewer stated.
I have many 1 inch bright colored buttons which I have sewn on other headbands, so I will try to sew some about 2 inches forward on these. The problem with the thicker cotton ones are that they are too small, tight, uncomfortable & do not stretch as much, feeling like your head is in a vice. Not this one.

title: Comfortable on larger heads!
text:
I love these because they come in several pretty colors, go with any of my scrubs & adjust to larger heads nicely.
On the loosest setting, the buttons fall above & slightly in front of my ears. That's exactly where I want them because not only are most masks too hot, tight & uncomfortable, but they make my feel like I'm trying to breathe while someone is holding a pillow over my face. So, these actually help me to breathe also. I just wish they also offered wider adjustable headbands with buttons also. Most wide headbands are just too tight & painful on me.

title: 99J, How to use as top piece
text:
99J is a much darker red than pictured, but a very beautiful color. Even my pics look too light, almost auburn & not the very deep burgundy or black cherry color I received. At first glance, this appears unusable due to the very large seam showing in back & I almost sent it back. But I sprayed on liquid hair gel at the roots, teased it with my fingers, & used hair dryer heat to make the roots stick straight up, giving them lift, & also making the hair also flip backwards, which seemed impossible to do at first glance. I have now managed to cover that awful seam, transformed it from stiff, flat & boring to full, natural-looking & silky with no seams showing anywhere.
I may order another one to color a little lighter to wear when my red shade fades. I will take a pic of what it first looks like. I have colored many hair pieces, sometimes lightening them first with a color remover like color zap. I also curl them to match my own hair. Will attach styled pics of front, top, back, & underneath. I also saw online a spray-on color in dark red for roots that might help camouflage the seam.

title: Full & beautiful!!
text:
This is a good quality full-looking scrunchie, I twist my long hair together, clip it to the top of my head, pull it up through the center & attach the scrunchie to the top of my head with small tortoise-shell clips (red-brown in hair color) on each side which can easily be concealed in the hair. It is comfortable & stays in place through a 12hr shift. Since I wear this on top of my head, it conceals my thinning hair in front & on top of my head. I blend it over my bangs in front. These are great for work & in hot weather to keep longer hair securely & comfortably off of your neck. I have also used larger plastic hairpins to also help comfortably secure these. I need larger scrunchies like this due to hair loss & a big head. It is not made to fit tightly over a ponytail.
I actually bought this color knowing it would not match my hair, which is a burgundy/brown shade, not too bright. I have been experimenting in coloring synthetic hair with Speedball acrylic ink & 70% alcohol in a spray bottle (see you-tube videos). I have successfully colored this to match my own hair color, which is difficult to match. By the way, I bought 2 other Katie colors: #33 "auburn" which is actually a dark brown shade with no red in it whatsoever, & #33/130 which is a dark brown blended with a light copper color. The 2nd was pretty, but just not the red shade I wanted.

title: Cooling and Refreshing-Perfect for Summer!
text:
I must admit that I was somewhat hesitant to try this product, thinking that it would leave a greasy feeling on my skin. Not so! This cooling, soothing gel is absorbed quickly, leaving a light, refreshing fragrance behind. It is the perfect solution for those hot, summer days, especially after a shower. No matter how high the temperature (even 90+ days) there is an immediate cooling sensation that is nothing short of pure delight.

One other concern I had was that this product might result in dry skin. Again, I was pleasantly surprised. My skin feels soft, supple and hydrated. In hot weather, it beats out regular lotions hands down. I sincerely recommend this to any woman who not only wants to produce a cooling sensation on her body as the temperatures soar but also experience a gel that moisturizes without the greasiness of some lotions or the drying effects of alcohol based skin products. This is a home run for the Vaseline Intensive Care line!

title: The old familiar brand.
text: If you got a waterbed, you gotta have algaecide. This is the same brand I used starting in 1972 in my first waterbed, the same we sold at the waterbed store where I worked in the 1970s, and so it seems friendly and familiar. My household has two waterbeds currently, so it's nice to buy ten bottles at a time, so we're covered for a few years. I put a bottle in whenever I move and have to refill the beds, and also about once a year. Have never had any algae problems.

title: Highly recommend - very happy with it so far!
text: So, after purchasing, I received an email with instructions regarding how to use the product and they were very upfront that it could take up to 2 months to see results. Just received the product yesterday. I have some cellulite around my buttocks and upper thigh area. Not too bad, but definitely some dimples I don't want. I took a shower and used the product last night. The smell of it is something to get used to. Not bad, but not the best smelling thing in the world, lol. It's very smooth (and a tad greasy, but not in a gross way) and left my skin feeling very soft. Went to bed and (knowing not to expect any sudden changes) saw a dramatic reduction in dimpling in the morning! Maybe because I haven't really had cellulite until very recently, but I was very happy and surprised at how my skin looked and felt this morning. Even if it didn't help with cellulite (which it obviously did), I would use it for the simple fact of how awesome it makes my skin feel. Applied some more this morning...we'll see how it goes from here!

title: It’s OK
text: I’m not crazy about this shampoo. I was using tresemme’s keratin shampoo & conditioner previously, but I’m now pregnant so I wanted something a little more natural. I’m white, my hair is on the thicker side, it’s natural state is frizzy/somewhat wirey and wavy, my scalp is fairly dry - not to the point of dandruff, but it takes a few days for my hair to look dirty usually. I can get it to curl great in the summer and it straightens well in the winter. The tresemme stuff was perfect for the winter, I could get up to 4 days with straightened hair, no frizz or oily hair at all. I get a day or two less with this stuff before the dandruff sets in and it looks oily. It feels like it strips my hair of oils, so I can’t get my fingers smoothly through it when wet (before the conditioner) or even when dry and straightened, and my hair frizzes more easily. It does have a pleasant but mild scent. I also feel like I have to use way more to get the same effects while washing. It’s just passing the mark as acceptable for me. I’m only using this because I am pregnant, I look forward to going back to my “poison” shampoo as soon as this kid is out!

title: My confidence is back!
text:
For as long as I can remember I have suffered from excessive sweating; it was eating away at my confidence and causing unnecessary stress in my life. I couldn't buy any shirts that were too tight around the underarms and forget about buying shirts/sweaters/blazers that were certain colors, like gray, green, or light blue. I would sweat through three layers if that's what I was wearing that day. I sweat during the coldest winter days as well as in the summer. No deodorant worked for me; not degree, not overnight dove sport, not certain dri, not even a prescribed hyperhydrosis deodorant prescribed to me by my doctor.

I have been using Odaban for a couple weeks now, and I was finally able to wear my green blazer in public, lift my arms, and not be sweating! I can't believe how well this works. There was a two day period of slight underarm irritation but it has passed. I have changed my shower schedule around a bit but if that's all it takes, then I'm staying with this. As long as you follow the specific directions, this will work for you. I don't even use it everyday anymore, I use it MAYBE twice a week. Spend the $10.00 because this will change your life around if you suffer from hyperhydrosis.

title: We'll see how long this lasts...
text:
Provides a decent shave, particularly after the beard has been moistened as it is immediately after a shower. The question is, for how long, considering the flimsy construction of some components and the already below-specified battery life.

Things they don't describe in the mostly worthless manual:

The charging indicator is a steady red AC plug symbol.

The LCD indication at full charge is 99. A RED (not a far more intuitive GREEN) battery full symbol is shown at when the charge reaches 99.

A low battery is indicated by a flashing red AC plug symbol when the charge number on the LCD reaches 10.

Charge time was tested and found to be 82 minutes. The manual claims 60 to 90 minutes, so they got that right.

Use time is specified in the manual as 50 to 60 minutes. The run time was tested and found to be only 30 minutes in 5 minute on, five minute off intervals, just free running and not being used to shave which should further reduce the run time slightly.

The charge indicator was at 52 after 25 minutes and then rapidly dropped from that to 10 only five minutes later causing the low battery indicator to flash, so I would definitely NOT trust the charge indicator to be an accurate indication of how much shaving time you have left. They are apparently not calculating percent charge remaining and displaying it on the LCD, they are simply and far less usefully displaying percent battery VOLTAGE which drops off rapidly at what is called the battery's discharge "knee." A cheap route to take revealing that the LCD display is nothing more useful than a gimmick.

The manual states that the razor should be unplugged from the charger (this razor package does not come with an AC to USB charge adapter) when the charge number reaches 99, so I suspect this charger might not have an intelligent charger which stops the battery charge process at full charge to avoid battery damage over the long term. So, I will not put this razor on charge and just forget about it until my next shave like I can with my Norelco with its intelligent charge system.

Other information:

The space under the heads which catches the beard shavings is very small. Cleaning often will be a must. We'll see how the hinge and head locking mechanism hold up.

When opening the shaving head to clean, put a finger on it to slow its opening, otherwise it will rapidly flip open and if a razor element isn't locked into its place by its flimsy and not very intuitive to correctly replace locking ring, as it wasn't in my case, the razor element and its parts will be vigorously projected into an alternate universe. Luckily, I found all of the parts. Had I been standing over a sink, some could easily have gone down the drain. We'll see how the razor element locking rings hold up.

title: The odor is AGONY!!! Updated 03/16/2019
text:
UPDATE AS OF 03/16/2019 All the previous info still applies. Now that I am 16 days out from using this product, I want to add that my feet are STILL peeling. I have been using this type (not this particular) product for a couple of years and the entire process is always completed at least by day 12. Thus, besides the horrible odor, this product is not particularly efficient at exfoliating. So, basically there is NOTHING about it that I can recommend.

No matter how good these are at exfoliating, I cannot recommend them due to the offensive/clingy/cloying/LONGLASTING odor. I have used products like this before and there is always some odor during use...but these, well, days later after soaking my feet in baking soda water and then vinegar water, the incredibly floral+chemical odor still wafts around my head--yes, all the way from my feet! It is sickening, offensive,, and embarrassing when I am around other people. Also, the socks I put on after using this product have been washed in hot water and laundry detergent and they are just going to have to be thrown away because the odor DOES NOT come out. I threw away second set of these bootees because I cannot subject myself to the odor again no matter how badly I want my feet to be soft without rough skin. DO NOT BUY if you are sensitive to odors and/or simply do not like strong odors wafting around you for days on end.

Anything that saves time is an improvement in life quality, it's been a wise investment.

text: I have dry lips and I am always looking for something to try and soothe them.  The only positive I feel like I can give this is that I like the packaging. It is very appealing to the eye. When I actually used the product I didn't care for it. The formula is kind of thin and didn't give a very moisturizing feeling. It almost felt like putting body lotion on your lips. It also takes disgusting so getting the tiniest amount in your mouth is the worst. I haven't tried this on any other parts of my body. I may just to see how it works. Overall I'm not impressed.

title: Good quality, great for shorter hair
text:
This sleep cap is really nicely made. The color is well named, as the item I received is a deep jewel tone, like in a peacock's feather. It's a much nicer color than on my monitor (the pictured item looks to me like "royal" blue).

The ties in the back allow you to adjust the fit; I haven't had them come untied. It's comfortable and nice not to have elastic digging into my forehead. There's not as much hair-space as in other caps I've used. This one is more for thin hair or a shorter hairstyle.

My short curls tend to flatten if I sleep mostly on one side, but if you aren't sleeping in rollers (or with your head magically levitated) that can't be helped. A light spritz of water in the morning takes care of the curls.

I expect this silk sleep cap to last a long while.

title: Love these paper sheet masks, but pricier than others
text:
These are pricier than other compressed facial masks, but they have the advantage of prime shipping (as opposed to 2-3 weeks for international shipping) and of being individually wrapped. I wanted to try making my own masks asap, and also want to take these when I travel and to throw in beauty gifts (spa in a jar) for friends and family. So the fast shipping and individually wrapped masks were worth paying more for me.

I love the concept of soaking these in whatever you like, or placing over a mud mask so that my skin can soak up the benefits and detoxify without drying out too fast. However, these are a bit too small for me width-wise and definitely too small for my hubby (who is willing to sheet mask with me!). I'll probably buy these again just because I can easily travel with them and use in gifts, but I am going to look for larger ones that I can use on a more regular basis. And once you see the difference sheet masking can do for your skin, you might just look forward to using these as often as you can! I know I do!

(I found a really good recipe to brighten and moisturize the face: one egg white, teaspoon of honey, and the juice of a lemon/lime slice. Whisk it together, or shake in a jar, and dab all over your face. Then soak your mask in it and place on your face. It feels sooo good! And is cheap :)

title: Surprisingly comfortable for double-layer masks
text:
Now that masks are the new fashion accessory I've discovered that not all masks fit the same. There's definitely a difference in how they fit over your nose and mouth. My favorite mask, which is stretchy, isn't always practical. I'm not fond of cloth masks because of how they sit on my face, but these brackets actually make them comfortable.

Basically, I put the bracket inside a double-layer mask. This works great to keep the bracket from pinching your face while at the same time keeping the mask a little bit further away. The difference in comfort is significant, and it's very easy to forget you're wearing a mask with one of these on.

That said, you still need to wash it,and sliding these brackets in and out of a double-layer mask isn't easy. But if you're willing to put in the effort in a mask that you'll wear all day, it's definitely more comfortable.

title: Great for dry skin!
text: I wish this was available in stores in the states so that I could have gotten a better match, but alas, it's only available through the internet here. I'm glad I also ordered 53 light beige because I usually end up mixing the two to get it just right. Maybe in the winter this will match better. I also wish there were more shades available, but then ordering over the internet is tough with foundation when you can't compare in person. I apply it with a Real Techniques sponge, and it goes on nice and smoothly. I tried it with a brush, but it kind of looked streaky. Since I also have dry skin, the sponge works better for me anyway. It feels really nice. It feels almost like bare skin but slightly better, like nicely moisturized skin. With a makeup setting spray, I get pretty good coverage for about 8 hours. It might last even longer, but that's as long as I've worn it. Once it seemed to wear off early, but I didn't use setting spray that time either. Also, it's summer and humid here, so I think that makes all makeup wear sooner. I think it would be a great winter time foundation for the extra moisturization and the shade I have is just a shade or two lighter than I need. It is fairly light to medium coverage, but I can build up to good medium coverage. A lot of people comment that it has a fruity smell, and it does but it's not like I pump it into my hand and go 'oh fruit' every time. I have to smell the pumped product on my hand or sponge directly before I notice it. Definitely not overpowering but pleasant.

title: Wonderful lash storage

title: Amazing time saver! Must have for wavy hair!

I went and ordered a second one for my teenaged daughter who was cursed (blessed?) with the same texture of hair as I have because this brush is so amazing. Highly recommend it to anyone with hair that is not curly enough to wear it curly, but too curly to wear it straight.

title: Pleasantly surprised how awesome the exfoliation factor is,  but I could do without the patchouli and packaging. Will buy more
text: I would buy again which I guess is the bottom line. I wasn't thrilled about the patchouli but it isn't overwhelming and it doesn't linger on my body making me smell like some hippy living in a VW van following the Dead. So I can live with it. The exfoliation factor is amazing! It feels awesome! Very rough and tough on the skin.....but in a totally good way. I love it. You can beat a steaming hot shower with this soap! The packaging is a little comical to me: The bars are packed in these giant clam shell reclaimed paper containers that are pretty big and those are wrapped in these "organic ink"(?) printed labels made out of some sort of greenie paper. The ink from the labels falls off the label (because it's "green" ink on some sort of "green" paper) and makes a mess all over the place when you try to open the soap. Oh well, somebody must feel good that they saved some trees or something with this packaging decision. Wouldn't have been the route I would have taken.

title: This serum is great! I usually do chemical peels with hyaluronic acid ...
text:
This serum is great! I usually do chemical peels with hyaluronic acid so I was familiar with it prior to receiving it. I loved that it has a dropper attached to the bottle top which helps keep waste down! I'm usually awful about wasting product but the dropper allowed me to get what I need. For the selling price point, this is comparable to some of the more expensive products I've tried in the past. I have bad skin, acne prone with a whole heck of a lot of sun damage so I'm always looking for something that works and isn't going to cost an arm and a leg. After about 2 weeks worth of usage I noticed a difference in my skin; it was smoother and some of my lighter laugh lines were not as apparent. After about a month, I saw a difference in my deeper set wrinkles [forehead and under my chin] I plan to keep using this product in the future. The first week or so was a little tough, as my skin reacts poorly to new skin care regimens...I saw an increase in my oil secretion, but this is a typical reaction for me. After that first week my skin adjusted. I really enjoy using this serum, I love that it doesn't go on greasy and it dries very fast and does not react with my foundation so I can wear it under my daily make up with no issue. I'm glad that I was able to try this product for free in exchange for my honest review of it.

I would definitely purchase this product.

This one won't take huge bottles, but it will take them about 9 inches tall and not too wide. It also fits my deodorant, a small bottle of body wash, and face wash in the main compartment. There's a small zippered compartment for my razor, and the side compartments hold combs, and toothbrush with toothpaste. Basically, everything I need in the gym shower is right there, hanging securely on a metal hook. The fabric is water resistant, so it can get splashed with shower spray without mildewing, and once my body wash leaked and the bag prevented the leak from going all over my gym bag. Overall, this was a very good purchase!
