title: Difficult to work with
text:
I’ve been really into gel blushes lately and I kept seeing this pop up in my feeds, so I gave in and bought it.

For the price you do get a lot of product. It’s quite large and it’s probably going to last a lifetime BECAUSE it is SO pigmented. Seriously, its almost too pigmented. You literally only need a pin sized amount because it’s so pigmented. Its difficult to control how much comes out because when you squeeze it.

It’s hard to get this blended in before it started staining and setting. It’s hard to control the pigment and every time I’ve tried it I end up going to low with it in order to get the edges blended out.

Frankly, I prefer Maybelline Cheek Heat over this product. It’s much more sheer and easier to work with and I like the dried down finish of it better because it’s a bit dewier than this product.

For the price I wish I liked it more.

title: Don’t love it but don’t hate it
text:
This foundation is a tricky one. There are things I really like about it and things that I don’t.
I bought it in the shade 04 Honey. In the bottle it looks like an almost exact match to my skin, but when I put it on it’s much paler with a decidedly pink undertone, yet it doesn’t look orange or too pink in my skin. I prefer a neutral undertone though since my skin can be both yellow and pink.

I love the bottle and packaging. It comes in a frosted glass bottle with a pink pump and pink cap that snaps on tightly.

The coverage is much higher than I expected and it is heavier than expected for a luminous foundation.

It covers blue tones better than redness. I have typically had to build it up in areas I have more redness (and we’re talking average redness, not anything extreme) and doing this makes it look much heavier so I end up using a concealer instead. The problem with this lies in the finish.

So this foundation’s finish is very confusing and hard to describe. It is very glowy and luminous without being shimmery but it has the heaviness of a matte. I know, confusing.
Areas can look too greasy or too dry. It settles into fine lines and creases around the eyes and nostrils. For this reason this is not a foundation I choose for the daytime. It’s much too heavy and shiny for the day, which is a shame because I enjoy it’s longevity. Once I set it with some powder around the eyes and my nostrils I really enjoy it for a night out.

I should also mention it is heavily perfumed with a floral scent so those sensitive to scented foundations will likely want to give this a pass. It’s not bothersome to me personally but fragrance can irritate really sensitive skin.

All in all I don’t use it as much as I hoped I would and probably won’t repurchase based on that and how heavy it is. At 36 I want a foundation with decent coverage but a lighter feel. It’s also not the easiest foundation to completely remove and when I wear it I have to use a cleaning oil and a cleanser both AND a miceller solution.

I have combo skin that can be prone to breakouts with certain brands but I haven’t broken out from this foundation.

I enjoy Holika Holika’s BB cream which is why I gave this a shot (and I like a luminous foundation) but I’ll probably stick with the BB cream in the future since it’s lighter.

title: Wonderful lip balm but smells different
text:
I bought this lip balm because I'm absolutely head over heels for the scent of the Bum Bum Cream (in addition to the cream I also have the shower gel and the body spray..that's how obsessed with it I am) but I was disappointed to find that this doesn't smell the same. It smells really good, it's just missing a few notes that the other products have. It mostly smells like vanilla with maybe a slight hint of caramel.
It's very moisturizing, I love how it feels on my lips, and overall it is a high quality lip balm that's worth it's price tag. However, if you're hoping it's going to smell like the cream, you're going to be disappointed. This is the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars.

title: True ORIGINAL Avon Odessey perfume.
text:
Three or so years ago Avon changed their original formula for Odessey perfume. When then changed its packaging they pulled a fast one and changed the scent, too. My husband noticed it before I did. To find the scent he loves, I had to search online through all the impostors claiming they had the real thing.

Two years ago I purchased four bottles of the true original and three of the fake. I failed the smell test because I was sniffing them one right after the other. In frustration I wrote a bad review of both sellers.

I’m apologizing to this seller of the true original for giving her a rotten one star review. She didn’t deserve it.

I put it on one day and my husband asked me where I had finally found the original scent, and I told him I didn’t, that this was a knock off. He told me I was crazy, that it was the same scent he loved me to wear and that I should smell like this all the time. I am truly sorry.

So please believe me when I say that this IS the REAL TRUE Avon Odyssey perfume. It smells great and I get many, many compliments when I wear it, which is always.

text: I absolutely love this product, and it can be difficult to find. I always have fly-away hairs, and this is one of the only products that smooths them down and keeps my hair looking nice for longer. This product is clear and odorless, and lasts probably 2 months with fairly consistent use (~5 times a week). Definitely a worthwhile product for the price.

title: Love it
text:
I was skeptical after reading the reviews and taking note of the cheap price, but I gave it a shot and I'm glad I did. I never, ever use any type of lotion on my face because my skin is already like an oil slick. However, after using this product for just over a week, I ordered two more bottles.

This lotion seems to be controlling the oil on my face. There's a lot less of it now. I have acne scars and red blotches from 40 years of bad skin, but now my skin tone has evened out. I was also recently diagnosed with sebaceous hyperplasia and my dermatologist said there is nothing to be done except have the spots removed if they bother me. The smaller spots have now vanished and the big one has stopped growing. This is why I ordered two additional bottles.

Also, other reviews complain about the eye dropper. I've had no trouble using it. The lotion is thin enough that it is easily sucked into the dropper. The only issue is that the outside of the dropper has lotion on it so it sometimes gets on the neck of the bottle when I put it back. I'd definitely recommend this product.

title: Excellent BBB
text:
You get what you pay for when buying a boar bristle brush. This brush has a great feel to it, the handle and weight of the brush in my hand work well to guide the brush through my long hair. The purpose of a BBB is not to detangle; it is to stimulate the scalp, spread sebum throughout your length, and use as a finishing brush. One should use a detangle brush or comb before brushing with a BBB. I use the GranNatuarals Boar Bristle Brush in the morning and at night, and I never use it on wash days. It is not a brush to use on wet hair. So, if you know this about a BBB, this is an excellent choice in BBB.

Also, the weight and shape of this brush make an excellent hair brush paddle choice.

I highly recommend this brush on both counts.

But in using them, I was not verypleased. Several pairs of earrings had posts that did not fit through the hole in the back; it is too small. It didn't seem to help with some others. I had one pair of earrings that seemed to benefit from them, but they seemed so bulky that It was uncomfortable. I have small earlobes and they sit close to my head. If you have large earlobes, or your problem is that your holes are stretched out, they might be helpful for you.

title: fake
text: Counterfeit product! I've been using this night cream for ten years, and ordering it from Amazon for almost that amount of time, and this is the first time I've felt sure what I received was not genuine. It burned, which it should NEVER do. The smell, weight and texture are wrong, and the color is a wheaty, salmon tinted off white, instead of the usual almost white color. Something looks off about the packaging, too, even though I don't mind receiving jars instead of pumps (I've gotten the jarred version before and am happy with it). I should’ve noticed the spelling and grammar mistakes in the product description, but I’ve never had this problem before.

title: The scrub smells like coffee (obviously)
text:
Before, I used a sugar scrub or any other random scrub that I found at the store. I will not be doing that anymore.

After searching for a new scrub, I stumbled upon the Arabica Coffee Scrub and I am never turning back.

This scrub does wonders to my skin (I do NOT use it on my face).

It leaves my body refreshed and smooth after one use.

I have not had a problem with rashes, or breakouts (I have extremely sensitive skin and break out easily).

The scrub smells like coffee (obviously), but it also has a sweet smell that flows with it.

It is a scrub, so it is rough (Don't rub it into your skin relentlessly).

title: Highly recommend this company'S products.
text:
First, I want to say I bought this at full price....period!

I've been very lax over years, at any kind of skin care routine. My skin isn't really showing any effects of bad skin care, because I was blessed with really good skin, but....I'm 52 now and decided I really shouldn't push it any longer. So; I purchased Tree of Life Beauty Vitamin C wash first. I was very impressed with the ingredient list, the amount used to wash my face (neck, chest, and shoulders as well), and the way my skin felt afterwards.

So when I saw the toner was 93% organic, I decided buy the Tree of life Beauty Toner, to go along with the wash. First of all, I really am impressed with the ingredients this company uses. I grow all organics herbs, berries, vegetables, etc. and use as many organic ingredients that I can. I would love to be a purist, but my budget says "NO!" This company doesn't use a lot of needless filler ingredients to stretch the product. So when you think of the product being only 8 oz, you can be assured that 8 oz (when used properly), is a good amount of product that will last. I can't say how long yet, as I've only been using it a week.

Secondly, being an herbalist has taught me that your skin is your largest organ! You should be careful what you put on it. Your pores soak up every last drop of whatever you put on your skin. Parabens are absolute poison and should be avoided like the plague! (Sorry all of you Vicks and vasaline lovers out there) From what I've read about Tree of life Beauty, we're on the same page and I don't feel I need to be concerned about them hiding any in their products.

And finally, Vitamin C is essential to your body in too many ways to go into. But I take a vitamin C daily to help with the absorption of Collagen 1&3 (Which is important for hair, skin, nails, bones, joints, etc). I had not realized the benefits of vitamin C for your face. I absolutely love the way my skin feels after using the cleanser and toner. I let it dry well, then follow up with moisturizer both morning and evening.

So far, I'm quite happy with Tree of Life Beauty products and will probably transition to more of their products as I use up what I already have. We'll see how it goes after using these items for 30 days.

title: Product packaging concerns
text:
The name “Honey Bee Smooth Bath & Body Scrub + Moisturizer” just evokes good thoughts, doesn’t it? If you love honey, it just sounds amazing. I know I love honey and I love using it or having it in my beauty products, so I was looking forward to receiving this product to test it out.

There are some actual product packaging concerns that really should be addressed by the company that makes this body scrub. First off, the jar is pretty sturdy, I’m not going to dispute that and it’s amber, which is always good in helping keep out UV rays. The ONLY seal is the Amazon barcode label (One of the photos shows the label, but I cut through it, it was intact when it arrived - so that was not the issue). There was no shrink wrap seal, neither was there an inner seal, nor one of those inner lid liners. This jar also does not have ANY other labeling except for that Amazon barcode and the top label with their website URL. This was a standalone jar, no box. There is no product information on the jar, no ingredient list, no product name, no manufacture or expiration dates. This brings up heavy red flags for me – quality control especially.

The product description sounds rather amazing, right? Ok, keep in mind what I previously mentioned about quality control. In their description they advertise that you can EAT it. I’d recommend against it because of the lack of quality sealing. It would be one thing if this were given to me by someone who I knew personally that had made the product, but since this is coming from a company that I don’t know and that doesn’t have anything other than the description on Amazon, I’m not sticking this product in my mouth. I know the anti-bacterial properties of honey, however, that doesn’t mean that it can’t be contaminated by anything else -1) it’s not pure honey, there are other ingredients within, 2) who knows the health/sanitation practices of this company, right?, 3) with there just being the barcode label as a seal, who’s to say that someone couldn’t have tampered with it in the warehouse?, and 4) their only label – the one I mentioned with their website URL – if you go to the URL, it comes up with:

“This webpage is not available

ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED”

I don’t know about you, but without anything reputable to back up the product or company, I find it very hard for me to trust this.

ALL of that aside, if you can look past those packaging and trust issues, getting to the actual product…

When you open the cover, it does have that very rich strong scent of honey. The brown sugar and other ingredients have settled to the bottom, so some stirring was necessary — the honey is also pretty solid, so a cosmetic spatula (not included) was not adequate enough to stir it. Once you do stir it, the scent of the brown sugar comes through. Because it’s honey, it’s really sticky, and like any sugar scrub, it has that gritty sugar texture which is great for exfoliation. If your skin is dry when you apply, you may have a tough time spreading it, to avoid this, moisten your skin prior to smoothing this along.

It does its job at exfoliating, removing a layer of dead skin, but I didn’t expect that it wouldn’t. The product itself is good, leaves the skin smooth and smells good – I used it on my leg.

It’s not proprietary though, since there are a ton of DIY tutorials on how to make sugar scrubs out on the web nowadays. But if you’re not into making your own and if they change the packaging and labeling and get a working website up, then this would be the way to go.

I really hope that they get the concerns I mentioned in the beginning straightened out. It would have been a decent product all around if not for those issues. If they do, then I'd be more than happy to bump the rating to a 4. This product was given to me complimentary in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

They don’t handle washing very well so I tend to really condition the ends and need to trim them occasionally as they will fray a bit and break after a lot of styling. For an inexpensive set I’m not disappointed at all. I was able to curl them as needed as seen in the picture. title: I use this to help me relax before bed
text:
I use this with lavender oil in my baths at night. It relaxes my body and helps sooth sore muscles from exercising. The flakes dissolve pretty quickly. If you add it when you first start running the water, it's mostly dissolved by the time you get in.
You use 3 cups of salt per bath so I expect this bag to last for a few baths. There's no scent to this, which I love because I can add my own essential oils to my bath if I want it scented.

title: Perfect for travel. Only one heat setting. Long cord.
text:
I ordered this for when I'm traveling and it's perfect for that. This does take longer to use than my full size waver but the size makes this easier to pack and it doesn't take up too much counter space.
The curler only has 1 heat setting and that's 410°. That's the temperature I always use on my straightener so I'm fine with not being able to adjust it. It heats up very quickly in about 30 seconds.
You use this like a crimper by taking about a 2 inch section of hair and clamping from the top to the bottom. You can't pull this straight through your hair or it'll just straighten it.

title: Great for traveling!
text:
You get 5 sets of under eye pads and each one is individually wrapped so you can throw it in your luggage when you travel. You also get 5 facemask which are also individually wrapped. There's a big container of 60 makeup remover wipes and they work really well to remove my makeup.
I saw someone say the mask didn't fit them. My head is pretty small to average size and it fit mine fine. I still had room on the velcro part to make it bigger. The mask fits comfortably and can be refrigerated to help with eye swelling or puffiness.
What I liked most about everything is it all says it's not tested on animals and most of it has a cruelty free bunny logo on the back. I always try to buy cruelty free cosmetics and spa products so this is perfect.

title: Small, easy to use,  USB powered.
text:
This nail drill is exactly as pictured. It has an on/off switch and an intensity level setting. It comes with lots of attachments and even several sandpaper pieces to use.
I used it to remove stubborn gel polish and I've used it to prep my nails for press on nails. I like that it's small and basically the size of a highlighter. It has a little weight to it but it's easy to hold and use.
It powers through a USB cable, it doesn't come with a wall socket.

title: Great for photo shoots, dress up or  just for fun.

I really love this crown. It's sort of heavy and not flimsy at all. The rhinestones are obviously fake and not very clear but that won't stop me from rocking it.
The metal is sort of a coppery tarnish gold color in person. It has two little holes where you can use clips or even string to attach it to your head so it doesn't move around.

title: Very conditioning but doesn't really tone my hair

This mask really conditioned my hair and it made my hair feel so soft. It would be great right after I bleach my hair. It also has a light pleasant scent.

title: Nice selection, super easy to use.
text:
I've always struggled with gluing in lashes and I had pretty much given up. I ordered these after a friend was telling me about how great magnetic liner is. I was super impressed with how easy it is for me to put these on.
I'm kind of confused on whether the liner is sticky and magnetic or just magnetic. I didn't let it dry all the way before doing my eyebrows and my lower eyelid got stuck to my upper eyelid. I couldn't tell if that was magnet pull or glue.
Whatever the liner is, it keeps those lashes in place and they are so easy to put on. The brush is thin but the thicker the line, the better it will hold on to the lashes.
My eye lids are sort of small and I think I'm going to have to trim these a tiny bit or the ends can be a little jabby in the corner of my eye.
I haven't worn these out yet due to the pandemic but I know the liner lasts because you have to scrub hard to get it off. These should last all day.

title: Perfect for my purse, the office and camping.
text:
I straighten my hair daily. This mini straightener is perfect for camping and on the go. I actually got this to keep at the office for emergencies but I'll be taking it with me when I go camping too.
Due to the smaller size it takes a little longer to straighten my hair. This isn't ideal for every day use unless you have really short hair, but it works great in a pinch or when you are trying to pack light.
It comes with a pretty blue green travel case/bag. It has dual voltage 100-240V and an adapter for worldwide travel.
It has 1 heat setting and that's 410°. This worked fine for me because that's the temp my regular straightener is set at.

text:
I have color treated hair and am always looking for a good product to use.
The shampoo comes with a nice pump and smells wonderful. It is not too overpowering smelling. I have used it four times and each time I feel more and more of a difference in the softness and hydration. It has become glossier as well. And the smell is amazing.
On to the oil ~ I am in love with this stuff!! I started applying the oil right out of the shower. It says to start with a few drops, but I apply about a quarter size. I was afraid it would make my hair really oily, but it doesn’t at all. It adds so much shine and moisture. It really helps the frizzys and dryness. I LOVE how my hair feels after I apply it. In fact, the first time I applied it my son asked me why I kept petting my hair. So I put some in his hair and he started doing it too.
I also love that they do not test on animals. This is a big factor for me when I am purchasing products.
Overall, I am very happy with both of these hair products.

I received this item at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I carry it in my purse for breath freshener but mostly I use it for acid reflux.  3 drops under my tongue, swish, swallow and then rub directly above stomach area where the burn is.  It helps. title: Healed the eczema on my hands after nothing else did
text: I've tried dozens of creams and lotions for the eczema on my hands, so I figured there was a pretty good chance this would be another waste of money. I've been using it for a week, and the difference in my skin is amazing. Most of the cuts and cracks have healed, and all of the bumps between my fingers and on my palms have gone away. Based on other reviews, I was afraid this would make my skin feel like it's coated in something, but it doesn't. It's not completely waterproof, but it does help relieve the irritation from frequent handwashing. Before I go to bed, I put on a layer of lotion and then put a layer of this over the top. My skin stays nice and moisturized without the need to wear cotton gloves all night. I will be buying more of this!

title: cons far outweigh the pros
text:
The glowing reviews about this product are accurate in a sense - yes, this product shows a noticeable improvement in the appearance of skin over a short period of time. It does contain enough glycolic acid at a decent ph, it does exfoliate well. Whatever praises people bestow are germane but only to a certain degree. The fact of the matter though is that the entire line of products contain many unefficacious artificial ingredients at best and downright harmful toxins, in effect, at worst.

It has plenty of potential but does not deliver. It seems to me that the makers are not truly interested in answering the riddle to great skin. It is a start devoid of middle or end notes. It does not cater to the skin as a complete system. It will give you a minor improvement and waste a lot of your time.

But don't take my word for it, try it for yourself. If you love it and are happy good for you. I will not throw cigarette buds on anyones Eden. If however you are not a believer like me and want to try another alternative try something with ONLY natural ingredients. Anything else and your skin will be in a constant battle with adversaries you put there, everyday, and leave there to do damage, because it's absurd to think that the body could assimilate such artificiality in any positive long-term way.

The choice is yours my friends.

title: Bummer.....
text:
Beautiful looking set and what you see is what you get.....for about two weeks and this is with very gentle use and no washing detergents or dishwasher machine clean.

I wanted this style angler for my long hair and saw it everywhere....decided to pay a bit extra and get the set. Arrived in a beautiful flawless condition and even my trendy daughter was impressed lol. She’s away at school and tends to borrow my makeup, hair products of all kinds, clothes, etc. Sigh! Lol

Normally, I would have attributed the damage to her as she is young and it’s easy to be roughshod on mom’s stuff when mom is pretty laid back minus a few clear things!

But, nope. Just me using it. Boyfriend skeptical but impressed by the detangler and decided the overall metallic “paint” rose gold was striking, yet pretty. He’s a die-hard boar bristle wooden brushes fan. Lovely but this was the detangler I needed (it works) and the case and other brush/comb were a splurge. A gift to myself. Nice!

Only I used it and never dropped it. Less than a month and the paint is flicking off and it’s night and day and looks....so cheap and damaged. I have supplies to patch up the chips and did fiddle with the chips but it was like an unraveling sweater.

Tired of picking the flecks off the bathroom floor and pitched it all in the garbage. It’s my fault for not seeking refund as the items were defective within the return window. Just darn irritating because none of the pieces were packed in a travel bag or a purse. Not once! I’d cleared an entire drawer for it.

I realized that I obviously had made a mistake and I do peruse reviews. I was too frustrated to do anything else other than leave this review.

It is a beautiful set. The paint shiny coating is glamorous and glossy and just too good to be true. I do not like chipped items, overall, so it all went in the bin.

Cannot recommend product

title: 024 takes the edge off my neck & shoulder pain
text: I love this product and buy it straight from the site in multiples for cost effectiveness.  I use it on my neck and back to relieve chronic pain from a neck injury - I had C5-7 fused in 2004 and haven't found anything else that works for me.  I find other products burn my skin and I don't care for their medicinal scents.  024 doesn't heal the problem, but it relaxes my stiff neck and shoulders with it's cooling / heating sensations and takes the edge off the pain.  As someone else said, a little goes a long way, so don't go crazy.  The scent can be strong, but I disagree that it's unfavorable - I love the mint scent and find it relieves stress and clears my sinuses.

title: Works! And seller replaced the defective unit 🙂
text:
Definitely zapping some of those course hairs. Mine does not seem to function the way intended. The knob seems to control nothing. Does not turn it off or change charge, seemingly. When I hold in my left hand, my finger gets zapped a bit, but not in my right hand. I am thinking it’s because I have my Apple Watch on my left, so be sure to remove all jewelry first!

I watched a video on you tube first. I have red hair and some of my hair is dark at the tip and light at the root plus I have freckles. This can make finding the follicle/pore challenging. However I have removed a lot of these suckers. Even removed an especially egregious one from my upper lip. No more painful than tweezing. After I finish my chin, will prolly go for the upper lip stash hairs.

Clue that you are in the right spot is when a lot of the white stuff comes out right away. Definitely a home run 😃. One star off for the control knob issue.

I should have returned it immediately for exchange when I realized it was not working properly. But I reached out to the seller and they will replace the defective unit. So 5 stars

title: Try this trick to easily use this great floss.
text: Have trouble holding this great floss? Try this: cut a piece about 14 inches long. Double it over then tie a simple overhand knot four to five inches down to form a loop slightly wider than your hand. Gently try to floss a tooth. Adjust the knot to an ideal size for you. The magic is that the knot is easily moved by separately pulling the ends. Once it's optimal tie a second knot and tease it until it sits on the first knot. They will now be locked into position. You can apply loads of force without deforming your loop.

text: I've tried many beard products (including many beard balms), but this is absolutely nothing like anything I have tried before.  Granted, it is labeled as a wax, so I expected it to be a little stiffer and to provide more hold.  But it's so hard in the can, I had to use a hair dryer to get it to soften up enough to be able to apply it.  Melting it by rubbing your hands together...good luck with that.  I tried it a couple of times and easily concluded this is definitely NOT what I was looking for.  The scent is fine and not too strong.  I'm moving on to another product...one that I don't have to heat up with a hair dryer for several minutes before I can apply it.

title: Good product after you learn how to get the oil out of the tube
text:
At first I had trouble getting anything at all out of the tube. There was a problem with my cap that prevented anything from coming out. But after taking the cap off the product flowed out. By reading other reviews I learned that the tube must be submerged in hot water for some time to liquify the mixture of oil. Otherwise you get a pebbly mixture. And unless you live in a subtropical climate, one of the oils in the mixture comes out in a semi-solid state and must be rolled between your palms to liquify it as well. Once that is done, your hands will be pretty thoroughly coated on both sides and between the fingers. Then you must work it into your beard. It did a pretty good job of softening my scruffy beard. But now its time to clean the oils off my hands using the sink full of hot water I soaked the tube in. An oily film can be seen in the water, but my hands still feel oily. No worries. The remaining oil get absorbed into my hands.
The instructions say to use a "manly amount." But that begs the question, how much is a manly amount? It really doesn't require as much as I initially thought. I guess the fragrance could be described as manly.

title: Great Cleanser!!!
text:
This is a wonderful facial cleanser! I have very sensitive skin, and I'm always nervous the first time I try out a new product, but I've had no reaction or irritation of any kind after using this morning and night over the last week. I also haven't had any type of breakout which happens often with other products I've tried in the past. That alone makes me very happy!

I also like the consistency of the cleanser because a little goes a long way and making it much more cost efficient. There are also these little conditioning 'beads' that kind of break apart to add jojoba oil to the cleanser. I found that the lather amount is about right and the scent is very light to almost non-existent (in my opinion anyway).

Pros:
*Department store quality at a reasonable price
*Small amount goes a long way making it cost efficient
*Little to no scent
*Conditioning jojoba beads
*Rinses off easily
*Non-drying
*Non-irritating to my sensitive skin
*Amount of cleanser for the price (6.7 oz)
*Money back guarantee

Cons:
*None noted

Even though I did receive a discounted price in order to use this cleanser and give a review based upon my experience with it, I was in no way influenced by the seller on the actual review. Because I mostly shop online these days, the reviews I read help me to decision on which products to buy, I am determined to give the best information in my reviews for others to make their purchasing choices. I feel very comfortable in recommending this cleanser if you are looking for a high quality cleanser with added benefits of conditioning/exfoliating using the best natural and scientific technology to also treat your skin.

title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!!!
text:
I have to admit that I am a high end facial product junkie. And when I saw this product for sale on Amazon, I knew that I had never tried any products from this company of Ove Beauty, I was excited to try it.
First it arrived on time as promised.
Second, it comes in a 2 ounce pump bottle. I use only at bedtime so it will last a good long time.

This advanced anti-aging complex contains multiple active ingredients including both Retinol and Hyaluronic Acid that absorb smoothly and quickly into the skin for effective results. Hyaluronic Acid is now being touted as one of the key ingredients that keeps skin hydrated, elastic and youthful looking. It helps to plump fine lines and wrinkles so they are less obvious. Health Mag 10/2014 named Hyaluronic Acid as one of the top ingredients for lines, wrinkles and hollow cheeks.

Prevention is also key This unique formulation also includes anti aging antioxidants vitamin C and Vitamin E to help further protect against skin damage.
I love this product and I will continue to use!!!
I did receive this product for a reduced cost for a fair and honest review.

title: Does NOT work and smells like a meth lab
text:
First off, I sweat so bad that I don’t look like I’m wearing any makeup by the time I leave my home, and in the summertime, it feels like I’m sitting in a jacuzzi with my clothes on… So, it was really important for this stuff to work. Unfortunately, this antiperspirant smells like a combination of formaldehyde and a meth lab … and I know because I tried using this stuff on my face to treat excessive sweating (due to fibromyalgia), but it only kind of worked for a 1 or 2 days, but not in a row. So it’s not reliable. Plus, it leaves your skin dry and terribly itchy!
Which REALLY SUCKS, considering how expensive it is for such a small amount of “antiperspirant”.

In short, I don’t recommend it.

title: USELESS (for me)
text:
Suction: the one thing in life that everyone looks forward sucking. These, provided no such thing. Maybe I was using them incorrectly? You can use them two ways, one way gives you wider more oval shape, if you turn around them around, you’ll get a less wide but taller shape... unfortunately both ways DID NOT SUCK. My guess is that they’re too soft, and too short so it’s too easy and doesn’t offer much resistance.

That being said, everyone’s lips are different. So it’s certainly possible that these could work for other people (who maybe have smaller lips), but for me, they were useless.

title: Sharp Shears for Healthy Looking Hair
text:
I learned some things when I was looking for hair cutting shears. Mostly that you can pay around $200 for the best ones,used by professionals,and,that you need very sharp scissors or shears to cut or trim hair.

I've been trimming and shaping my own hair for a long time and am usually happy with the results,considering too many times,when I would go to a salon to have it cut or shaped or trimmed,they did a job I was almost always disappointed with. I decided a long time ago,if someone was going to screw up my hair,it might as well be me. At least I have a good idea on when to stop cutting it and I actually care what the final result looks like.

I also have fine,wavy hair. Not the easiest to cut.

I have noticed,and maybe it was from using whatever scissors were around at the time,that sometimes the ends do look a bit frazzled;and in researching shears,I found out that unless the blades are very sharp,the ends can break,or result in split ends. I don't have split ends and never noticed them,except for a long,long time ago when I was a teenager;but,I have used these once to do some light trimming and shaping;with wavy hair you are always shaping,cutting with the wave and not cutting against the wave. And,these shears have produced a nice result. And I don't see the somewhat frazzled or lightningbolt effect at the ends of my hair,that I sometimes get.

I've used these just once,I only trim my hair to maintain healthy looking ends,and I did it a few weeks ago,and I like these and I'm glad I looked for something better than "any old scissors" that I have on hand.

Battery lasts well over a week with daily trimming, but I do notice the motor begins to turn a bit slower after several days on the battery.

The mustache/sideburn trimmer is average and does the job.

The beard trimmer is pretty good, but has trouble getting really close under my nose. I sometimes have to go over that area several times to get it as close as I like.

The vacuum will only catch about 3/4 of the hair. The other 1/4 will be all over your sink and need to be cleaned up. Emptying the vacuum chamber is easy though. The vacuum is also loud enough that it would wake up someone sleeping in the same room but not the next room.

title: Unexpectedly Pretty Color
text:
I am already a fan of Josie Maran's color stick in Rosy which I purchased at Sephora late in 2010. I still have half of it left and expect I will run out of it sometime in mid-2013. What a way to stretch a dollar! I saw this color, Love, which is not available in the store, and was attracted to what appears to be more of an earthy, rich and darker color than Rosy. I ordered it and it arrived yesterday. I was disappointed to find a pale mauvish color and did not have high hopes for how it would look on me, as I have never liked mauve colors on me. This morning I tried it anyway, fully expecting to hate it. Within about 20 minutes I noticed the most natural-looking vibrant bloom in my cheeks, attributable only to this! I love the silky texture and it does not feel sticky or greasy on my face at all. Just pure healthy moisturizing (thanks to the argan oil in it) color that I am so glad to have. It has more of a matte effect on the skin than does Rosy, which is more glossy and sheer. Both colors last all day on my face, even in extreme heat and humidity.

The price may seem expensive but considering my first one is still fresh and going strong after 19 months, it's actually a steal! Smells pleasant, too - rather like fresh berries. Just be aware that it is not going to be the dark berry color shown in the photograph.

Well, he used it 3 times, and he broke out exactly on the spot where he put the product, I am sure it was the lactic acid that made him break out because he was putting it only on that spot and the zit popped ONLY on that spot (he usually doesn't get random zits on his face).
Very disappointing, I wish I could contact Skin Laboratory but seems like their "contact page" doesn't work.
Well, if you see this review please contact me, I am extremely disappointed by your product and would like to send it back for a refund.

Update: I started using it myself for a dark spot, I forgot about it and left it on all night, my fault clearly, and it "ate" my skin, now I have raw skin and like a "hole" ... hoping for new skin to grow as it doesn't look pretty :( - peeling went wrong. I do not have sensitive skin, can't imagine what it would have done to someone else ... be careful, powerful stuff.

title: There Are Better Norelcos
text:
Since this model seems to be discontinued there probably isn't much chance of you finding one for sale. But just in case you do, don't get it.

I've had this shaver for years now, buying it as a replacement for my previous Norelco that I dearly loved. But I had put so many years on that one, and when it was time to replace the battery and heads (about $80.00 total), I figured it was time to just get a new one.

This was the first frustrating part of the process, finding a replacement. Norelco makes so many models. I was looking for one on sale as to limited funds. I soon found out a lot of things I didn't like. These shavers are no longer made in Holland, to fine exacting standards, but are now made in China. They are of varying quality, even within the same model, so you get the luck of the draw. This new model, for twice the money, did not have a battery charge indicator on it, and they no longer have the head height adjustment. And it was LOUD! All for TWICE the price of my old Norelco shaver that was made in Holland, had the battery indicator, and the adjustable heads.

So right away, I considered rebuilding the old one. I should have. This shaver grabbed my hair (still does), gives me razor burn, is made out of a more flimsy plastic, doesn't hold a charge nearly as long as with past models, and is just all around a poor replacement, for, did I mention, TWICE THE MONEY!

So I've put up with it for years now and am at the same place again. The heads and battery need replacing for a cost of over $80.00 and I'm sure not going to put that into this shaver. So it's off to the reviews again to find a new shaver. I understand that now that Philips has purchased Norelco that their quality has begun to come back up while their prices have stayed the same or even gone done some. I hope this is true as the alternatives don't exist.

In a word, you get what you pay for and with the 6843XL Reflex Plus, you don't get much!

title: New Shaver -  Quality?
text: This is the third Norelco rotary electric shaver I've owned in, say the past 25-30 years.  My observations are: 1) it is the only Norelco rotary shaver I've ever owned that occaisionally "pulls" a whisker (Ouch) rather than cut it off. The motor sounds "weaker" with fewer RPM's than previously-owned Norelco razors and that may be the problem.  2) the routine shave is OK.  3)the small icon indicating the razor needs cleaning lights up after every shave so it's essentially useless. 3) the battery life after a charge is spectacular.  I get a month or more on a re-charge.  4) Assembly and overall quality seems very good.  Finally, I wish Norelco had not cut corners on the power of the electric motor especially on a shaver costing as much as this one does.

title: LEAKS OVER EVERYTHING!!!
text:
Leaks over everything. Clothes covered in suntan lotion and oil. We went camping in a desert to find that half of our clothes were soaked with olive oil and suntan lotion. Anyone out there know what its like to wear the same pants for a week??
They had a good idea.what could have been a very simple design was taken too far by adding the stop valve and flip cap on the bottles.
Why not just have a bottle that screws shut. Unscrew to use, screw cap back on to seal???? These have a good and tight fitting screw on cap but the issue is the cap has a simple flip up section, much like a ketchup bottle does. That part of the cap is what leaks. Then, as if that is not bad enough, the design of the bottle is to store it UPSIDE DOWN....
Take the cap on the bottle now and throw it away, replace it with a simple screw on cap and now you will have a full 5 star product. Now though it is below 1 star because of leakage. Will be returning them.

text: I bought mine years ago when this model first came out. I noticed the battery wasn't holding a charge anymore so I bought a replacement set for less than ten dollars and did the simple repair myself as per instructions from the battery vendors website. When this one finally kicks the bucket and is beyond repair I will not hesitate in buying another Norelco. It is built to last with the normal maintenance of cleaning and lubrication and if you are a bit handy it will last far longer. This model has an adjustment for closeness of cut for those with sensitive skin and a basic flip out trimmer on the back. The head assembly flips open and is also easily removable for cleaning as are each of the cutter heads for a more comprehensive cleaning job. As per the instructions always keep the individual cutters and foil heads paired when cleaning and reassembling as they wear together.

title: Best toothbrush made.
text:
A great alternative to the expensive plug in version. It has just as much power - maybe more. Reliability is about the same. You end up spending more for batteries, but the unit is much cheaper to begin with. I'm not sure how much electricity costs are for the plug in model. I subtract a star from both this one and the plug in model because of reliability. Over the years I have had almost everything go wrong from dead batteries to bad switches to corroded wires to just plain dead. The first one I had lasted 4 years. None have since. These units are not repairable. Expect them to last a year, maybe two.

This unit has the exact same mechanism as the expensive plug in model and uses the same replacement heads and is about the same size. The batteries come out the bottom and there is an O ring seal there. If moisture is allowed to enter it will mess up the battery compartment. If you stand it vertically after use rather than laying it down it will last much much longer because the water drains off it. I get a month, sometimes two, out of a set of batteries.

Do not buy the suggested newer model of this for $15. It's not the same as the others. It a motor driven thing with a huge head that is hard to use and doesn't do near as good of a job. It's small and cheap. Junk.

title: So sad
text:
This was the most perfect foundation I've ever used. I bet I used it for 12-15 years, and it never let me down. The formulation was consistent, light with medium coverage, no fragrance, slightly yellow enough to be the perfect color. It was worth every dime. My skin transitioned into middle age on this foundation, and I didn't realize what a rare thing that is. Most of the products on the market are made for younger skin, though they don't necessarily specify that. This one transcended a range of needs, including aging, blurring, SPF, tone...

The new line that replaced this one is heavier coverage and not the same quality product. Now the line doesn't work well with older skin, and Benefit doesn't really have a line that is made for older skin. Also, their other lines don't have the warm/yellow undertone. They are more orangey. So thanks for being really clear about your ageism and market. That's too bad.

title: What?
text:
I can't tell that this Mist does anything, except make my hair smell like tea tree mint toothpaste. And for $26 a bottle, it needs to be fabulous.

This product is designed to change the alkalinity of your hair, so that it stays smooth and shiny. I accomplish that with light argon oil. Truly, I couldn't tell that this product did anything. I see no merit to its use, and would look toward other finishing products to smooth hair and restore shine. They're also usually much cheaper than this Mist.

title: Finally! A place to get the Brown in a GREAT mascara!
text:
It's very hard to find this color in a drug store. Us blondies (or gray-ies, as the case may be for those of us over 45) look goofy in black mascara, and this color -- combined with really the best mascara on the market for non-waterproof, long-lasting, and thickening capabilities -- is my first choice among the many.

title: Customization in your soap, what?
text:
This hand soap really reached out to me, pun intended. The signed card with a photo of the couple, really shows who your buying from. I might be a sap when it comes to having heart strings, but that just plucked my heart chords.

With every handsoap, conditioner, body wash, pretty much every kind of fragrance imaginable ---- can be completely customized. Want more gunpowder and more bonfire? or maybe more of just everything? heck, what about old fashioned scentless? To me, as a fragrance fanatic, this is a complete solid. I wanna come out smelling great, wherever I may tread. These two got your back, so Buck up, cowgirls and cowboys, this ain't your normal (soap) rodeo.

I do not claim to know soap or how its made, but I can tell you when a real company is looking out for you and has it's best intentions for you. Don't be scared to get your hands dirty this time, partner, this brand is one for outlaws only.

TLDR: great soap, you can customize it to a hand wash to body wash to even salve cologne. New company with inspiring couple that you can get behind.

text:
Update 05Oct2020:
I used the lavender bath bombs last night and remembered to take pictures of the water this time. The lavender bomb really did make my water a very pretty purple. When I used the eucalyptus bath bomb, it really did my water a really pretty blue green color. My tub didn’t stain, nor did my bath billow. And since I got rid of the horrendous item that I kept having to mess with that caused me to make the pillow keep sliding, the pillow stayed put this time. I HIGHLY recommend this product!

I received this two days ago, 19 September 2020, and I put it to use yesterday 20 Sept 2020. I’m really happy with this purchase. My initial impression was very positive. It really did look like it came straight out of a spa. It was squishy and felt comfortable. The bathbombs were a great touch. And it came with a very large mesh bag so that you can wash in there and not ruin it (I think, that’s what that is for). When I used it yesterday, it really did feel comfortable and there were no pressure pains. It did slide a bit down, but was easy to slide back up into position (I think it was also sliding because I kept having to adjust another item not from this purchase). The bathbomb that I used yesterday was the eucalyptus one. The fragrance in the box was nice, once I opened it, the fragrance was more subtle. It turned my bath water blue! It looked really nice but then I was thinking it was going to stain my tub blue. After I drained my tub there were no stains (phew!). The actual bath pillow was very easy to rinse off and hang up to dry. It was overall a very pleasant experience. The way this came, would make a great gift for someone. I know I would LOVE to have received this as a gift.

title: Comprehensive review of robusta coffee scrub
text:
I recently used this scrub and felt inspired to write a review about it for those that aren't sure if they should get this scrub or not.

Before buying this scrub, I was aware coffee scrubs have been trending for a year or so. As others, I was very skeptical about it and wasn't sure how I felt about this beauty trend. The only way I was going to find out was to give it a try.

Here's what I learned after using it that I think will help others should you decide to try it:

1) Prepare your environment and set aside time before using it - Prior to using the scrub, decide where you are going to use it (shower, bath, fenced backyard, etc.) because I'm warning you now, it's gonna get messy. I have a regular sized shower/bath, so if I plan on using this again, I would get myself completely wet, sit in the tub, use the scrub all over my body, rinse off (still sitting), then finally stand up to complete washing off. If you have a private fenced off backyard where you are near a hose, that's a good setting too. The whole process took approximately 40-50 minutes (I like to take my time). I used the whole pack because I literally used it all over my body, but you can use whatever amount you want. Just know that you will need time to really work it into your skin and let it set for a few minutes before washing it off.

2) Be honest with yourself about your skin regimen - What I mean is, if you are not disciplined about your skin regimen or don't want to take time to use this scrub, then honestly I don't know this product is going to work for you. Personally, I'm committed to a regular and consistent skin regimen and set aside time to use this product to get optimal results. I am just saying this isn't like a typical scrub and takes more time to work it in to your skin.

3) You'll likely need soap to get the rest of it off - Even after a rinse, it will stain, just like coffee will do, so I used some shea butter body wash and a body brush to get the rest of it off. Once I was completely clean, I dried off and used body shop cocoa butter all over my body (it's what I usually use anyway).

4) For people with very oily skin be aware - Since this product has coconut oil and you are highly prone to breaking out, I'm not sure if this is a good idea; the amount of coconut oil is definitely noticeable so just be aware.

The verdict: I will say, this made me feel amazing afterwards. My skin felt very smooth and soft. That being said, I bought it without having any expectations. I tried it mainly out of curiosity. As there are advances in beauty products, I am naturally going to want to try new things. I have heard that coffee scrubs reduce cellulite or supports regeneration of new skin cells. Honestly I don't know if that's true and frankly find that doubtful. However, I can say it is better than most scrubs I've used in the past, and it's a wonderful treat for the skin from time to time. I would buy and use it again for occasional use.

title: Velvety feel - creates a matte effect and reduces the appearance of pores and wrinkles.
text: This product has been a 'must have' since I discovered it.  When I received my first bottle, I applied to half of my face to see if it made a difference and it really does, in terms of minimizing the appearance of fine lines and pores by creating a matte-like foundation!  When the bottle is approaching empty, the product gets crumbly and I tend to discard the bottle before it is completely empty, which is a shame.  A couple of tips I've learned about using this product - 1. When spreading the product on your face, spread in the direction that your peach-fuzz facial hairs grow.  2. Keep it away from your brows as it will look crumbly and flaky (like eyebrow dandruff?) if it gets into them.  Otherwise it is great and I often use it with no other makeup.

title: Great concept - just falls short of the intended use!
text: I was really curious about receiving this product - as I LOVE the concept. I am constantly looking for a cover for my razors - both to keep them clean and to prevent my little ones from coming in contact with the blade. Unfortunately, this design just really falls short. There is a metal plate within the clamp like pod which the blade sits against when the pod is closed. I understand the metal was likely placed there to protect the blade and prevent unnecessary dulling and the build up of gunk. Most razors on the market today have a strip of lotion or emollient along the top of the blade. Unfortunately, the metal from the pod kept fusing to the strip causing both the strip to come off and the plastic of the pod to pull free - resulting in both a broken pod and a damaged and unusable razor. I would also caution this company regarding the name and claim of the product. Although the product is meant to provide a protective cover to the razor -  it by no means provides any sort of sterile environment.... thus I do think calling this a “steripod” might be a bit misleading.

title: Fantastic
text: Prior to discovering this product, I used another, much pricier coverup.  It was ok but the applicator was strange and a lot of the expensive cream was wasted.  Also, it didn't last all day.  Pur concealer is perfect.  It spreads easily, blends in nicely and does the job.  Even my undereye dark circles are minimized.  It looks like a small amount of product but a little goes a long way and the tube lasts a very long time, even with daily use.  Update 4/15/2022:  Many months ago, I purchased a second tube of this product because I figured the first tube would soon be gone.  Not so!  Here it is, at least 4 months later and, even with generous daily use, it's only this morning I had to open the new tube.  Great product, lasts a long time, easy to apply and well priced.  The folks who don't like the applicator might try dapping on the small amount needed and spreading it with a fingertip.  Works great that way.

title: Not what I expected but...
text:
When I ordered this, I thought it was a regular ol' hose nozzle. It's not -- you can actually attach it to a pressure washer as well. I was not overly impressed with this at first. The pressure washer attachment came connected to the hose nozzle and it was an absolute pain to remove (my husband had to use pliers to get it out). It was easy enough to attach to the hose but somewhat a pain to take off. It also only seems to have 2 spray patterns, not 4 like advertised (a hard "line" spray and a softer line spray).

I was not comfortable spraying my flowers with this because it seemed to spray fairly hard, even when I turned the nozzle to reduce the spray. So, I started spraying off the mold on my sidewalk. Our house faces north and is fairly shaded in the front and, since it rains a lot in Florida, tends to get mold build-up on the front sidewalks. As you can see from the picture I posted, this nozzle does actually help spray off mold. It's not quite a pressure washer but it was able to remove the heavy stuff (but, remember, it does come with the pressure washer attachment). I am giving this four stars because it's not quite what I expected but it does help remove mold from cement, which makes it worth having.

I couldn't even figure out how to change the drill heads (I had to get my husband involved and he had trouble getting the lock to release).  I would have given this a higher rating if it had just come with instructions (as in this is how you change the drill heads or this drill head is for when you want to do XXX, etc.).  That aside, the kit is nice to have for anyone who maintains their nails.

The temperature and air speed adjustments provide plenty of choice and the cool button really sets the style.  Its better than other products at twice the price.

title: A Thick and Rich Eye Cream.
text:
EDITED REVIEW as of 9/25/21.

I came back to edit this review and to lower my rating from 4 stars to 3 stars. Here's why:

After a few weeks of using this cream, I started to develop some sensitivity to it. When I say sensitivity, here's what I mean: 1) The scent bothered me more than it did when I first used the cream. In fact, I started to sneeze most evening after applying it. 2) I'd used the cream on other areas of my face, and noticed minor breakouts in those areas.

Basically, I think the cream was just too oily for my skin. Even around the eye area, which has virtually no oil glands, the non-absorbency of the cream left me feeling sticky and greasy even though I gave the cream plenty of time to absorb.

End of Edit.

***************************************************************************************************************************

Everything else I said in my original review still stands. But the above edit may help you decide if this is the right eye cream for you.

If you're looking for a natural, plant-based eye cream that is ultra-thick and rich, you'll find it in this 2 oz. jar.

The jar will last a VERY long time, because you only need a tiny amount of this cream to cover the undereye area and the corners where crows feet form.

I'd advise putting the cream on a couple of hours before bed, since it takes quite a while to absorb into the skin. (If you don't wait, you'll end up depositing most of the cream on your pillowcase.)

I've also used a small amount of this cream on other areas of my face (nose to mouth lines) and the results were the same as around my eye area.

So what were the results? The skin around my eye area looked smoother and brighter after one night of use.
The results on other parts of my face were less noticeable, but I believe continued use of the cream will improve the results in both the eye area and on the face.

I'm rating the cream 4 stars instead of 5, because of one major issue I have with it, which is: THE SCENT.
The cream has a rather strong minty (?), menthol (?) medicinal smell that takes some time to fade away.
Since I prefer NO SCENT in eye/facial products, I deducted one star from my rating.

That aside, if scented products don't bother you, and you want a thick, rich eye cream you will probably enjoy using this one.

title: Gives a QUICK and CLOSE Shave.
text:
I ordered this for my partner, who has been using a 3-head rotary shaver to shave his head. This one does a far better job! It has many great features, including:

1) It arrives fully charged, ready to use.

2) Along with the 6-head shaving attachment, It has just about every shaving accessory you could want; a facial cleansing brush, sideburn trimmer, nose/ear trimmer, face cleaning sponge.

3) It is washable.

4) It comes with the USB cord for charging, and you get approximately 90 minutes of shave time after 1.5 hours of charging.

HERE'S THE BEST PART: It gives a QUICK and CLOSE shave to my partner's head, with no tugging or pulling.
He said "This is like having a riding mower for my head, versus a push-mower". LOL! I think that's a pretty good testimonial.

As a final note, the price is reasonable, especially considering all the good features of this unit.

P.S. to the ladies: I think the 6-head attachment could make a great shaver for your legs, so you might want one of your own. :>)

title: Pretty scent, silky feel.
text:
I've tried many brands of purple shampoos/conditioners in the never-ending battle against brassy tones.
This is one of the better brands.

First of all, I love the scent. It is vaguely floral, definitely a feminine scent. It smells wonderful in the shower, but I like the fact that it fades quickly once you rinse it away. It doesn't linger all day, meaning it won't compete with any other fragrance you are wearing.

Second, I like the fact that this set is gentle, and non-drying. (Some other brands have left me with straw-like hair after a few uses.) This combo cleans gently, and leaves the hair feeling silky.

Third, the toning is effective. There is a visible difference after just a couple of uses. I saw the yellow/orange tones had faded after the first use, and after the second, my hair was shiny and showed highlights, but there was a marked difference in the amount of brassiness.

Fourth, I like the fact that the shampoo is natural (made with botanicals) and is sulfate and paraben free. It is also cruelty free, another big plus. The pump bottles are also great, making the shampoo and conditioner easy to use in the shower. They are plastic, so no breakage issues.

Finally, the price is right. The shampoo and conditioner bottles each contain 16.9 fl. oz of product. A good buy.

Bottom line, this is a solid 5 star set. Recommended!

title: 7 tools for just over $7 dollars.
text:
This manicure set comes boxed, and tightly wrapped in plastic. It seems like you get a lot with this little set. The implements include scissors, 2 pair of nail clippers, a file, etc.

All the implements are rather "lightweight", meaning just that. They don't feel like heavy-duty metal. And maybe it's because of the light weight, but they don't seem especially sharp. They do an okay job clipping the nails, but just okay.

Still, you get 7 tools for just over $7 dollars, so if you want just a basic manicure set, or something to travel with, this set will be good enough for that.

title: Sampler set is a great way to try English Laundry.
text:
There are four bottles included in this nicely packaged set. The set comes in a dark brown "textured" heavy cardboard box, wrapped in a clear plastic sleeve. I mention the specifics of the packaging, because the pretty packaging makes it gift-ready. (Just add a bow or a ribbon, a name tag, and you're done!)

Despite the fact that I'm calling this a "sampler set" the 20 ml bottles are good size. (Not tiny little things.) There's plenty of product to use each fragrance for awhile. (You can really get to know the aromas this way. It's not a one-and-done type of sampler.)

All four fragrances are pleasant, clean, and crisp. My partner likes Oxford Bleu and Riviera the most. He says these have a "fresh" smell to him. (I agree!. The Oxford Bleu is my favorite.)

If you're not familiar with English Laundry scents, this set is a great way to try several of their offerings. If you already love English Laundry, here's a chance to enjoy some of your favorites.

title: Gentle and effective

It lasted several days without recharging and makes quick work of stubble, but he has to go over an area a few times as hairs will be missed. It's easy to clean out because the top pops open and can be brushed out. Overall, a good buy.

title: Nice electric shaver by Wahl
text:
I had a set of Wahl clippers that lasted for over a decade. I finally got a new pair of clippers and through the old clippers away. I miss my old Wahl clippers they were a super workhorse set of clippers. I had no idea that Wahl even made shavers.

I have had quite a few high-end electric shavers, and they all have the same problem, they just don't shave as close as a razor. The positive thing about electric shavers is that they are easy to use for quick touch ups and convenient shaves when you don't want to mess with water and creams and lotions.

This Wahl shaver, in particular, is pretty nice. It shaves about as close as other electric shavers, which isn't as close as a manual razor, but with repeated use and going back and forth, it is better than no shave. Some type of pre-shave lotion, like Williams Lectric shave, helps a little.

Still, this is a pretty decent shaver. It charges fast and holds the charge for a long time. The top pops off easy to clean the blades. You can use the provided brush or just rinse it off with water. You can also use it in the shower or wet/dry shave. The directions say not to submerge it under 3 feet of water.

It also has a shaver that pops up for sideburns or whatever you would want a clean smooth line on. Bottom line this is a pretty good shaver.

title: Do not buy
text:
I installed this hair for a quick half up half down style for an event. Not ENTIRELY disappointed considering I knew this wouldn’t be the best hair for such a cheap price, but I didn’t expect it to mat and tangle after only a few hours.

I installed this hair the night after I received it, we were taking a road trip the following morning so I had done nothing but sat in the car. The hair was matted and tangled after only a few hours in the car. No wind, no heat, just matted. It got extremely dry after day 3, EXTREMELY.

I will say using argan oil helped with the dryness, left it shiny and easier to comb through. But left the hair oily after so many uses to the point it doesn’t hold a curl. Also, the ends are very very dry, I crimpped this hair and it will hold a crimp— everywhere BUT but ends. The ends will straightened and dried out within an hour or so.

title: The drying "moisturizing cream"
text:
This is not a cream, it's a gel
This is not moisturizing. My skin felt dry and tight seconds (not minutes) after applying it. In fact, I had applied jojoba oil to my face PRIOR to applying the "moisturizer" (as I typically do) and the "moisturizer" somehow managed to take away the moisture of the oil and leave my skin feeling dryer than before I used the oil!

This might be perfect for someone with normal type skin who moisturizes for fun, or "insurance" (?), when they really don't need moisture. (Possibly the same people who are freaked out about any kind of residue on their skin.) But if you have dry skin and you need moisture, as I do, I suggest you look elsewhere; sadly, (the ingredients looked promising), it will not be found within.

title: Wonderful chocolate substitute
text: I love this stuff.  It's definitely not chocolate, it is carob, (so the flavor is different) but I have used it successfully as a substitute for chocolate in a couple of recipes (namely Wheat Belly Chocolate Chip Cookies - I just made them into chocolate cookies without the chips - and the "Make It Paleo" cookbook coconut fudge) and it's enough of a chocolate flavor that it satisfies my cravings for chocolate, without the negative effects of caffeine and the extra sugar needed to cover the bitter taste of chocolate (carob is not bitter so less sweetener is needed).  I'm also thrilled that it's organic and raw.

title: Well Made Unit
text: This is an extremely well-made unit and appears completely waterproof.  It charges in about an hour with a charge that lasts me four showers.  While it removes some skin I would prefer stiffer rubber “bristles.”  The handle is made of a slippery plastic that is impossible to hang into with soapy hands.  Probably OK for the bathtub, but risky in the shower.  Men usually have larger backs and are less flexible.  So I made a longer “handle” with a 12” PVC pipe, attached with a gasket and a hose clamp, easily removed for charging.  The pipe also doesn’t slip in a soapy hand.  With all the running gear in the head the unit is top heavy when in the charger.  Even the suction cups on the charger base can’t hold it upright.  However, the gasket for the handle also pushes the unit enough off center to balance it and prevent fall overs.  The instruction sheet is a riot.  It reads like it was run from Chinese through a translation program into “English.”  The best line is “Especially designed with horny brush and thus removing residual horniness.”  If only it were so simple!  It should be rewritten by a native English speaker.

title: Performance Just Like the Dentist Office BUT for ~ $140 on Sale now
text: We tried several home teeth whitening kits and most gave marginal results.  But this kit, performs just the same as what you get at the Dentist.  Look at the picture I posted.  Its the teeth color card. Out of 1 - 20, my wife started with 14 top and 11 bottom. She drank a lot of coffee, red wine, etc...We tried this kit and got her down to 4 top and 2 bottom. Her teeth are just as white as the dentist office whitening service.  Here is what separates this kit from others: 1) Performance is second to none, 2) You get most of the whitening results the first application which is 8 minutes.  Remember with this kit, you have to do 4 sets of 8 minutes per day.  Meaning a total of 32 minutes total per day.  Getting most of the whitening in the first 8 minutes is amazing results 3) It only takes 5 days and 2.5 vials total out of the 10 vials that comes with the kit.  Meaning she can maintain her whiteness for the next 4 months without spending more. The procedure costs ~$400 at the dentist. You pay ~$140 - $150 for this kit for the same fast results and can maintain it for 4 months, depending on your teeth.  Meaning out of all of the teeth whitening solutions available, this one ends up being the MOST COST EFFECTIVE with guaranteed results.  Meaning if your teeth were able to whiten before, you should get the same whitening again.  My teeth can't be whitened because how they developed before my permanent teeth came out. I had a high fever so my teeth are a little yellow as a result and can't be whitened much even at the dentist.  At any rate, this is the real thing and you keep the blue light system and battery pack.  Just buy more vials later when you run out.  Enjoy!

title: The best a man can get!
text:
Oh, yes it is!

Anyone who says otherwise probably hasn't given it the money back guarantee time for the skin to adjust.

Not quite as close as a blade, but with a beard as heavy as mine (& with sensitive skin to boot), who cares?! The wife agrees, and if that isn't good enough..

Buy a refurbished one for about half price at Goodman's - also through Amazon.

title: Best yet from Phillips/Norelco.
text:
Yes, it's true. This is a good switch from even the latest Gillette multi-blade wonder. Even the replacement lotion (or gel) cartridges are much cheaper than those blades or the multi-pack (whole plastic ones with a handle) throws-away.

I recommend spreading the lotion or gel with a finger rather than relying on the 'glide rings' as this will make it go further. Also, any basic model without the bells and whistles will serve you just as well.

I suffer from a heavy growth/sensitive skin combination, and find this razor to be the best Phillips/Norelco device, yet.

I bought mine about eight months ago, and even shave my head with it. Not quite as close as the 'naked' blade, but as mine grows to stubble within a few hours - who cares? My wife LOVES it, too - and can't stop kissing and sniffing my face and head after I shave!

Now for the going shopping bit:

I highly suggest going for a factory refurbished unit. This is by far the best value for your money at about one third the price of a new one. I found mine at Goodmans (also available through Amazon). These are simply shavers that someone has tried and returned because it didn't suit them. Mine is absolutely like brand new, and arrived in the same sealed packaging as a 'new' one. Obviously the heads and cutters have been replaced, making them perfectly clean and safe.

Yaba-daba-do. I'm a very happy camper (shaving camper, that is)!

Bon chance, fellow hairy's..

title: Laura Mercier Night Nutrition a good value
text: My jar is almost empty and I can honestly evaluate it, according to my personal experience.  First of all, I love the smell....so light.  It reminds me of my mother's Pond's face cream of the 50's.  It goes on light and feels instantly moisturizing on your skin.  Doesn't soak in quickly.  Everyone seems to really love this cream according to all the reviews I saw on the internet. It is creamy and light and feels great when you first put it on.  Just one important thing the reviews don't tell you - after a short time,the cream will begin to "ball up" on the face if you wear it under makeup. Fine for going to bed but give it an hour so it doesn't come off on the pillow.  Nowhere have I seen anything about it balling up mentioned, so I am only giving you a heads up on the fact that it does this.  Otherwise, it does moisturize your skin very well and will last a long while during the day if you don't wear makeup over it.  When I am home, I usually apply after my shower and wear no makeup.  Works better that way for me.

title: LOOKS like a big bottle - IT IS NOT, Nor is the brand I thought.
text:
OK, I searched for another product. Amazon included this one in the list.
It LOOKS like a big bottle. It is NOT. It is a little 32 oz jug.
The product I was looking for was "xxxxxx Foaming hand wash refill"
This product is .49 cents an ounce vs .17 cents an ounce.
I did not notice the brand I wanted, I did not notice what looked like a large (gal?) bottle was not.
When it arrived on time I was shocked that I made such a mistake, but I guess it is my fault.
So, while this is an expensive product I would not have bought, I guess because it came up on the search for the name brand product I wanted, it is my fault.
Just don't make the same mistake I did. Regardless of if it is good or not, It is expensive.

title: It's hard to manage sometimes because I don't like shampoo that weighs my hair down or make them ...
text:
I have long black hair and of medium thickness. The length is up to my belly button which is consider very long. It's hard to manage sometimes because I don't like shampoo that weighs my hair down or make them tangled.

This argan oil shampoo smells very good but I prefer something that is not scented with chemicals which are labeled as "parfum"
The scent don't really bother me. The texture is nice and not too thick. Lathers up my hair nicely with a quarter size. Since I have a lot of hair, I have to use a quarter size or more. I scratch and rub my scalp for about 30-50 seconds before I rinse in a bucket. This helps me to clean my hair even better. Instead of just rinse form the shower, which dandruff can still stick in my hair.
I am quite impressed with the result. My hair is not too dry not oily at all but moisturized. It feels silky with some volume and smells great.

title: Woh. Check it out
text:
This is an unique mirror. I have yet to see one like this. The mirror came with a standard tweezer. Not the best but can't complain.

It is very well made and high quality. There are two mirrors; enlargement and normal. Very well designed for applying makeup because of light.
A good size. Neither too big or small. Travel friendly and great for those messy desks ;)
Adjustable and very light weigh.

The mirror has 3 slots for batteries. To open the cover on the bottom you have to turn the circular plate.
Three slides for lighting option; top mirror light, and bottom. It's not necessary but totally awesome.
I can't get over this mirror!

Discount received for the mirror for testing and reviewing purpose. All of my reviews are 100% honest and unbiased. Thank you for reading!

title: I have used these before and love them. They exfoliate nicely
text: I have used these before and love them. They exfoliate nicely. Aren't too rough on skin, and the sudsing cleanser is gentle on skin. Helps remove all my heavy makeup and keeps my skin clear from acne by removing all the dead skin.  My skin is very sensitive & I have rosacea, so grainy-scrubs tend to be much for my skin. These are awesome and I re-use them after rinsing well & air dry. I don't use toner nor moisturizer on my face, and these don't dry my skin out. I also use Retin-A & Oracea, so my skin does a lot of peeling and is very sensitive to scrubs, but these are fine (just don't use too much pressure; just lightly touch face in circular motion and rinse with cool water to close pores. If your skin is super sensitive like mine, I only use pure aloe vera (from the leaf, not chemically treated in a bottle) to moisturize, and ssoothe my skin.  These are my go to for exfoliating my sensitive skin.

title: Love the curls and price!
text: I was skeptical at first, but I absolutely love the curls this bubble wand produces! I have stubborn, hard to hold curls kinda hair, but I curled my hair before bedtime and woke up still with nice curls! I went to work at the hospital and needless to say, it lasted my entire 8 hour shift without hair products/hair spray! Everyone loved it as they never see me with curly hair unless I’m going out LoL The on my thing I don’t care for is the stand for placing it down, as I had to keep flipping it up and down when I was curling my hair. One thing I can recommend is to section your hair and when curling, only curl a small section at a time because if you grab too much hair (I have a lot of hair and thick hair too), then it won’t curl well. Another thing is, I can’t guess how long to hold my hair on the wand before releasing so I’m just guesstimating and pray I’ve held it long enough to get the curl I want. I’m too afraid of holding too long, damaging my hair. I purchased this item bc it was on sale for less than $19, saving me $20, so I figured I’d give it a try. I also purchased a TYMO airflow flat iron/curler (on sale too) at the same time as this purchase and tested both products and since I love both, I’m keeping both! I’d recommend either products or both! Woman can never have enough hair styling products, makeup or skin care products LoL
