title: Norelco replaced my old Braun
text:
I just got my first Norelco model 8825 XL, after 7 years using a Braun 4501. I considered these two brands the top in the electrical shaving industry. In some aspects I founded the Norelco reigning over the Braun and in other aspects the Braun is much better. So, the question you should ask yourself is what type of hair are you trying to shave?
Let first look at the Norelco series:
The different between the Norelco's Spectra (8000 series), Quadra (7000 series), Advantage (6000 series), and the Reflex (5000 series) is one major feature added to each series. The Reflex sports the basic "Lift & Cut" system. The Advantage is the same but include a lotion dispenser. The Quadra's "Lift and Cut" system has two types of head with a slot and hole. The Spectra series has what the Quadra does, but include a comfort control. Both the Quadra and Spectra don't have lotion dispenser. There are also more special features that can be found in each series by looking at the 2nd digit. For example the Spectra 8894 have a digital screen where the bare-bone lower number Spectra 8825 have just a green light.
The performances, Norelco vs. Braun:
I have soft hair in the beard area and thicker hair around the lips (mustache and chin area). The Norelco does a superior job in the beard area; it cut it clean with a couple of strokes. When using the Braun (older model 4501), I sometime have to use a long trimmer and then go back over with the coil. The Norelco three individual heads move over the sides of the face a lot better. Braun does do a superior job over the mustache area. It coils has more and bigger holes then Norelco. The Spectra with it dual slot and hole head is good but takes longer time to cut down the thicker stub. The old Braun battery (NH-) is dying on me. Norelco battery (NiCd) is replaceable and you use it charged or just plug and play, which the Braun could not do. Overall, I prefer the Norelco's design.
The features I like:
I am still playing with the Personal Comfort Control and am not sure if it is necessary. The more sensitive the level is the long it takes to cut so far. The long hair trimmer is great, but that is almost standard in most models, but not the Advantage's Series. Plug and play is great, since I don't travel every day. Cleaning is simple; just rinse it in the sink. I like the solid construction the Norelco's design is, the rotating machine is fun to use and is very smooth.

title: For cleaning your teeth it should be easier to clean.
text:
So I bought this after seeing all the advertisements about how great sonicare is, and don't get me wrong, it is.

But the brush leaves much to be desired for.

The brush head screws into and a rubber pad rest on an area inside the handle that and this is what delivers the vibrations. Yet, in this area water gets trapped and start to allow mold and other things to grow within the area. Take off the brush head and you see black mold inside and all along where the brush screws in. If you are not grossed out by this you should be. It is impossible to clean this area well. I have tried basically everything and still specks of mold remain and it grows back quickly. Not sure how this effects my oral hygiene but I wish I had known beforehand.

title: This last year it's gotten pretty bad. I decided to give this stuff a ...
text:
So I have been dealing with adult acne for well.. 10+ years. This last year it's gotten pretty bad. I decided to give this stuff a try, because why not... Well it is actually making a difference, like more than anything else I have tried. I have only been using it a week, but I am seeing a reduction in new acne and I am seeing the skin production rate sort of go up so my skin is healing faster. I think this product causes minor inflammation of the face, which is partially responsible for the smooth looking skin. I am seriously very impressed with this product, and I will follow up in a few more weeks with hopefully some even better results.

I am using Tretinoin .05 also, which dries up my skin a ton. This stuff actually hasn't produced any additional peeling, and I am actually using it in place of lotion. Now my skin has already become accustomed to the super peely tretinoin, so your results may vary. For me though, this is much less irritating and I think it's making a solid companion to my prescription tretinoin.

If you are in a situation like mine, adult acne, not sure where to go next... I would seriously give this a shot. My results have been good so far, and it's honestly making me feel so much better about life.

title: Disappointing.
text:
This product is very disappointing. Initially I was excited to find a non-peel nail polish that was water based - I'm allergic to harsh chemicals, so traditional nail polish isn't an option. I've used Suncoat peelable nail polish before and liked it a lot because it was completely odor free and did not cause any allergic reaction. It did not last long on my nails, but I figured it was essentially meant for kids, so it's OK it if only lasts for a few hours. I was only wearing it out for dinner, etc. Then I've found out that Suncoat also makes water based polish that is non-peel. I figured I would give it a try. I've read multiple reviews stating that with proper application the product would last a few days on the nails. 2 or 3 days of wear are more than enough for me as I like to change my colors often. Also, I understand that water based polish would never be as durable as the traditional polish, so I was perfectly OK to change it out every couple of days. As soon as the product arrived I applied it as instructed. I did it shortly before bed time so that I wouldn't get my nails wet and allow the polish to cure. By the time I woke up it had already chipped! So, I reapplied and went to work. By the time I got to work it was chipped again! This was embarrassing; I spent good 20 minutes trying to scrap the polish off my nails. Luckily, it came off easily.

What's even more disappointing is that Suncoat customer service does not seem to care about customers. I've contacted them asking if they had any helpful advice and so far received no response.

title: One of these things is not like the other
text:
The One Million LUCKY is my favorite scent on my husband. He ran out and I missed the smell, so I ordered more. However... One of these things is not like the other. Or rather, one of these things is like both...

The left bottle is a genuine bottle of One Million Lucky, the center bottle is what I just received, and the right bottle is One Million.

The bottle I just received.... Notice the one on the left has the chrome/gold front and clear glass? The one on the right has a gold front and amber glass? Hm. The one in the center has the chrome/gold front.... But amber glass??? It also smells nothing like Lucky. It definitely smells more of the regular One Million.

I have reordered and only HOPE this is an isolated incident and I get the correct thing this next time.
-----
I rec'd the bottle I reordered today, and thankfully everything seems to be legit with it and I can resume sniffing my husband.

I tried multiple cowashes, and this was finally my ahhh yes! Moment. I love the way this makes my hair feel. It doesn't make my roots feel greasier, but it makes my lengths feel much softer.

title: I do really like it and it may take longer than using an ...
text:
EDIT: Just an update from my previous review. After using this a few more times, I do really like it and it may take longer than using an acetone-based polish remover but it won't dry out your nails. There isn't much of a scent at all, just smells like oil, and after soaking each nail with a cotton pad for about 1-2 minutes the polish begins to rub off easily. It is a bit messy and I do usually wash my hands afterwards because the oil isn't very absorbent, but it is still much better feeling than using regular polish remover.

Once this bottle is empty I'll try out another similar product, but so far this is still a great polish remover if you're patient. Also didn't stain or discolor my nails or skin.

title: Smells Lovely But Very Weak
text:
I bought my first two Auric Blends perfumes two years ago and was very pleased. I bought another two last summer and two more just recently. The scents are lovely and I wish I could describe them in detail, but the last four perfumes I bought are more diluted each time and I can't pick up on the depth of the fragrances. I even wrote an email to Auric Blends politely voicing concern. I understand perfume ingredients must be expensive, but "watering down" perfumes with carrier oil to make the batch more cost efficient is compromising the product. I, and I believe many of my fellow Auric Blends fans will agree, would be fine with a small price increase if it meant the perfumes could be concentrated again. I sincerely mean that, because I like this company.

The latest two I purchased are Sandalwood and Divine Opium. Sandalwood is woody and sweet. Divine Opium has similar notes to my favorite Black Opium but a little brighter. Like I said, they're so weak that the full fragrance notes are hard to pick up on, and the scent fades quickly.

title: This is not only the best natural/organic liquid eyeliner
text:
This is not only the best natural/organic liquid eyeliner, but also the best liquid eyeliner I have used in general. I have been slowly switching all my beauty products to natural products for health reasons and was worried I wouldn't be able to find a good eyeliner that didn't smear or cause "racoon" eyes. This product stays on all day and night and does not need reapplication throughout the day. It's waterproof, so it's a little more difficult to remove at the end of the day like most waterproof makeup products in general. Also, one of these eyeliners lasted me 3 months of almost everyday wear!

My only suggestion is the brand name be written on the label of the product. I received this from a friend as a gift for my birthday and it took me awhile to find it again because there was no name listed on the label!

title: One of the best sunscreens..
text:
I purchased this product because my dad told me it was one of the best (he heard it on the news so it has to be the truth.. Right?) So when I received it we were going to the beach that weekend. Best time to try it out if you ask me. One of my children has dark skin and the other is pale and burns easily. We applied it 15 minutes before heading down to the beach and we were out in the sun for hours. Neither one of them burned.
I used it as well as my husband and it did its job very well. I even got a little tan but no burning. My husbands face burns very easily and this stuff protected him 100% and we only applied it once. I probably should of put it on my kids a few times in the amount of time we were there but I had left it in the hotel room. I am very pleased with this product. title: Lasts for MONTHS.

I regularly remove them from her hair, soak them in water with dishwashing liquid while I am simultaneously washing her hair, and then I reinstall the hair when it is dry. She just wears one of those extra long satin scarves to bed to keep the twists from fraying.

Learning how to install these myself has saved a lot of money. I don't even know how to do cornrows, so I had to find a method of braiding on YouTube that flatly connects braids together. These twists have made it through months of a busy tween, so they are a good buy for everyone.

title: Thrilled with this mask!!
text:
I love this product! It comes in a small container so I was kind of bummed at first, but what little product is in here packs a powerful punch. I highly recommend this if you're looking for a clay or mud type of mask to clarify and clear your skin. I suffer from deep cystic acne and broke out earlier this week. I put on this mud mask and I could not believe how great the results were. Within one day my pimples had disappeared and even my damage spots seem to be less noticeable. My skin felt super soft and clear.

I have a pretty sensitive skin but I didn't have any irritation from this whatsoever. The package says to leave the mask on for 10 or 15 to 20 minutes but I noticed that even after 20 minutes, the mask still was not dried so I did leave it on for longer. It is a bit of a drying mask so if you already have dry skin, you will want to use a moisturizer following the mask. I found that when I combined it with my acne medication that contains benzoyl peroxide and salicylic acid, it was just to drying for my skin. Therefore, I would recommend maybe skipping a day of other chemical products when you use this mask.

The mask it goes on really nice and smooth. I used a Q-tip to mix up the mask material as the directions say to stir it each time you're going to use it. Then I just used the Q-tip to apply the mask and I from layer on my face. The mask has a cooling a fact and isn't a dry or itchy at all. It was a very pleasant experience overall. It wasn't messy at all to use either.

I posted some pictures below of the material in the jar as well as when it was on my face. That way, you can see how quickly I put the mask on my face. I hope the photos are helpful.

Again, I recognize that this is a smaller container than I had previously thought, but you don't need much to cover your entire face. Although I can't say for sure, I am guessing that I would get at least 10 to 15 masks with this product. That is quite a bit considering how much is charged for mud mask facials at spas. Do you make sure that you see all the container tightly and store it in a cool or dark place as it will dry out quickly if you leave it open.

title: Long lasting, high quality temp tattoos
text:
I love this company's products! This is it my first purchase of temporary tattoos from this company and so I am familiar with their brands and products. I would definitely recommend their products if you're looking for high-quality tattoos that are modern and stylish.

These are super easy to put on and tends to stay for several days versus some of the other tattoos on the market. The one I have in the picture below has been on for four days now and it still looks just like the day I applied at.

I love all of the different packs of variety so that you can get a pack of that suits your style and needs. I would definitely recommend these. Application is really simple. You pick the tattoo you want and place it in side down on your skin wherever you would like it to be. Just make sure it is straight and where you want it before you apply the wet paper towel. You just take a wet paper towel and place it over the paper side of the tattoo. The other side you adhere to your skin. Then hold it there for 30 seconds, and when you left it off, the tattoo stays on your skin and the paper peels away. Then, just let it dry.

Love these! I highly recommend them. Happy shopping

title: great set of hair clips--flexible hold and durable for styling
text:
I LOVE these!! I have recently gotten into dyeing my hair crazy unicorn colors and I've gotten sick of ruining my really expensive hair clips with all of the permanent dyes. So I decided to invest in this 6-piece set of clips since I've seen my hair stylist use these when she is separating my hair into different pieces.

Anyway, I have really long and thick hair. So when I'm dyeing my hair, which I do at home, I really need to section the hair pieces off to make sure I get all of the strands saturated with color. Otherwise, well, I'm not really into striped hair at the moment and uneven dye jobs that LOOK like I did it myself at home after drinking too much wine ;)

I got the RED color because I have purple hair and wanted the clips to stand out. I do not plan to wear these out of the house--they are only for my styling needs at home. Otherwise, I would recommend getting a darker color because the plastic isn't super nice or stylish looking. I like that these clips open easily and don't have a super strong grip. Some of my clips are way too tight and I end up pulling my hair out or getting my hair stuck in the coils. I like the more flexible feel of these and that they have more give, so I can move them around. Even though they are flexible, they still hold the hair in place, but just do it less harshly, if that makes sense.

I like the set of 6 because I tend to lose track of my clips and so this way, I will have a nice sized supply and won't always be running around my house searching for clips.

I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I hope you found my review helpful and that I provided enough detailed information so that you can determine whether or not this product is right for you and your lifestyle needs. I take my reviews seriously and try to accurately reflect the true value of the item and not the discounted price I was lucky enough to pay. Enjoy!

title: The All Natural way to remove nail polish!
text:
I'm puzzled by this product. I loved the idea of having a natural, non-toxic nail polish remover. I paint my own nails quite often, skipping the nail salon to save money and time. I've been giving myself manicures and pedicures since 6th grade, so I'm pretty good at it (if I do say so myself) and am well-versed in many of the products out there. I typically use a 100% acetone remover, which is AWESOME, but I hate that there are so many harmful chemicals, not only on my nails, but also in the fumes I'm breathing in every time I use it. So, when I saw this product, I was excited and motivated to try it and like it.

When it arrived, I was also pleased with the size. I had assumed it would be pretty small because of the way the dropper looks next to it in the picture, but it's actually a good sized bottle. Before using any product, I read the directions and particularly with a new type of product like this non-toxic, all-natural nail polish remover. That's when I saw that you have to leave the product on the nail for 2-5 minutes. I don't understand this because once you use the dropper to apply the product to the nail polish that's on the nail, it immediately starts dripping down the sides of the nails onto your hands and makes a bit of a mess. It's also pretty inconvenient to sit there for 5 minutes when I could use my regular nail polish remover and would have clean nails in 30 seconds to a minute. I decided instead to try pouring the product into a shallow bowl and soaking my nails in it instead. This did make it much easier and created less of a mess, but it also requires you to use a lot more of the product than you would just using the dropper.

I waited 2 minutes and took a cotton ball to swipe the nail to see if the polish would come off. It started to, but just the top layer. I re-soaked them in the product for 3 more minutes, and I was able to remove the polish from my nails. I should also mention that I use Orly bonding base coat, which helps the polish adhere to the nail. I also had 3 coats of polish, and a top coat, so that might be why the polish was so stubborn to come off. Plus, it was a deep red, which is difficult to remove no matter what you are using, and it usually dyes my nail beds a bit when I'm removing the polish anyway. As a positive, I did notice that this product was MUCH less harmful on my nails. My acetone remover immediately dries out my nails and strips all the healthy oils from the nails and nail beds. This did not do that. My nails had a nice, healthy shine to them and the nail beds retained their moisture, which is nice.

So, in summary, I love that this product is natural and non-toxic, but it's just not practical for me to spend 5 minutes soaking my nails to wait for the polish to come off. However, if you are super green and more willing to commit to being patient in order to be able to use something that has no chemicals and is good for your body and those around you (which I commend you for!), then this is a great substitute for chemical nail polish removers.

title: Great travel solution!
text:
This portable wig stand was very easy to assemble. I ordered it to hold my halo extensions. I always take them with me when I travel but I don't take the foam head to put them down on because it is way to bulky to pack along. This portable wig stand is a perfect solution. It is taken apart easily packed into any size overnight bag and easily assembled once you get to your destination. You cannot use this a s a stand to style your wigs as you cannot pin it down but this is a great solution for a stand on the go!!
I received this portable wig stand free in order to test it and share my honest and unbiased opinion.

title: Smells so good!
text:
This shampoo smells so good!!
I couldn't wait to start using it. I color my hair and I iron it straight every other day. This causes my hair to look dull and frizzy at times. This shampoo actually reduces the frizz and really increases the shine. Plus it is the only shampoo that actually keeps my hair smelling great for two day!
I like that the bottle is plastic and has a pump. The shampoo lathers well. I don't even need a conditioner after this. It is so hydrating.
I received this shampoo at a promotional price in order to use it evaluate it and share my honest and unbiased opinion.

title: This cream is great

My skin is very dry, and I noticed that this cream keeps my skin soft for most of the day, even through washing them. The cream is unscented. I can read all the ingredients on the panel. Almost all of them are oils. This product is all natural. There is no greasy feel and it absorbs very quickly.
I received this hand cream at a promotional price in order to share my honest and unbiased opinion.

title: Loved the 1" and these 1 1/4"
text: Love these for the pliability, easy to put in; provide long-lasting curls; easy to sleep in; quick to curl; easy to pack when traveling.  Note hair should be relatively long (at least 14") to effectively use these because they are really big. They are nice for a page-boy look.

title: Provide long-lasting, bouncy curls without the headache
text: These are soft and pliable.  I find them a nice alternative to curling and flat irons. The curls from these last several days (personal experience) and the curls are fluffy and bouncy. The larger the roller, the larger the curl.  Mixing them with different size rods has been very successful and gain many compliments. They require being applied to dampened hair if hair is fine, straight. They are soft to sleep on, and when I'm in a hurry and applied for a half hour or so or while showering, they were just as effective as wearing for several hours.

title: great taste, price is high
text:
Rocky Mountain Hemp Hearts have a great taste. I have ordered them a couple of times and used them a number of ways as have other reviewers, but favorite recipe is to add to a smoothie. They taste great and I have never found a hull. I was introduced to them by a local smoothie place which charges about $2 for a scoop, so I decided to find and buy my own and did on Amazon. I agree with the a couple of other reviewers,: 1-The lid of the container does come off too easily, so I wish Rocky Mountain would provide a container with a more secure top. 2: These are very expensive in comparison to other brands. After reading reviews, i have decided to try Nutiva. If it has a lot of hulls, then it's not worth the lower price and I'll I'll post an update.
* Suggestion for Rocky Mountain: lower the price and place them in a bag and customers can transfer to their own containers as most do anyway.

There are still some pink and greenish reflects in certain lightings while in others it’s the pure white I want it to be. I included two photos ones with and one without flash. The one without flash you can kinda see the colored reflects I’m talking about. I painted over grown out white acrylics so you can tell the difference in opaqueness around my cuticles so you’d have to do a white base. This is more ideal as a topper instead of standalone. Is quite a bit thicker that most gels I’ve used but I could’ve just gotten an old bottle or something. Was still very useable.

title: too scented
text:
I have very sensitive facial skin and cannot tolerate perfumed face products. This cream has a scent to it and made my face itch. I will use it as general moisturizer--just not on my face.
It is fairly thin cream and spreads easily. At first I thought it was leaving a greasy trail but this disappeared as the cream was absorbed. A bit pricey for the amount you get.

title: For cosplay
text:
If you are into cosplay or just historical costumes, then this wig is a lot of fun. It comes with a necklace, earrings and a set of buck teeth. I ditched the teeth. Easy to wear wig which comes with a nice stretchy adjustable cap and a hair net to keep your own locks locked down. It's a fun, creative wig and I hope to see a lot of other styles in the future.
The hair itself it auburn. Not too fake looking. The hair line is a bit of a struggle but I got it right .

title: way too strong
text:
I tried the Lavanda. It is way too strong. It's suggested to spray it on clothes, on the body and perhaps even in air.
The spray is ejected in a tiny amount. I thought to myself it was too tiny an amount until I smelt it. It has all the good labels, no cruelty to animals, gluten free (I did pan on eating it!), etc etc. With just a small amount on my wrist, the smell was overpowering. I thought it might wear off but I ended up washing it off. It was just too strong. Smelled chemically to me--not a bit like flowers. Can't imagine putting this on a baby or baby clothing.

title: A lovely gift set
text:
This would make a lovely gift set for all those people you don't know 'that ' well. But since the 3 enclosed bath bombs spell MOM, then the box is limited... The gift box wrapping is lovely. Take off the mocha silk ribbon which matches well with the paper, and underneath is a plain cardboard box.
I love these combo boxes: inside: 3 bath bombs which are very lightly scented, a box of dried rose petals (yeah potpourri bags) and an adorable, square bar of soap. I put the soap in my shower near the shower head as the water drips release some of the scent over time as the soap melts.
Anyway, a very nice, gentle set. I wish the bombs didn't spell MOM as then this would be very giftable to something other than MOM.

title: For kids
text:
This is a fun little set geared towards little girls. It has the nail spacer included in a lovely glittery purple. The nail polish tends towards the clumpy so I added some thinner. I don't expect perfection anyway with nail polish for kids as the little girl in question doesn't sit still long enough for it to dry properly anyway. But thicker polish is destined to be a problem. So thinner is great.
The colours are perfect for a little girl and she was thrilled with this set. Teens... may require something a bit more sophisticated.

title: A bit big
text:
I have a number of pink ombre wigs. This one is Ok but not my favourite. The top section is mostly dark but it looks more chocolate brown than black (I like black). I like the length of this. The pink sections are very nice and I like the chade of pink. Not salmon but not dusty pink either. The hair has a nice wave to it--nothing too extreme. It's soft but doesn't have that static thing that some wigs have that causes the hair to stick to your arms. '
The mocha coloured lace cap is nice and stretchy but it is a tad big for my head. It does have adjustable straps inside. The biggest issue I had with this is the shape of the head section. It's rather dome shaped. I think the cap is overly wide.

title: Very pretty
text:
Whoever designed these hair clips knows that little girls LOVE unicorns. The sequins on one clip project a gold-fuchsia vibe while the other is magenta, gold and blue.
The wings and star are glued on and I can see these coming off in time but hey I've got a glue gun. The front of strong clips (the bit you see) are covered in the dusky pink grosgrain ribbon, and the endings look neat and tidy. These are a big hit with a 6 year old

title: really pretty
text:
One of the headbands was aurora borealis and the other was black. The aurora borealis is beautiful and all the rhinestones catch and reflect the light so there's a huge WOW factor. At first glance, the black one seemed a disappointment in comparison but once under the light, the silver tone sets off the black rhinestones well. It's more subtle and not as WOW as the other headband but it's also very pretty.
The headbands have lots of flex and are very comfortable to wear. The inside of the band is a soft black velvet which is pleasant to the touch. Well sewn. No loose ends

title: I love this wig
text: This is a super wig and I'm very happy with it. The stretchy lace cap inside is a sort of cafe-au lait colour which matches the wig. The wig looks a slightly different colour than it does on MY screen but that can't be helped at times. IMO the green is prettier. In person it looks like a pale Jade. Plus the colour is not uniform as there are lighter hairs too so the overall effect is FAB. The bangs are great. Had to trim just a bit (as expected) and they help with the hairline.

title: Ever wanted to know what you will look like with grey hair?
text:
The colour of this wig is very attractive. It's a beautiful silver but there's black subtly peppered in here too. It's not that obvious at all until you get up close.
The hair is on the shiny side, but IMO that goes with the grey.
The tresses are loosely curled and the side area of the hair is cut much shorter--below my ears so this could do with some styling.
The biggest issue is the hairline. I can see the cap and the very center part of the hairline cap does not want to sit flat. So it needs work.
Very attractive overall--I'm going to have to work on the hairline....

title: 3-1. Love the purple
text:
Of the three wigs here, the purple is the best. I would give that wig 5 stars. The colour is fantastic; it's not the same purple all over; it's got different shades and the hairline is fantastic.
The black wig is bad. I'd give that 2 stars. It's super shiny but the worst thing is that there is NO way I can hide my hairline unless I pull the wig farther down on my forehead. It's also not cut that well, but that's possible to fix. The hairline issue is not fixable.
The grey wig---I love that one too. My second favourite. It's got those great dark roots. It is very long so tangling may be an issue depending on use. But it looks great, fits well etc. So.. 2 out of 3 ain't bad.
Overall a great deal as long as I accept that one wig is fairly useless for me.

title: Great colours
text:
The best thing about this wig is the colours: fantastic fantasy cosplay colours: it's just beautiful. The 'hair' is soft and not too shiny. Too shiny would really spoil this IMO.
The hair is REALLY full, so it's going to either look The Shining scary, or else, you are going to need a crown or something to keep the hair off your face. You can also style it off your face too.
The hair is cut in a long shag style, with some bits in the back much shorter. This gives it the full look. The hairline section is the wig's weak point and it looks fake--well it looks fake anyway with the colours, but it's hard to make the wig look GOOD. Again back to styling, crown, or some type of headband to smooth over the hairline section.

title: Ok for costuming, teens etc
text:
My head measures about 22 1/2 around. On me the wig seemed to be on the small side. The hair is obviously fake as it is meant to be so so problem there, and it's a nice quality nylon or nylon type material. I love the colours.
It comes with a hair net, 2 wig caps, a pearl-type clip and a pair of druzy post earrings. The latter were a surprise and a pleasant one.
I had a hard time getting the wig to cover the very front section of my hair. I think anyone who has masses of hair, or really long hair may find this wig doesn't cover easily.
The hair hangs awkwardly. It falls forward into the face. I trimmed it a bit.
IMO this is a great wig for costuming and/or teens, but those with masses of long hair may find it problematic.

title: Sold!
text:
I just recently started using purple shampoo. I have grey hair, btw. I liked the results I had with another brand so was eager to try this brand. First, at least at the time of this review, the price is decent.
The purple shampoo is a deep violet. I applied it to my wet hair and worked it in. Loved the purple lather. Then applied the conditioner which is more of a deep inky blue. The instructions said to leave it in for a few minutes. When I wash it out, my hair feels differently--it feels as though there's still something there on my hair, but deeply mixed in. It feels differently than when I use regular shampoo.
Anyway, I love what this does for my hair. It seems to brighten the light silver and darken the darker grey. At least that's what it seems like. No frizzies either and that's important for me.
I used Great Clips brand before trying this, and while I really liked what Great Clips Purple shampoo did for my hair, I prefer this brand. Anyway, I'm sold. I like the tones and depths the purple shampoo gives my hair.

title: Quite surprisng
text:
This is a very pale mud mask. It spreads really easily. It's not as 'mud' looking as most of the other ones I've tried. Makes you look like a ghost appearance wise or someone who is very pale.
I left this one for about an hr. It never cracked, but it was there as a very light mask. Easy to wash off. My skin felt very soft afterwards. I was surprised really as I had left it on for so long I'd almost forgotten about it.
I feel that the mud mask did have a restorative effect to my skin. It also has a very subtle (and I mean subtle) flower scent. I liked the scent but was happy that it wasn't too strong as I have extremely sensitive facial skin and perfumed skin products make me itch.
My skin still feels softer 24 hrs later.

title: More vanilla than musk
text:
I liked this shower wash. The liquid is thick and feels rich. It produces a heavy lather. I like both musk and vanilla and found this to be a pleasant blend with its emphasis on vanilla.
I had no issues with my skin using this.

title: Well this is fun
text:
I wasn't sure what to expect from this product, but it is really fun. Who thought that pink eyelashes would look great?
I am not a make up expert and I don't think I am that good at it either, so I have no problem admitting that MY end result did not look like the pictures. And I will also admit that this may be my fault.
The pictures show eyelashes that look solidly pink (or whatever colour you buy); mine did not come out like that. The brush tends to carry a lot of mascara so I got some clumping.
My eyelashes, which are black, ended up pinkish over the black near the base but with pink tips and I actually think it looks better than the professional pics. The only way I could get solid pink eyelashes ended up with too much clumping. So it was possible to get solid pink eyelashes and I did, but then I had to gently wipe off all the excess mascara and that left me with pink tips.
Honestly, I liked it that way, I think it looks more subtle and not so obvious. The pink mascara goes great with mauve or nude eyeshadow IMO.
This needed a couple of minutes to dry but after that it didn't smudge. And it really does lengthen and thicken lashes. I'm happy with the look and like it more than the professional photos on site.

title: Oily
text:
If you look at the ingredients listed, there are a lot of oils: coconut oil, Jojoba oil, Clary Sage essential oil, organic Ylang Ylang essential oil, neroli essential oil, geranium essenatil oil, sunflower seed oil, lavender oil, rose absolute, Jasmine absolute and a vitamin E oil blend. I think I got them all.
The name of this item says 'cream.' It is an oil. It is far too greasy for my face. I used it on my arms and legs and liked it but as you can expect, it leaves an oily shine. It had a woodsy type scent not too strong. If you are expecting 'cream' this is not it. Oil, yes.

title: not that strong
text: This is a fairly weak retinol formula. I have several on my shelf and I can tell from using them which ones are stronger. This isn't the worst I have tried but I would place it in the middle range. It's rather expensive for what you get. It's also quite thin and runny.

title: Moisturizes nicely
text:
This cream is very moisturizing. It feels a bit decadent to be honest. It's a light green and not quite as cucumber-y as I would like. The cucumber smell is there but it's more delicate than another cucumber cream I have on hand.
It's silky smooth, goes on easily and is very quickly absorbed. It is pricey, but it makes my skin feel soft and supple.
It's especially good on some tough spots--neck and elbows.

title: Great box
text: The box is the best thing here. I had high hopes for the mascara. It's string, so it doesn't go on easily. It clumps. And I also found it very difficult to remove, Of course it is waterproof and that feature works. It took many swipes with oil to start to break this up and off the lashes.

title: fairly gentle
text: I have very sensitive facial skin so I have to be careful with any products. This did not irritate my skin. I would say that it is a very mild facial scrub. It didn't take much to use on my face, but it didn't feel as though it did a while lot either. Pleasant enough but I wouldn't be tempted to buy it.

title: I love the purple
text:
This great set is a larger square and two small circles. The material is so soft, you want to rub your face all over it. Each piece comes with a handle for easy storage/drying. Instructions say these can be machine washed and dried but I hand washed mine and they came out just as lovely as before.
The seams are very well sewn with some type of lightly corded material.
Very nice indeed. The colour is purple but it's a heliotrope purple. Quite beautiful.

title: A new experience
text:
I've never quite tried anything like this. The cleanser is a light green gel--almost slime but not slimy. Instructions say to apply with wet fingers.
At first I used too much as the cleaner went far further than I expected. It has a wonderful light fruit smell and smears easily over the face. I have very sensitive facial skin and this cleaner did not present any problems. It was easy to wash off. My skin felt nice afterwards--not dry at all.

title: Good clay mask
text:
I liked this clay mask a lot. The mask cream is very thick indeed, and it takes a squeeze to get it out of the tube. It goes a long way, but at the same time, this is a small tube (3 oz). It dries quickly. And it's the type of mask that makes your face feel TIGHT. The type where you can't smile.
After about 20 mins, I washed this off. It was easy to remove. After using a few times, I think it does indeed have a brightening effect on the skin. It doesn't moisturize. At least it didn't for me, and I had to lather on cream afterwards as my skin felt a bit dry after the mask.
Overall I liked this. I like how it worked but it is on the pricey side.

title: Nifty idea but I'd worry about it holding mask in place
text:
What's that saying about necessity being the mother of invention? Well here we are in a pandemic wearing face masks. Someone came up with the idea of a head band with buttons to hold the mask mask in place.

This is a thin material. Think very thin t shirt type material. The headband measures about 18 inches and just over 3 inches wide. I like the material for a headband. However, its use as a mask holder is iffy. Many people complain that the elastic that holds the masks in place makes their ears pop out. That is definitely true of some masks. They can also be wearying on the ears, having that elastic against your ears all day, so this headband is a great concept.
I put the headband on and as I stretched it over my head, I heard a pop, so some stitching gave somewhere.

I attached two types of masks, one at a time. First, it was a bit fiddly to get the elastic over the button. Once it just sprang off.

One mask using the buttons fit well. Another did not. The latter mask opened up on the sides.

I would hesitate to wear this out thinking that everything would stay put for hours. I like the headband as a headband. It's nice material. A sort of light grey merle, but if you are looking at this for long-term safety, I would say no.

title: Smells Great
text: i received my Baja Baby Lavender Shampoo and decided to use it and liked how it smelled for one thing, I used it at night on my friends child. He is very sensitive to soaps but this one was very mild and the smell wasn't over powering. It helped his eczema he has I noticed that his legs were not red like they normally are after a bath. title: Great for almost everything, except ears
text:
The cotton on these swabs is layered thinner and firmer than other cotton swabs I've tried. This makes them less than ideal for cleaning delicate parts of the human body, like ears.

However, they are excellent for everything else. If you're doing detail cleaning, these swabs are a total bargain. If you need cotton swabs for a high heat situation (where plastic just won't do), these are more than adequate. If you want cheap swabs for children's arts and crafts, stop looking now.

When it comes to cleaning out my ears, I'll stick to the name brand that I've known and trusted my whole life. But for every other situation I need cotton swabs in, from here on out, I'll be saving some money by using these bargain swabs.

text: I bought this eau de toilette on the Yves Rocher website, where it is considerably cheaper (and currently on sale).  I am only reviewing it on Amazon because, for whatever reason, the company will not let me review it on its own site.  Muguet on Fleurs is the second lily of the valley eau de toilette in my collection, the first being Yardley's classic Lily of the Valley.  In contrast to Yardley's, which is multi-faceted and "Victorian," Yves Rocher's is natural and pure, as well as dewy, "green," indefinably French; for me one sniff evokes lilies of the valley growing right outside a French cafe.  Highly recommended.

I went to the Merz Apothecary in Chicago, one of the physical locations that is the same company as Smallflower (who sells this product here on Amazon), and after reviewing many terrific options with a helpful staff, I chose Bowmakers. There is something really special about it and, frankly, it seems to me to make everything else smell special and good, even baser smells in the environment. Doesn't just cover them up, seems to transform them. Seems to work really well with my body chemistry also, as far as I can tell. text:
I hope this gets to the right person who in charge of answering questions.
I've used this before and hopefully it's doing a good job. I just purchased more of the product for Fiber Water Beds from Amazon.com.

My question is the DIRECTIONS DO NOT INCLUDE WHAT SIZE WATERBED THE PRODUCT IS BEING USED IN. HOW MUCH TO USE FOR A KING SIZE BED VS. A SINGLE BED?

The Blue Sapphire liquid comes in 4 oz and 8 oz bottles. and my OLDER bottle says Multi purpose Plus and it's not on the NEW bottle. Also my older bottle says "fulll motion and fiber-fill" and the new bottle says time released water bed protection. The NEW one ,from Amazon also has a serial number on it and the old does not.
PG01127006 is the number on the new bottle and says Wasserbett Conditioner and states for Fiberbeds to repeat application every 4 to 6 months .

My older bottle, which I purchased at a waterbed store(which is now closed and there are none near me0, says REVITALISANT Pour lit D'eau and says repeat application every 8 to 12 months.
This is quite confusing and I would like you as the manufacturer to CLEARIFY THE INFORMATION.

title: Terrible compared to Phillips blades on my course beard.
text: I ordered these to replace the original blades from my 300 series.  The reviews were good so I thought I'd save some money.  Admittedly I have tough, course beard hair, but these were worse than the 18 month old, dull originals I was replacing.  I tried all kinds of ways to get them to shave well (light pressure, hard pressure, quick circles, slow lines, etc).  Shaving took more than twice as long and still left behind stray whiskers.  The shave was also not as close as before. I oiled them regularly and followed the instructions.  After about a week of daily use I gave up and just ordered new Phillips blades.  When the new Phillips blades arrived the difference was palpable.  Total shave time dropped to about 60-90 seconds with new Phillips blades.  It had been 3-4 min with the dull Phillips blades and 6-7 minutes with theses Corablades.

title: Best. Lotion. Ever.
text: I love this lotion! I ordered the salve 2 years ago when I had contact dermatitis on my hand from using a very strong cleaning spray. Nothing helped the dermatitis until I tried the salve and it cleared it up in less than 24 hours! 2 months ago I had a bad case of cellulitis on my chest was put on 3 different types of VERY STRONG antibiotics-they didn't work! I thought of the Fay Farm salve and remembered they also had a lotion and ordered it. Within DAYS the cellulitis started to ckear up. I had even had a skin biopsy taken, 3 doctors were concerned it was cancer when they 3 antibiotics did nothing. This lotion is PURE GOLD... After moving to a northern state this summer my hands are so dry and cracked my fingertips were cracking open by my nails--so painful! I'm now slathering this lotion on my hands. And I also had a head cold a couple weeks ago--my nose was so red I started putting the lotion on my nose at night before I got in bed--and my nose didn't peel! My husband isn't crazy about the smell if the lotion but I LOVE it!  When I ordered the lotion I also ordered another tin of the salve--also amazing stuff!

title: Smell and look wonderful!
text:
[[VIDEOID:e3d6cd6f62a78b875093488eace2bb]] These smell and look wonderful! The packaging is beautiful and I can not wait to treat myself to a relaxing bath with these!

12/29/16 Update:

So I've had time to use a fair number of these bath bombs since receiving them. My only real complaint is that they don't really fizz or bubble to the extent that many other bath bombs do, but I was prepared for that when I placed my order because I had read quite a few reviews on these already.

The scent is sort of hit or miss depending on which bomb you're using. Overall they could all stand to be a bit stronger than they are.

The saving grace for this product is that they make my skin feel super soft! Which I love.

The botanical pieces don't really bother me the way it seems to bother a lot of other people apparently. Yes, if you purchase these your bathtub may require a bit of cleanup if the pieces don't wash completely down the drain after your bath. Be prepared. This is a natural product, so you're going to get bits and pieces of the plants that were used in their creation. I personally enjoy that.

Would I purchase these again? Meh. I like the way that they make my skin feel, but I will probably look at other options in the future.

title: Organic Tamanu Oil
text: This is an interesting oil....I never knew anything about it, so when I had a chance to  receive this product at discount  for my opinion/review I had to try it.  It does have a interesting smell, reminds me of ginseng, almost an earthy smell.  The oil is also black/gray in color. The bottle has a pump which is great for distribution.  I've been mixing it with other oils and using it for sore muscles.  Tamanu oil has lots of different properties, it can be used as a natural treatments for acne and acne scars, eczema, psoriasis, toenail fungus, stretch marks, age spots, skin rashes, general scarring, dermatitis and many more.  Very interesting if you get a chance to research it.  I think it is a great product, plus it is USDA & ECO Certified Organic and 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE....so you can't go wrong with this product!

title: I really want this bag to work!
text: I purchased this bag to keep my art journaling supplies together and handy (pens, markers, scissors, washi tape, journals, watercolors, etc.) when we travel. It is the perfect size and interior layout for this purpose, and it is a very nice looking bag, too. It is described as being made of ‘PU leather’ and did not investigate any further.  But when I opened the package, I was surprised by the shiny soft and slick surface, and it has me a bit concerned. Normal cowhide leather will naturally scuff over time, especially with travel and frequent use, but I am not sure yet whether this material will scratch or perhaps even tear after a while, or worse: start to get that sticky feel to it as the material’s composition breaks down. It feels more like soft plastic than leather, and it does not smell bad. Overall I am pleased with the design and features of this bag and plan to keep it. I will update my review again after a few months of use.

text: I love CK Free. It just smells so fresh and clean, and it's never overwhelming or cloying.  If you're like me and you prefer to smell fresh rather than musky, this is a great cologne for you.  If you want something that people will notice immediately upon entering the room, though, it may not be the best option for you.  It can be a little subtle, so you won't get a ton of attention for wearing it. That being said, people who do notice it will almost universally like it.  Of course, with any scent, you should probably smell it before buying, but this is one I can honestly say just about any guy will not hate. Not every guy will love it, nor will every woman, but I can't imagine disliking this scent.  I think it smells like a waterfall looks like, if that makes any sense.

text: I am so glad I tried the GLO BRILLIANT WHITE SMILE Home teeth whitening device set.  At first I thought I was not going to be able to sit there for 3 consecutive sessions of 8 minutes but once I started, and I did it while working so time just went by go quickly, I got used to the mouth piece.  It is very easy to use, press it once so it starts to warm up the mouth piece while you apply the lip balm and gel on your teeth.  When ready press button again to start your 8 minute session.  I did this for 5 days straight and cannot believe how much it whitened my teeth.  I did not experience and discomfort or pain and I’m very happy with my results.  I will continue with the monthly touch up like the product suggests and definitely recommend for anyone looking for a product that works at whitening your teeth.

title: Lightly Cucumber Scented and Easy on the Skin
text:
It's rare to find a skin product that doesn't irritate me one way or another, which often leads to me having dry skin because of my reluctance to use lotion, but this product has changed that.

One of the most pleasant things about this lotion is its fresh cucumber scent; I'm not sure why this isn't clearly indicated on the package, but it's delightful!

This lotion goes on smooth, and it's not sticky or clumpy at all. It dries within just a few minutes. It's a great help in keeping my legs happy when shaving daily during the summer, and the scent is summery too!

I like their lip balm a bit, but it's the body lotion and shaving cream that I can't get through summer without. I love it!

title: I have fine hair but a lot of it
text:
I’ve had numerous extensions in my life. I bought these as a cheaper alternative to the Bellami volumizing weft, which is expensive (definitely an investment). I have fine hair but a lot of it. The problem I have with many extension companies is blending the extensions with my own hair, since most of them are so thin my hair peaks through. I also have shoulder length hair, which adds another level of difficulty when trying to blend extensions.

Pros
• The hair is soft
• The hair doesn’t tangle easily
• The color is nice
• The clips are amazing. Once I clip them in they stay.
• They are convenient. One weft and you’re done (usually)
• They are cheap, and a good quality for the price
• Good starting off extensions

Cons
• The hair is thin; it is heavier on top and thins out to a v-point. As expected my hair peaked though. I ended up tying up my bottom layer and putting the extensions on top. It solved the problem of the hair poking though.
• For these extensions to work for me I would need to buy at least two more packs of hair. Having 3, five clip wefts wouldn’t fit around my head comfortably.
• These will not give you volume; they are too thin to give you any thickness
• If you have a lot of hair these will not look very natural

This hair is best suited for someone with thin, medium length hair who is looking for some length. Also, if you have layers in your hair it could help blend the hair. I got my own hair thinned out a little at the hair salon and it made a huge difference.

This hair will not work well with short hair or thick hair unless you are willing to work hard to blend it.

I will be buying one more weft in order to see how that works out for me. I will update this post once I receive my new weft.

My experience wearing 2- five clip wefts

text: I decided I wanted to try the silicone makeup sponge everyone is raving about.  There's a bit of a learning curve. It's not as IMMEDIATELY perfect as a beautyblender. I suggest you tap to blend it in,  spreading it on makes it look blotchy.  It definitely takes less foundation.  Maybe two drops perhalf of the face.  Now,  I wish it was thinner so it is easier to blend in the corner of the nose.  Over all,  I am happy.  Saves on foundation and no more messy old make up sponges. I honestly think those old ones hold a lot germs and they can get hard quickly from letting foundation sit on them without washing out after each use and even when you do wash them,  it never seems to completely get it all out.  With the silicone makeup sponge it is so easy to wash.  I do recommend this one :)

title: High Quality
text:
I am using a micro needle roller at .25mm on my scalp for hair growth, or at least hopeful hair growth.

This roller has fewer needles than my other, so I decided to increase the number of stroke repetitions to account for the reduced number of needles, no big deal.

First thing I noticed. The packaging is nice and sterile.

Next, the little cup for the alcohol when sterilizing is really a nice touch.

The quality of the handle is better than anything else I've tried. I think it's some sort of metal. It feels really good in my hand not having plastic.

When using it, it rolls controllably. Very nice feeling of control.

The micro needles seem to be the same length as my other .25mm, so that's accurate.

Overall, this is a high quality product. I like it better than my higher needle count head because the handle is nicer.

I'll see if I actually grow any hair, but the product seems really good, I'd recommend it.

I hope you found this review helpful.

The colors of the bunnies are true to the product pictures so I disagree the green one could classify as mint. It's really more of a dark teal, but I still it.

This set comes with four makeup sponges. I don't often use those so I'm no expert but these seem a little cheap to me as they came with some dents in them. title: Neat concept, could be executed better
text:
I really like the idea of a portable water pik. When I travel I have to pack up my standard water flosser and it's kinda bulky and doesn't travel well. So having a single integrated unit is appealing.

However, the implementation is a bit weak. For starters the tank is either glued or heat welded along its entire perimeter and it will, I'm sure, be a weak spot that eventually leaks. As you use it, since it's all one piece, it's really hard to hold on to and the water runs directly down from my mouth on to the unit, making it even more slippery. Maybe the pik head should be angled to allow for the water not to run down on it.

If you're someone who travels a lot and you need to have a water flosser with you I think this is worth a try. With some practice it might become less awkward to use over time.

title: Very happy with this razor
text:
I am very impressed with this razor. I have used electric razors most of my 35+ years of shaving. I was skeptical using it for the first time, I thought it wasn't working because it is so soft to the face and so quiet. It didn't sound "agressive" like my other razors did. WRONG!!! The shave was close, my skin was not irritated at all, and it cut smooth basically in the first pass. This unit is first class.

My previous razor was a Braun foil. I bought one for myself and another for my son from Frys because of the price. JUNK!!! We both have heavy beards, he more so than I, and both of us had terrible 5 o'clock shadows by 10:00AM! And the skin irritation on my neck, just horrible.

I took a long time comparing all the available models. For me this model provides the best mix of features and price. I definitely recommend the Speed-XL shaving heads. Other nice features are it can be cleaned under the faucet, it charges quickly and maintains that charge for a long time, and it provides what I consider one of the best shaves I've had in a long time. The heft and feel is good. Materials are good. Workmanship is good. The only feature I'd like to have is a battery charge indicator.

The other Speed-XL model is the 8160. It includes the cleaning system with a much higher price. Now there is the SmartTouch-XL which may be overkill. But if price is not an issue...

May, 2012 - I can't believe I wrote the original review almost seven years ago. I'm still using this razor and it still works just as I expressed back then. The battery still keeps a great charge, and the shave is still excellant. I went on a 10 day vacation last year and the charge held for the whole trip. This is truly a great product.

title: Really nice spray bottle
text: Really nice spray bottle. I have three of these and I keep alcohol in them for sanitizing. The trigger sprayer is easy on my hand the size is great and I am going to make a label one day if it kills me with my old LabelMaker that says alcohol. I use isopropyl alcohol for everything. Before Covid when my husband will go to sleep I would spray the whole floor the door knobs, and the chairs. I didn’t want him to get sick. And he didn’t and neither did I. I think preventative spraying with alcohol is a good way to not get sick. If you have a nice spray bottle you can spray the floor in the bathroom, the kitchen floor, the door knobs, and you can wash the surface with a glass covering like my kitchen table. It’s hard to find a good spray bottle and these work well plus they’re very very pretty. They’re a blue green. Very cheery and well-made. If you get about 3 You will always know alcohol and you won’t even have to label them. You can have them in different parts of your house. That will be your visual go to alcohol station. I color coordinate everything. I read books on neuroscience and the more organized you are the less your brain stresses. So when I see green I know it’s a big fat spray bottle with alcohol. I buy alcohol by the gallon and just fill them. Hope this helps somebody

title: 💕💃Retire that old blow dryer and brush💕
text:
WOW!! When I first recieved this I was really intimidated. Its HUGE! I was worried about even being able to use it. But I'm always up for a challenge.
First let me say I have fine but thick hair and shoulder length. Normally I use a blow dryer and a circular brush to give myself some volume.
This unit comes with 2 brushes, one for shorter hair,one for longer. The brushes have nice soft bristles that won't rip at your hair. So if you do get a tangle it slides right out. I used the shorter brush myself.
At first it was difficult for me to use because of a bad shoulder. The size was an issue for me. But with a little practice I got the hang of it. Realizing that it actually takes the place of 2 tools. The blow dryer and circular brush all in one ( still old school I guess 🙃) And in the long run I found it easier on my bad shoulder because I had to use only one tool instead of two! 💃
I also takes some real practice to use the rolling feature. If there was anything I would change, that would be it. There is one for this. And it's very easy to accidentally go the wrong way (😜 believe me not a good look)
Once I figured out to just roll it enough to get the hair on and let go of the button, hold it for a moment while the dryer works then pull it through. And WOW it gives you such volume that lasts all day. Leaves your soft and silky too. I'm so impressed!
I immediately made the room for this new tool in my bathroom.
I would highly recommend it. It's a little intimidating.. So worth the challenge tho!
I stepped out of my comfort zone and tried it... You should too! Sometimes new products are a real improvement on the old standbys.👍

If you found this review helpful could you please pop 👆 the button below👇
Happy Shopping😊

title: This is a complete Manicure Kit
text:
This electric manicure kit has everything you need to use for artificial nails 💅. Well except for the products. The drill is strong and you get a total of 11 bits with it. Be mindful that it is elecric and the switch is on the cord, not the drill itself. Which makes it a little difficult to use. I feel this drill set is not for beginners. You need to have the knowledge on how to use it. In picture #2 I have displayed the instructions that were included. Just one small page and not informative at all.
This is a nice package if your already comfortable with applying artificial nails.
But not for beginners.

title: Removes blush
text: Works.

title: Doesn't feel like metal. Doesn't match curve on body of camera.
text:
I'm disappointed in this product.

It doesn't feel like metal. It feels like plastic.

The curve does not match the curvature of the RX100. There's a very slight gap between body and handgrip. I will admit it is possible that I didn't position it precisely, though I made a great effort to do so.

I would have preferred a deeper inset, but that's a stylistic thing.

The part on the fron of the camera doesn't run all the way to the lens mount. That leaves a gap between the edge of the handgrip and the lens mount that feels odd to my fingertips when holding the camera.

I really don't care for the surprise bonus: the name and model number of the item are printed on the front of the handgrip. That ugly surprise is nowhere to be seen on the nine photos of the product on the Amazon sales page. There is absolutely no practical reason for this to be there.

I'm going to try to return. The cheaper plastic version is superior.

Jerry

I will never put anything else on my hair but Jane's cream, ever. No stickiness, no strong smell, no greasy residue, no dryness. I love it.

title: My Skincare regime goes a little like: cleanser
text:
My Skincare regime goes a little like: cleanser, thayers witch hazel rose toner, the ordinary caffeine solution, the ordinary niacinamide (this product), and then I wrap it up with a heavy moisturizer (dry skin).

I love this product. I've seen such an improvement with texture and color related to my skin. I used to have a lot of redness around my nose and my general t-zone area, just where my skins seemed to always be more "flush", and after 3 or 4 weeks of consistent use, I'm amazed at the difference. I never really though my skin was bad, but after seeing the complexion even everywhere -- I can't go back! If you have issues with discoloration, this probably could help a lot.

The quality is not great, and this company makes a beautiful set of six with much better materials and gold accenting for two dollars more...spend the money on the other set.  The airless pump will keep ingredients from oxidizing too quickly.  Not a bad set, but since I've used the other one...I'm spoiled, so this one is just okay.

text: These pumps are good quality, solid construction meant for larger bottles to pay attention to the type of bottle it fits or you will be unhappy. That being said, $5 each for a glass spray pump bottle is pricey...they back it up with quality, but if your buying 4 of them I think the price should be lower.

What’s really nice about them is they make a nice gift for a guy and a lot of these types of holders are way too feminine to give to a guy as a gift. Any patriot would certainly love it.  The price? I found it to be fair for the novelty that it is.

title: Nice quality but overpriced

They are perfect if you want to make your own natural cleaning supplies, and the dark amber color will protect your essential oil’s, but I feel that the price is way out of line. I’m not debating the quality, the quality is there. The price… Not.

title: The Covid answer to post gym workouts!
text: The Covid answer to post gym workouts!  If I were a gym owner,  I would keep these well in stock! This is a nice big cloth, used to clean up after a workout. It is not dripping wet but it is adequately moist. There is a slight clean scent to it, but nothing perfumy or anything that would fight with a perfume. It did a nice job, however other than doing may be under arms face and chest one of these towels would not be enough if you really wanted to clean yourself up.  These would also be great during camping trips. Or even long car trips when you like to refresh. For what it is, I don’t think the price is unreasonable. If I were a gym owner I would give each patron two of these towels when they arrived. I thought the product was good, the towel was really soft and enjoyable to use.  The towel itself is also as strong as it is soft. I will make sure to have a couple of these in my purse at all times.

title: Love this oil!

title: Not great for exfoliating, but a pleasant experience
text: Not great for exfoliating, but a pleasant experience.  All the salt in this product is less than I would’ve expected and very fine grained so the exfoliation experience isn’t what I expected. What I did like about it was it was not as oily as many of the products that I’ve had in the past. It did leave my skin feeling soft and refreshed. And I do think the price is very reasonable for the quality of the ingredients that are in it. I took one star off for the misrepresentation of the exfoliation product.

title: One of my favorites!
text: This is not sweet and cloying. It is high and bright, slightly citrus-y, but with the lightness of florals like jasmine or rose. It's airy and sun-shiny. I apply it such that a little is on my skin and some is on my clothes. Fairly decent lasting, without knocking you out.

title: Awesome hairdryer just like the hairdressers
text: This hair dryer is the BOMB! It blows air without a lot of noise but it blows hard!. If you are looking to add volume this is the one you want. It is just like the one the hairdressers use. The attachments stay put and don't fall off at the slightest bump. It is top heavy so you have to get used to the weight but this is a quality product.

title: My go-to dye now
text: This dye has great lasting power. I like how the pigment is rich enough to where I can mix it with white conditioner to get a great pastel tone. If you're going to mix it like this, remember to measure how much of each you're using lest you not to be able to recreate the proper percentages to get the same results. Been there, done that. ;) As always, definitely test your mixture out on a piece of hair to make sure you like the results so you're not stuck with a head full of results you don't like!

title: The Light Brown is too orange!
text: Very little product carries through to the bristles for application. It dries too fast so it's very difficult to apply. But once it is applied, my brows look orange. I'm a natural strawberry blonde so I figured the reddish tone would work on me.. but NOT! It's wayyy too orange and makes my brows look fake. I do not recommend this product for blondes.

title: Use ahand towel you get better results
text: Was not happy with this product.  It's stiff and does not follow the contour of your back.  One side, the non-abrasive side suds up like crazy, but doesn't exfoliate well.  The textured side doesn't sud up well and is stiff.
